text:
FANTASTIC!!!!
These guys know the basics about customer service infused with super-flavorful thai food. We've been coming here for a year (about 8 times). Friendly, fast, clean and fresh tasting thai food. I'd give it 10 stars if I could. Not in a fancy big box stand alone building but clean and worth the visit. You won't go wrong I promise. Try the Pad Thai, Deep Fried Tofu and 'F5" Spicy Thai Basil. Fresh and mouthwatering. Oh and the price ... very affordable. ENJOY this GEM!!!!
really good thai food..big serving and the best part is the service very nice and attentive waiters..will be coming back for sure

We typically stay within the strip area when we visit Las Vegas. This time we decided to expand our horizon and see and experience other parts of Vegas. After reading so many positive reviews, we decided to try Weera Thai one day. 

Food at this place is better than any Thai restaurants that I have ever tried. Mind you, living in LA and being an avid fan of Thai food, I have dined at a substantial number of Thai restaurants. 

We went there for lunch and the restaurant was pretty busy. There were two female servers and they both were very nice and friendly. We typically don't see such friendly and attentive service in LA area. The lunch specials are simply great deals with salad, soup and entrée - all with very good quantity. 

The food and service was so good that we ended up going there the second day as well. Anytime we visit Vegas again, we will come here to dine.

This place is not a 4 star Thai place. Service was good but food was horrible. Stayed on the strip and wanted Thai so came out here but was not impressed by the food at all. Had padthai and penang curry

Located in an older strip mall, next to my family's favorite restaurant (Island Style), this place is a swan-- meaning you would never know how beautiful and elegantly casual it is in on the inside from the older, not-so-great strip mall exterior.  The service has always been average, but the food is worth the wait.  Their curries are delicious, and my husband is a big fan of their pad thai and thinks it's about the best in town.  They have a lunch special which is out of this world-- about 15 things to choose from, served with soup and an eggroll for about $10.  It's well worth it.  You will leave stuffed if not with a to-go box.  The food is outstanding!  It's a must-try.

Big fan of Archi's now for the past few years. Tried this place on a Groupon deal. Pleasantly surprised. Excellent Pad Thai and Papaya salad. Less greasy than Archi's. I am wondering if I will go back to Archi's. Fabulous service as well.

I hate giving places poor ratings.. In fact, this is the first bad rating I've ever given. For the record, the food is great. The complaint comes from the fact that I have received deliveries that were wrong on several occasions.  I'm not one to complain, so I let the first couple go, but  the last time I called them to let them know, and they offered to give me a credit for the same order in the future--perfect. Except, the next time I called, they had no recollection of such a guarantee. I was told by the manager that nothing could be done, so I asked to speak to the owner. I was then told that they are never in the restaurant, and was given an email to contact them; but, the email address didn't work. So, without much other recourse, I'm wallowing in the muck of Yelp reviews. Like I said, the food is great, but the service can be iffy.

I have had Weera for lunch on several occasions. They have yet to disappoint. They have an excellent lunch special. 8 bucks will get you a dish, jasmine rice, egg roll and a salad. I recommend the garlic pepper chicken or the pad Thai.

The food here is great! Almost everything I order here I enjoyed very much. From the sausage, larb fish, beef broccoli(ka na moo gob)larb beef and tom yum. But the service here is average.. We use to love coming here with the family cause the gentleman that owns this place is very nice. He would alwayse ask us about the food, if we enjoyed it or not. But the wife on the other hand would never smile at us alwayse seems like she did not appreciate our business, maybe because we were thai lolz and probably think we don't tip well "WRONG". . Anywayse,if you like good food , veera thai is a good choice.

WOW   best Thai food in vegas. I live here for 40 years and this restaurant is the one. I heard this is the place where Vegas thai chefs hang out.  Sea Bass dish is out of this world. Glass noodles salad is to die for. NO MSG thank you. NO dirty bent aluminum fire pot YESSS.
1000 percents improvement since opening. Congret Peter .....I like to see Jamine rice if possible
Nice decor, friendly staff. Very large menu. Full bar. Recommend the crispy duck panang curry. Lots of crispy duck! My friend ordered the panang curry with chicken. Oodles of chicken in his order.

Best Thai food in Vegas, we always come and get the same thing. Not too adventurous, but it's not a bad thing, everything we get has so much flavor and just perfect. For an appetizer we get the Tom Kah Kai soup with chicken (a medium heat). For the main entrees we do the pineapple fried rice is absolutely spectacular, my favorite thing here personally) also one of the best Panang curries in Vegas for sure. Then on to the pad Thai also just as amazing. We usually go with my entire family which is a party of 6, and if you order full entrees and feeds all of us. Staff is super friendly, just a nice place to eat for either lunch or dinner.
The food is good. They maintain a HOMELY environment. The waiters are very simple and honest. They are caring as well. The food wait time was in acceptable limit.

The food is really good here.  I can sense that the owner really cares about the quality of the food. It's the only place so far that has my favorite dessert, Sweet sticky rice with durian.  Other restaurant won't serve it bc of their infamous fragrance...oh well.  All I can say to my fellow Thai food eaters is this...PLEASE DO NOT SMELL THE FOOD, JUST PUT IT IN YOUR MOUTH AND SAVOR THE FLAVOR.  I found that sometimes food that smells good, does not necessary taste good.  In our culture, THE STINKIER, THE BETTER!!!

Quite good. I usually frequent a different Thai food restaurant and my first time here was yesterday. As I dine on leftovers, i give this place three stars in comparison to my normal. Maybe...2 months ago, I ate Thai food in Pinetop AZ...MOUNTAIN TOWN PINETOP, ARIZONA...I would give that place 3.7 stars (Not quite 4...). I expected more in comparison to what else is in close proximity to this place but I do love Thai food in all forms so it's not bad but I've had better.

I was in the mood for Thai food so I hopped on Yelp to see what was near by and found Weera Thai.  Whenever I'm looking for a new Thai restaurant I always look for Misty Y and Dan P's reviews, once I see that they give it a good rating I am ready to try it out.  

I had the Spicy Basil with Chicken lunch special, spicy level 3 out of 5 and thought it was spiced perfectly for my taste.  Usually some restaurants will either under spice or over spice when asking for a middle of the range level, but this was perfectly spicy will not making me reach for water after every bite.  The flavors on the dish were also spot on.  You dont get too much but for $6 I couldnt complain.  

I cant wait to come back and try their duck dishes.  Writing this review has me craving Thai food again! haha.

The interior is nice. The menu looks impressive.  I bought the comb on yelp 8$ for 15$.. My favorite soup is Tom yum. I ordered that but they made the soup soo sweet n its no taste sour at all. I have to ask the waitress for couple lime n mix w the soup..

I came here only for Khao Soi soup and they did not disappoint me. I was told the owner is from Chiang mai and Khao Soi is probably the most popular dish over there. I was literally transferred to the streets of CHM. The only thing what i could object is that the noodles stick together otherwise perfect.
Foods incredible! Service is super friendly and very on top of things! If you are craving Thai, this is a must!
Delicious Thai food, the restaurant is nicely decorated, service is fine. We come for the food and leave happy, great lunch specials as well!

Great service and great food! Always look forward to coming here whenever I am in Vegas.
Love the gingered seabass, a little pricey for the portion size but well worth splurging for.

Okay I've been to Thailand,  cooked Thai food 
Professionally and eaten  since 1985... This place rocks. Great Tom ka gai,  and some of the more unique Thai dishes. Very much worth it.

Top thai places to eat in town. We eat here often because it caters to the thai's and Americans. All the food here's is good and always consistent .our favorite dish is sum tum. Nobody in town makes it better.

great option for eating off-the-strip, especially since it seems there's a thai restaurant on every block around here. i used the eat24 app to place a to-go order because I wasn't sure if they delivered to the hotel or not. at any rate, we were greeted warmly as soon as we entered the restaurant - surprised at how quiet and pleasant it was inside considering its location. tastefully decorated, too. 

we ordered the chicken satay (our three-year-old's favorite), fresh spring rolls with shrimp (large portion, couldn't finish it! very fresh, nice ratio of veggies to shrimp), pad thai with tofu (medium spicy was just right; lots of tofu pieces, too), and house fried rice with chicken. it was too much food; i felt bad we couldn't eat it all. will probably order the satay, rolls, and pad thai again especially since we're in vegas for another two days. it's so nice to find places off-the-strip with great food, value, and service!
Fast delivery and tasty food! I love the chicken wings.
Honestly one of the best Thai food places I have ever ate at.   If I could give more stars I would. ..
Small cozy place. Service is decent. I come here specifically for the crispy pork with Chinese broccoli. It's heaven. I wish San Diego makes it as good as they do! I nice hidden gem of Vegas.

Nice decoration and severs so friendly. I had many thai food in Los Angeles so when i came here i didn't expect much about the taste. After i orderd some menus that was awsome Larb ped is nice and many dishes that is better than in thai town in LA. The food is too slow to serve but is worth to wait. The food too slow but dessert was slower that is dissapoint me but  I'll be back again for sure next time for nice thai food!!
I will try Thai food later because I work seven day sweets hope. I bring my family to going to weed ra thai food one day

Seabass and pad thai with grass noodle are the best
This is my second visit. I will definitely visit again if i go to vegas.
I got good deal on yelp which was $20 for $10
Server was friendly

The food here is really delicious, pretty pricey but the portions are big enough to feed 2-3 people. BBQ Beef there is really good, how they cook it varies, I had a few slices that were medium rare and well done, but still very good.

This place deserves six stars. Excellent portions, prices, and food variety. The staff is friendly and very attentive. The outside of the store is completely different in comparison to the inside. I stepped inside and was immediately impressed. Also, they have five star rewards which is a total plus! Definitely coming back for more :)

A small simply decorated place that has one of the best pad thai I've had. The tom yum goong was spicy and fragrant, but didn't have much shrimp flavor. The thai tea was very good and refreshing. The sweet rice and durian was very unique. Sweet and salty with lots of coconut cream and served hot. Great solid authentic Thai food.

Superb Thai food!!  Came to Vegas for a conference and I'm glad we stumbled into this restaurant. 

We came for lunch and ordered Thai sweet basil, Fried rice , and Tom Yum Kung (shrimp soup).  This is easily the best Thai I've tasted in a while and definitely one of the best.  The food came early, cooked fresh and flavorful!  Highly recommended!!

I was meaning to visit this place for quite some time and managed to take out some food from there on my last night at Vegas.
In one word- FABULOUS!
We had the Massumun Curry and the Thai Green Curry. We had also ordered a side of Fried Tofu. 
This was for two people. The portions are huge. One curry easily feeds 2-3 people. However, you may need to order an extra side of the steamed rice to suffice for both of you. Both curries were rich and flavorsome and you can choode how spicy you want it.
The fried tofu was not ny favorite but loved the sweet chilli dip that accompanied it.
Sooo stuffed and happy :D
Two entrees and a side+ a 5$ delivery charge works out to about 35$. A little pricey, but the tummy seems so happy, you won't feel guilty for too long!
Favorite thai restaurant:) they have awesome pad thai! It is my go to place to take my friends to! worth the drive from summerlin:):)

Truly disappointed !  The joint was nice but truly overrated by News 3 Wake up with the Wagners segment.  We asked for beef salad and squid salad. We were then asked by the server how hot 1 to 5 ( 1 being low. 5 being high). Well we asked for a 2   All the while , 2 customers sat after us and were served before us.  FAIL!!  When we got our order, the beef salad was perfect. The squid salad was at a 4 or 5 spicy level. We asked our server to take it back. She refused. Got stuck with it. No tip for her.  Will not be going back any time soon.

Had a great meal here a few nights ago with my family! Started off with the Tom yum soup, sooo good. Pad Thai, soft shell crab, pineapple fried rice and BBQ chicken were all so great! I just wasn't really a fan of the panang curry. Had a weird consistency and just strange taste all around. Tasted like they threw peanut butter and fish sauce in a bender and served it to us haha so definitely stay clear of that. But that was just one dish. The other 5-6 dishes we had were awesome. Our server, Preeyaphan (? I think that's how you spell it) was very attentive and knowledgeable of the food, so that made our dinning experience run very smoothly

Been here long time ago, they renovated the place. Now it is very nice. The food is good pretty big portion and they have happy hour, the service is a bit slow, we need to asked few times for water refill and lemon. Their cocktail is pretty interesting, but the taste is only ok. I would not get it anymore. Would I come back here, possible. But not on top of my list

Easily one of the TOP 3 Thai restaurants in town
Beautiful decor and very good authentic Thai food.
Went here for a friend's birthday- the food was good and the cocktails were creative. I would go back but not my very first choice.

I had never heard of this place before and was just looking for Thai food that was in the area on Yelp. I placed an order thru the Yelp app for pick up. (First time doing that. So easy. Definitely doing that again!) Walked in to pick up our order and we were greeted warmly. We ordered Pad Thai with Chicken, Mongolian Beef and Crab Rangoon. First off, that Crab Rangoon...just wow. Tons of filling with REAL crab - not a ton but it's tasty. Yes, it is a little pricey but I say worth it. The Mongolian Beef was really good. No issue with dry meat. Veggies were fresh. And the Pad Thai was good too. All in all, I'm looking forward to trying this place again and actually dining there.

We ordered the tom yum goon, larb (duck), Orange chicken, and pad thai, 1-2 spicy on a 5 scale.  Very fresh shrimp in the soup, large tomato chunks, onions, mushroom, and great spices.  The Orange chicken was cooked to perfection, most places make it too soggy.  Not here!  The pad thai (pork) made me cry tears of spicy joy.  A great meal!  We could have bumped up the spice on the larb, and added some more spice to tone down the rich duck flavor.
Excellent food and great service. Delivery was here in 15 minutes. I'd love to see them keep a separate vegetarian menu. Lots of fresh veggies and tofu.

So...I had ordered delivery last week and fell in love with everything I ordered (panang curry, fresh spring rolls, and Tom Kah Kai). I ordered the fresh spring rolls and the Dynamite Appetizer (deep fried chicken wings with hot spicy sauce). Not good at all. The hot spicy sauce was not spicy and had a fishy taste...as if someone accidentally spilled fish sauce into the sauce. I ate the chicken wings by themselves. Then, the fresh spring rolls that I was so looking forward to eat, was not anywhere near the taste I had enjoyed last week. Brown/old bean sprouts, not as much shrimp, too many noodles and they were dried out. I'm so disappointed. And the price of delivery just added more negative to my experience.

This is , hopefully, a one time review. I have been there many times, and, until the latest review, it was my favorite. The last visit was woeful. Jungle Curry, had only string beans and carrots in it, and was unpalatable hotness at only a 3. I really should have not accepted it but was not willing to wait another 20 min.They were crowded and I hope  that was the reason it was bad, no 
excuse though. I will give it one more try and be more demanding to get what I want, and deserve, as a frequent customer.

Great food!!! The food was absolutely amazing. Great service too. And when I say amazing I know because I eat at a lot of Thai food. It was clean and cozy. Will definitely come back when next I visit Vegas.

This restaurant was originally Royal Thai, but they recently changed owners and cooks. The decor was decent, with my only complaint being a few antique American posters around the room under all the Thai decorations. They do have excellent service as they are extremely attentive and polite. 

I think their specialty is duck items, and I do agree. Their Laab was tasty and savory without being too herby. 

We also had Pad Thai and Pad Se-ew, which was also also good without being too salty and too sweet (for the Pad Thai). 

We also ordered 2 Tom Yum dishes: (1) seafood (2) pork ribs(? - can't remember.. some type of pork bone). In terms of favorite dish, I would go with the pork ribs tom yum because I prefer my dishes sour and I don't really prefer tomatoes, which make soups slightly sweet. In fact, we liked the pork ribs tom yum so much, we ordered another! :D The seafood tom yum was still okay though, just not suited for my tastes. A fair warning though; the preparations are Thai in custom, so they leave inedible herbs in the soup to maintain authenticity. You will know they are inedible because they are really chewy; I would just scoop it out. 

The great thing is, they do allow you to change the level of spiciness. I believe there are 5 levels you can choose from, depending on how hot you can handle the food. 

Finally, the famous Thai tea. I have to say, it was fine to me, but I have a sweet tooth, so this tea may be too sweet for the average person. However, I've had teas that are just too strong in tea level, and this one was just fine.

All in all, great job so far. If I were them, I would make new take-out menus soon and change the front of the restaurant to get rid of the "Royal Thai" name and put in Weera Thai so people do not get confused.

Disclosure- I go here like 2 times a week. It is good, it is not insane good and I'm still morning the loss of now closed Thai BBQ's Tiger's cry and crispy spicy catfish, but it is totally solid and perfect for lunch. The waitresses are always cool. All the curries are great. It is family friendly, but kind of boring. I'm glad they got rid of the old fake fishing rod decoration (which I now miss) but the new decor is not making me feel so homey and comfortable- its kind of sterile, but whatever, great food. its solid and never disappoints, just not amazing.

We came here on a 30$ living socials deal and heard that this was reviewed as one of Las Vegas top 5 Thai restaurants. 

We Ordered the Duck Curry spicy #3 on a 1-5 spice scale and the crab fried rice. I love places like this that offer brown rice as an alternative and decided to substitute white for brown. The crab fried rice was full of flavor and tasted like they used fresh crab. The duck curry was awesome but was a little too spicy for a #3 but like most Thai places i always believe the number depends on the chef that day. 

For desert we decided on the durian sticky rice with coconut milk. Now for all of you that don't know what durian is its that infamous stinky fruit usually found in most Asian markets. At first I was hesitant to try the desert so I tasted the rice without the fruit and it was pretty good. I then tried it with the durian and it was like nothing I've tasted before and considered it one of the best deserts I've ever tasted. 

Good Thai food and really friendly staff and the best stinky sticky rice I've ever tasted.

I'm the pickiest person when it comes to thai because of a place back home I loved.  The coconut curry chicken is the best. E1 on the menu.  Add a little pineapple and cashews.  The sweet and the spice is perfect.

Weera Thai continues to be one of the two best Thai restaurants in Las Vegas. I lived in Thailand for a year and Weera is authentic and great value. The kitchen is very clean and recently they got cited for using dented cans, but it didnt impact taste or service!

My favorite Thai place to come to. Their food is so delicious & they have a great lunch special! Their service varies ... Like my first time there the waitress told us not to get a plate because it gave another person an upset stomach ...... Awkward ..... But that was just one waitress. Their quality of food is exceptional however and I like how you can make it extremely spicy!

Weera Thai has been a great place to dine as long as my experience goes. The food is great and the thai ladies working there are nice.

So, for the 4th of July weekend my family planned to go there for dinner. When we arrived, we noticed that they have renovated the place and it was a much bigger than what I used to know. It was busy, but we cared to wait since we wanted to eat some of our usual dishes again. When we got our table, it was a bit awkward because it was squashed between two other tables and one of our chairs was blocking the path to the restrooms which created unwanted passing through by other people and disturbing our dinner. Then, we have this nice thai lady taking order from us. However, she wasn't taking down any notes. Instead, she was memorizing my orders, so seems like she was pretty good at it. Until, we noticed that we made the order before a couple arrived next to us. But, that couple got their food first and one of the waitress accidentally brought the couple's food to our table. We ordered the same type of dish and when the waitress realized she made a mistake, she was confused and took the food back.That is when I realized the lady who took our order made a grave mistake. We ordered the eggplant dish with beef, but it arrived with chicken and as soon as I saw my favorite dish of crispy pork and vegetables, i realized the portion was smaller than before and the quality dropped just by looking at it. Usually I finish the whole plate but this time I cannot chew some of the pieces, the skin felt like rubber. I can sense that the chefs are out of their breath and exhausted from cooking over and over again at a very busy time. Overall, we didn't get to enjoy our dinner fully. I didn't complain because we are already tired and hungry and we don't feel like bringing up these issues. However, the thai lady who took our order was very nice to bring a coloring paper and crayons for my son to keep himself busy.

I love Thai food, I could probably eat it 3-4 days a week and not get my fill. I came to Weera with some work friends for lunch. 

The restaurant was clean and the wait staff attentive. The Pad Thai chicken was tasty, I had it spicy 3 out of 5, which I thought tasted more like a 2. The portion was generous. 

On check out, our bill was combined, even though we had asked for separate checks at the time we ordered. The host seemed put out to separate the bills and had to get help to accomplish our request. 

All in all, I enjoyed the food and will return for sure.
I would rather eat cardboard than the Pad Seu and the complimentary wings did not make the delivery. The white rice was delicious, but then my 4 year old neice can make white rice.

My boyfriend used to LOVE this restaurant. The experience would have continued to be 5/5 for us, given that the food is delicious and the waiters were once very kind, helpful, and sincerely nice. However, our experiences since their renovation have been disappointing, and recently, incredibly frustrating due to the bad attitude and lack of customer service of the rude, curt female manager working. Our waitress was very sweet but did not speak English, so there was confusion when she asked if we wanted brown rice, despite the fact that they did not have any at the time. This was no problem when we received only white rice, because as two laid back people, we understand stuff happens. When taking our order, the waitress did great by asking what level of heat and what type of meat we wanted. However, she did not ask what type of tofu I wanted, like they had during previous visits, and I had not thought to tell her because it honestly had spaced my mind. This should have been a simple, easy fix, but the manager made sure that not only was I not going to get steamed tofu, but that she was going to berate and belittle me in front of my boyfriend and the other patrons of the restaurant by spitefully lecturing me at our table about the fact that I needed to specify, or else they are going to make me whatever they want. I have never been so rudely treated and embarrassed in my life. We were so disgusted by this woman at this point, having barely touched our food, that we requested to have our food to go. Instead of letting us pack our own food, the waitress took it all to the back. Upon arriving home, much later than we had intended on having a nice, relaxing meal, as if to add insult to injury, our packed meal had about 20% of the curry that we paid for in the small containers, which made the meal not even worth eating. I called and complained, to which naturally I was combated with lame excuses for their terrible actions. We will never go back there again. If I find out the name of said manager, I will edit and place her name so that you can request not to have her have any part of your dining experience.
Came here on a business trip, looking for authentic Thai food. Found this place on Yelp. All dishes are very authentic and tasty. Strongly recommended!

Ordered delivery from Weera on a Monday night. Our food came within an hour and was delicious. Large portions and fantastic flavors! I would definitely order from here again. Also, so happy they deliver to the Vdara. If you stay here, your dining options are slightly limited unless you're willing to walk pretty far. It was nice to try something new and be able to easily pick it up right outside the lobby of the hotel.

The food was delicious!  This was our first time here and we were not disappointed.  Great food, cute little restaurant and great staff!  The shrimp with glass noodle salad was very refreshing and the deep fried pork with basil was very flavorful.

We were visiting Las Vegas and checked the Yelp reviews to find a good Thai restaurant.  The food was great and the service was very friendly and helpful.  The food can be very spicy, so keep that in mind when you order.  I had the duck curry and the sticky rice and they were both delicious. The prices were very reasonable.

Tasty curry.  Great service.  Clean restaurant.

The co-workers and I placed an online order for pickup after a recommendation from one of them.  We arrived about 15 min after the orders went in and the meals were waiting for us upon arrival.  Although we did not eat there, I will say the restaurant was extremely clean from what I saw.

I ordered the red curry lunch special.  Great option with a lot of food for only $11.  Everything had so much flavor, it was amazing!

Will definitely be going back again!

Weera Thai, is by far one of my favorite Thai places here in Vegas. My friends and I have been coming here for over 5 years. Even after hey remodeled the interior. If have fiends in town bring them for their lunch special.

Also, don't forget to get their Pat Thai or the Panag Curry.  Those two are my favorite in the menu.

Been coming here for years, way back when it was still Royal Thai.  Incredible transformation after the expansion.  The sign outside tricks you into thinking you're about to pass up another cruddy strip-mall Asian restaurant.  If you haven't tried Weera lately you're missing out. 

Very rich Penang curry, noodle dishes (pad si ew) are savory, soups are steaming with fresh meats and vegetables.  

Definitely in the top 3 Thai in Vegas.

My fiance and I are locals and love trying new food places especially Thai food. We should know better by now that it is not easy to find a place that is better than the Archi's on Rainbow and 215. 


First off Weera's service is terrible. They had us sit, did not take drink orders, I had to ask for my drink then at that they did not ask my fiance for his drink order, they acted like he was non existent. Once our server came back for the third time we ordered our food and his drink.

We love thai food and always over order due to how the food becomes more flavorful the next day. We ordered:

Pad prik king level 4, my fiances favorite (usually) he liked it, said it had a good flavor but could have got level 5. 

Panang curry level 4, my favorite (usually) I could have got a 5 as well. It had good flavor and since this place is close to my work and Archi's is not, I will order it for lunch one day. 

Pad thai level 4, recived level 0. Enough said. 

Shrimp fried rice, it was good, you really have to be terrible to screw that up. 

Fried wings, they were cripsy and the sauce was really good, oh and it was more spicy than our other dishes.

Thai tea, was delish and it would have been nice if the fiance had the option of a refill. 

We waited and waited to be aknowledged for our check. 

There are better places for Thai food here in vegas. But this is just my opinion.

From the very first time I tried Weera, I knew I was hooked!  I love the selections on the menu because they offer both Thai traditional, and Issan cuisine. The service is fast, professional, and friendly, no matter how busy it is. And if they do fall behind on busy days, the managers-owners, aren't scared to come out and take orders. I love that! I don't think I've ever had an off day here, everything has been very consistent since day one!
Best fried chicken wontons, sweetest servers, decent prices, good portions. Used to eat here at least once as week. Had a few hiccups but overall a great place.

I saw their special on Groupon, and since I love Thai food and have never been to this place, I bought the coupon.
We have a mixed review on the quality of food and service. First we order chicken potstickers. For $5 we got 8 pieces, I was impressed because none of the other Thai restaurants would give you that many potstickers in an order. It was a bit salty but tasted pretty good. For the main dish we ordered chicken teriyaki and chicken fried rice. The food came out really fast since they weren't really busy. They put a lot of rice on the plate. I was happy this far until I got a bite of the chicken teriyaki. First of all there's not much you can do to ruin a teriyaki dish. It wasn't the flavor of the sauce that made me upset, but the fact that the chicken taste like spoiled meat. I made a complain to the waitress about the weird taste of the chicken. And she said that it was just different style of that region. Helloooo, do you think I'm stupid. I know that different region cooks the same food different way hence the different flavors. But no, the sauce taste just like plain teriyaki sauce, and that's not what I tasted on the chicken. I'm Asian and I crave for  good Asian food all the time. I'm not picky but bad Asian food just turns me off. As far as my husband, he's a white guy but an extremely good cook and cook many asian dishes better than most. He took one bite and pushed the food away. He knew the meat was rancid and ate no more. So when the waitress came back he told her that the meat was bad, and she said ok thank you. 

So when I asked a different waitress to box my fried rice, I told her about the bad teriyaki chicken that we didn't touch, she told us she would check with the kitchen and the owner. After several minutes of waiting, we decided just to leave the cash on the table and don't even bother. As we were walking outside the restaurant, the first waitress came and asked us if we want thai tea to go for screwing up the order. My husband told her he's never coming back to the restaurant again, and her comment was ok thank you very much.  I told her I don't want any thai tea and how upset I was that she tried to convince me again about the different style. Come on! I could understand if maybe I didn't like the flavor, but Bad Meat is Bad Meat. Period. The fact that the owner keep defending the flavor of what I know is the weird taste of bad meat just pissed me off more than the food itself.

We eat out quite often. I give praise where it's due and complaints where it's due.

So will I ever come back here again? Absolutely not! There's so many good Thai restaurants in Vegas, and I wouldn't even consider this place as one of them.

My girl friend moved to Henderson for medical school in 2012. Since we both love Thai food, we started exploring around Las Vegas area and came across Weera Thai restaurant. A couple of years ago, the restaurant wasn't THAT famous as it is now. The decor was simple and so was the menu. Now there are a lot more items on the menu and it looks more fancy! The food quality has been excellent so far and it is one my favorite Thai restaurants in the US. Whenever I visit Henderson, we try and eat at this place. The Tom Kah Kai soup is heavenly... Green/Yellow chicken curry, Pad see ewe, and papaya salad are my favorite! 

And now they have changed their hours and are open for service 7 days a week! Plus they deliver to the strip! Their happy hour is good and prices are very reasonable. If you love Thai food and are in the Vegas area, you MUST eat here!

Excellent food and service...I would suggest to anyone who enjoys Chinese food, to give Weera Thai Restaurant a try...You will be plesantly surprised....and the price is wonderful

I give this restaurant an A plus...
I order for delivery to my hotel mgm grand.food coming fast less than 30 mins and very yummy thai food .
Wow I'm so glad I came to this restaurant the food is amazing the place is nice and clean, just an amazing experience.

Weera Thai is simply "Amazing".  I dine there for dinner with increasing frequency.  The food from the extensive menu is consistently outstanding; it never disappoints.  It's fresh, well prepared, flavorful, and offers a complexity that most mortals (including some of the top chefs in Vegas who go there) simply cannot prepare at home.   It is clear that the Weera Thai owners and staff actually care, want your dining experience to be positive, and value your business.  Care is taken to keep the restaurant very clean, and the relaxed, casual, atmosphere is great for conversation.  The service is polite, efficient, friendly and attentive, never intrusive.  I've tried most Thai restaurants in Las Vegas, the extensive menu (including Issan) differentiates itself from others. It has rave reviews from a number of  food critics;  A recent Desert Companion review of Thai Restaurants in Las Vegas claimed it "Best Thai Food in the Universe" and "Mind-blowing".  The portions are ample and the pricing is very reasonable.  

Reading the other reviews, ..I've not been there during peak lunch hours.  Keep in mind that it is a small establishment and being way from China Town and the Strip, in a small strip mall, means that it really has to deliver to draw customer in order to offer the more extensive menu; if they are out of eggs rolls...there are so many interesting excellent choices not offered elsewhere.  The Pad Kee Mow (Drunken Noodle),  is outstanding, (I think the owner said that they get the noodles fresh daily!) - I'll take freshness, at the expense of their being out of something on occasion, but personally I've not experienced that.   As of late, I ask the waitresses to select something for me that I haven't tried before - not something I'd not do in many restaurants.  

There are times where it can be a bit busy in the evening if a number of tables show up at the same time, and there are large groups.  My suggestions is go with friends, or a date and enjoy the dining experience, and the environment that allows for conversation.  I dine out often with friends, and am not a stranger to fine dining, and worked in the restaurant industry myself for many years when younger.
I was in Las Vegas for Christmas, and went there both Eve and Day with friends (who are from Asia, live in Las Vegas and are knowledgeble and selective about their restaurants, and fine dining).  They loved it.

Some ideas in addition to Specials there: Panang Curry, Pinapple Fried Rice (hint of curry) combination , Tom Yum or Tom Kha Gai, Crab Fried Rice, (can't recall the name...but there's a duck sausage) I finally tried the Papaya Salad (a bit sweet for my taste, and a bit heavy on the dressing for my liking).  I'd order it again, but ask for less dressing and spicer heat level).  I've had the Spicy Thai Holy Basil with Chicken - mentioned by another reviewer -no complaints.

I really liked this place!  The food was fresh, portions generous, and service was shockingly friendly.  We ordered pineapple fried rice and Pad See Ewe.  Both were delicious and left no room for complaints.  Will return the next time I'm sick of eating at buffets.

The food is good, though rather pricy for what is essentially rice. If there were more veggies I wouldn't mind so much. But the taste is there. One thing I don't like is that when ordering online from eat24 they won't honor the coupons. I got a call saying that it they wouldn't give the free ice tea with the purchase. How about taking the coupon off the system then?

Nice view. But the food is awlful taste and smell. I think this is the only bad Thai food in town which I ate. I ordered 10 different dishes but all are bad, not look like Thai style. Services are very slow, they dont have enough waitors and waitress to serve such a crowed people today. Have to togo all of the food :( Never be back ! Not recommend this one for Thai food.

All around good Thai food. They have an extensive menu that could be compared with Lotus of Siam, just with better service and a lower price tag. The food has varied on my visits between outstanding and good. It's not always consistent, which is why it gets only 4 stars.

Do: Try the pineapple rice, it's so damn good!
Don't: Accidentally wander in to the shady looking massage parlor right next door. Weera is fairly nondescript, as is the massage parlor. I nearly ended up through that door by mistake on my first visit.

The service was nice, the food was mediocre, and the Thai tea... TERRIBLE. I love Thai tea and I base my reviews on Thai restaurants around them. I was expecting a great deal from this place considering the reviews said "Great Authentic Thai food!' I think the reviews led me to expect too much.
Food is still good.  They renovated the restaurant and starting to put unknown charges on your bill.   Watch for this.

Food was pretty good. We enjoy spicy Thai food so it was great that they were able to accommodate our taste buds. They have the traditional Thai dishes, but they they also had the Isaan section. We decided to order from the Isaan section because there aren't many restaurants that offer those types of dishes. The papaya salad with crab was very good and spicy. The portions are pretty large too. Prices are a bit higher than other places, but then again the portions make up for it. We would return to Weera and recommend others try it out.
THE best Thai food in Las Vegas. Better than Lotus of Siam or Le Thai. Try the Tom Saap here. It's the best. Our whole family love the food here and we come here to eat every time we're in town.

Yo soy clienta de weera thai desde hace 2 años es mi lugar thailandes favorito.me encanta la comida siempre caliente y con el mejor savor q he provado me encanta la tom yum soup chickenchicken phad thai and egg rolls riquisimos !!el mejor lunch menu de cualquier restaurant thailandes acompañado con un plato de ensalada y un plato de sopa yumiyummi!!!he conocido muchos aqui en las vegas.se los recomiendo.

This restaurant has amazing, tasteful, and good Thai food. It has excellent authentic Thai food. The service is very friendly and kind. They have an assortment of curries that are very piquant and tasteful. Also the Thai tea is excellent and not too sweet with great flavor.
Had the red curry and it was really good. The Thai iced coffee was delicious as well. The staff was very nice and the service was fast. Everyone left very satisfied. Five stars all day.

We got delivery as it was very hot and I was very tired. What a great experience still. 
Started with the wonton soup which might be the best I've ever had. So flavorful!
Next was tofu spring rolls which were delicious. The peanut dipping sauce was so spot on. 
We ordered chicken in red curry sauce and Mongolian beef as our entrees. They were both so good, flavorful and well cooked and so not greasy. We also got pineapple fried rice which was excellent. 
Overall there's no wrong choices and this will be our new go to spot. Can't wait to try something new. :)

We were staying at the MGM and getting tired of the strip food and the overpriced food.  My wife is Thai and she really wanted to eat.  Well this is the place.  The food is fresh and the prices are great.  We started with Thai Seafood Salad$12.95.  Jumbo Shrimp white fish and squid.  wow!!!  My wife ordered Issan sausage.  Very authentic.  And tasted great. I could go on forever. Let's just say the food is great.  Cab from MGM $20.00. Cheaper if your near downtown.   We ate at Seablue an Tao. The food here is 1/4 of the price. And 4x better.

Careful, you might overlook it. It's kind of hidden with all the other shops in this packed strip mall on Sahara. But once in the restaurant, it's clean, cozy, well designed. The staff is extremely polite. I always gravitate back to my comfort food - Pad-Se-Ew. It met my expectations. Good sized portion, great taste. I loved it.

I've been here about 5-6 times and will continue coming.
I think very good for thai people and if you visiting Las vegas u need go to try here
My husband, daughter and I had lunch here today before flying out from the Las Vegas airport. Their lunch specials were excellent - great flavor and great value.

This place is by far the best Thai restaurant I've ever been in the States! And I'm the kind of person who always makes it a priority to visit at least one Thai restaurant every time I visit any city. If you are looking for authentic Thai food, you will not be disappointed. The place is very clean and well appointed with a  relaxed ambience. The owner and his staff are very friendly. That's always a great quality for the Thai restaurant. Even though this place is not in downtown but with only 10 mins cab ride, you will be at one of the best Thai restaurant in the country! Try Larb Duck and Tom Yum Pork spare ribs. They are just the best.

I'm giving the restaurant 5 stars for serving great food but nothing for customer service. The waitress started to get our order but as soon as another guests came in, she told us that she has to seat them first. Then, she ignored us a lot of times when we were trying to get her attention to order more rice. She finally came, took the order and forgot about us again.  We had to ask another person for it. That was just so rude of her. It also seems like she panics when she sees guests coming in the restaurant and tries to multi-task thus neglecting the service she's giving to the other guests.

We decided to go here while visiting Las Vegas, after reading the reviews and hearing it was one of the top thai restaurants in the area. We ended up going here twice during our stay - everyone enjoyed it so much.  Loved the fresh coconut water...after drinking the water, they will cut it in half so you can scoop out the coconut meat also. Staff is friendly and food taste and portions are good.

The best and most original Thai food in Vegas. Seriously! I love Thai food when it is authentic - which means full of flavor - and Weera is the real thing.

We ordered Kao Soy, Kaprow Mookob, and an appetizer of spicy chicken wings. Also had Som Tum, a salad.

The Kao Soy is a Northern Thai soup with thin noodles, and when done well, is a spicy warm delight.

Weera is about a 10 minute drive North of Aria.

Next time we are in Vegas, we will return! I highly recommend.

We came here on a fluke...
Another thai was no longer around.
(Out of towners) but man the food here looks ABSOLUTELY Amazing!!
Must try this!
Went there for my sister in law's birthday. Always great service and great  food. Coconut ice cream with sticky rice was awesome!!!

I'm not sure why this place gets such great reviews.  Perhaps we came on a bad day, but our meal was mediocre at best.  My shrimp massaman curry was flavourless, with a LOT of potato and very little of anything else.  My boyfriend got a meat dish and wasn't very happy with it either.  We were pretty disappointed.

Amazing Customer Service! They Are Really Attentive To See If You Need Anything Else. There Food Is Delicious, Recommend The Chicken Pad Thai/ Chicken Fried Rice & Tom Yum Sea Food Soup Its Amazing. Overall Great Quality In Food

We visited Weera Thai with our family who are locals in Las Vegas who love this place. We shared two appetizers and four entrees and had lots of leftovers for lunch the next day. We shared the Shrimp Spring Rolls and Veggie Egg Rolls which were both pretty good. Graham enjoyed what he order, Pinneapple Fried Rice with Shrimp and Red Curry with Tofu. I did not care for what I ordered, the Spicy Thai Basil with Tofu. We felt like overall the service could improve and that they needed to add more vegetables to their dishes. They had unique and tasty flavors but lacked quality control with the amount of vegetables offered in each entree.

My family loves Weera Thai.  It's our go-to place.  I tried it out for the first time now about 1.5 years ago.  It's always really wonderful.  

We usually get the crab sticks, sometimes that large soup (I think they are all great) the papaya salad (the best!).  We love it all.  Haven't had anything there that wasn't hot and super yummy.  We have probably been there 15 times now.

The only deficit I would say is that once in a while, the service is a leetle bit lacking.  Nothing major though and the servers are very nice, always!  Would also love it if they'd install a soda machine.  Nothing like cold Coca Cola (with free refills)  to go with the hot and spicy food of Weera Thai.

We come here all the time. My husband and I use to come here even 3 times a week sometimes. Things have definitely changed in their service and their food as well. We always order the duck spring rolls and my husband is very forgetful and forgets to ask for the peanut sauce instead with the spring rolls and this time we were told it would be $2 extra. They exchanged it for free this time, but it's weird to be told that when we've been coming here for so long. I understand though. Another thing about their food quality was their Thai fried rice was mushy.... first time this has ever happened to us. Also there was a lady on November 17th at around 10pm that was standing behind the counter that kept giving my husband a dirty look when we tried to redeem codes we had gotten from their reward program... why have a program for loyal customers if you're going to give attitude about people trying to use it. Like I said before, we've come here a lot and a lot of the staff knows us. Sadly none of them were working tonight ..
Had a great time. Customer service spot on price was fair I'm glad I went here. Will definitely try them again looking forward to the next visit
Great green curry with tofu, awesome spicy eggplant with beef; more food than the two of us could finish; and with (adult) beverages, tax and tip, still around $30.  We'll be back.

This is the best authentic Thai food that I have had. The Panang curry is spot on.  We know the staff personally due to comming quite often.  The Pad See Ew is also the best Ive had..and were always treated well and will continue to make this our only Thai spot to dine at.

We went with a group of 6. There were maybe three other tables occupied when we arrived. It took her a while for the server to take our drink order and another long while for her to deliver the drinks. The server did not speak very good English (or pretended not to). Her facial expressions were not good. She seemed short tempered and irritated. She never once was pleasant as a server should be. The food was really good. Portions were good.

Came upon this place by looking for Thai food and could not be happier. Crab ragoons are amazing. The Pad Thai is the best we have had. Great overall experience and only a few minutes from the strip. We will be back.
I love thai food and Weera Thai is about as good as it gets in Las Vegas.  I always come here for at least one dinner. Phase Thai is my favorite. I even walked over a mile to get here.

First time at this restaurant.  Great food and great environment.  The staff was very good and knowledgeable.  The restaurant is not very attractive from the outside but the interior good.  Highly recommend.
Food was delish. Servers were professional . The inside looks better than the outside.

As to me, this is the best Thai restaurant in Vegas.

I like the rainbow fried rice and pineapple fried rice the most~!!!! 

Also the mango with sweet rice as a dessert~~~Perfect~!!!!

The only reason I am giving Weera a 5 start rating is because Yelp doesn't give the option of 10 stars. We've been coming here for over a year now, and we adore it! Not only is their food amazingly cooked, their service is quick and clean, and their workers are hard working and so extremely nice, but they also give to the poor (what I witnessed today! I was so unbelievably proud to be eating there These people are angels!) NOW, the food... I have yet to not like anything on the menu. Everything is so good and cooked to perfection. One of the best thai restaurants with outstanding service and amazing food. ps: make sure you tell them you checked in they give you complementary ice cream! Love it here!
Large menu, multiple styles, great service and nice ambiance. Food is on point of course. Not as busy and crazy as the other Thai spot in town.  Happy hour specials also.

LOVE LOVE LOVE! Pad Thai, Panang Curry, Tom Yum soup was everything I could eat everyday all day! 

Will be definitely be coming back from California for this. 

Service was so friendly and helpful! ANNND the food is so well priced. I was surprised and happy when I got the check. Lol

A lot of Thai customers in this restaurant - A first good sign.
Friendly staff and service - a second good sign
The Menu has wide variety kinds of food to offer
Delicious authentic Thai food especially Issan sausages, Somtum with fried catfish.  Curry dish was very authentic and tasted great, Fried kale with Crispy pork was OK.  ChiangMai sausage was OK.  As every restaurant has its own specialty -  This one is very good on Issan Menu, all spicy salad and curry.
Price is a little bit more expensive than in my city.  However, it is still affordable and worth the money you pay.
Overall, this is a good place to have Authentic Thai food in Las Vegas.

We came in as a group and had dinner here. We ordered the pad thai, duck salad, fried rice, pad see ew, tom yum soup, fried ribs.

The pad thai was 4 stars. The noodle was perfectly cooked but lack of flavor.

The duck salad was very good but next time I'll ask for minus the ground rice seasoning which made it very gritty.

The fried rice was okay. I didn't taste any flavor to it other than plain rice that was fried up.

Pad see ew was delicious and not dry with plenty of flavor.

The tom yum soup was traditional tom yum flavor with lots of mushrooms and peppers only a few shrimps. 

The ribs were very tasty chopped into tiny bits. If only they were chopped bigger so that you can actually taste the meat verses a bunch of bones. There wasn't that many pieces of ribs on that tiny plate full of garnishes. 

Each plate varied apprx. $10+ dollars which didn't include rice.  They charge $1 per person for rice which adds up if you go with a large party.

This is the second time that I have been to Weera Thai Restaurant and both were for lunch.  The place sits in a run down strip mall, but that should not be a deterrent from visiting.  The place is very clean inside and the service that you get is second to none.

Within seconds of entering the place you're greeted by the staff and they ask you to make yourself comfortable.  You're imediately given menu's and drink orders are taken.  From that time on, your drinks are never left to go empty.

The menu is pretty good and has a vast array of options to choose from, as well as the typical adjustments for spiciness, if that's your thing.  I've ordered the Shrimp Pad Thai, Cashew Chicken and Garlic Chicken and I have yet to have a bad meal.  The food is fresh and very tasty and as authentic as anything else served up in Vegas.

The price point for the meals are usually set well, not to cheap and not overly exorbant either.  Service is perfect and the environment is always pleasant.  I would recommend this place for a good thai meal.

Oh, and the Thai Iced Tea is absolutely delicious!

Weera Thai is a cute space in a rather dingy strip mall.  My brother and I stopped in for lunch. We took advantage of the lunch specials ordering the Chicken Pad Thai ($7.99) and Mongolian Beef ($7.99). Both come with salad, soup, rice and egg roll. I enjoyed the Pad Thai, it was a good sized portion and a great value. My brother didn't like the Mongolian beef enough to order it again, but left satisfied. Unfortunately, service was sluggish. They had a full dining room so it's understandable. It just rules it out as a lunch spot, since we need to be in & out in under an hour. I would like to return to try items beyond the lunch menu selection; the Issan items piqued my attention.

This place is fantastic. Great prices too & amazing food. We're obviously from out of town, so I was craving Thai food like crazy. My mom & I shared the mixed veggies with chicken & got pork fried rice. One of the best rices I've ever had! Awesome customer service too. :)

A really good secret....Hands down they have some really great food! It is inconspicuously located in a strip mall on Sahara, so you can easily pass right by it.  Anything you get on this menu is guaranteed to be delicious you can't go wrong....the staff is also very humbled and gracious to be of service.  Pricing is reasonable, I just wish the portions were a little bigger.
If you are looking for good Thai food this is the place to go! The crispy duck with curry and coconut is amazing and the desserts are to die for!
My wife and I will be here at least once a week. It was amazing.    Great service as well.
I eat here for lunch during work. Love the lunch specials, especially getting panang curry with crispy chicken. So good!
Yum! Delicious and extremely reasonable prices, great service. I would recommend the pad thai and the spicy basil chicken, very flavorful!

They were quick on delivery.. Good taste
Will definitely come back here.. Portions were pretty good..

For the last two visits, the food has been okay but it's delivered so slow.  Our last visit, 3 of the 4 entrees came together but the last never came.  We ended up taking it as a carry out.  Today, the same thing happened but only worse.  Entrees 1 and 2 came out together.  Entree 2 white rice wasn't provided.  Entree 3 came after both people finished and we ended up cancelling entree 4.  Very poor service.

I use to eat here up to 3 times a week when I first head of this place. It's close enough that it delivers to my job and in the same plaza as my hair salon so it was a must every time I was nearby. A little overpriced for the kind of food that it is but it sooo delicious.

my favorites are the fried crab rice, the yellow curry, their eggrolls, and their Thai tea.

very quick delivery

Absolutely amazing! Tasty, home-made noodles with spices to your desired level of heat. The lychee nut saki was delightful. We had the curry and noodle dishes. Worth driving off the Las Vegas  Strip to have food Nirvana experience!

This is my second time at Weera Thai. I came here because of Groupon, but that did not input my review. The food is bursting with flavor and has a true Thai heat to it. They do have promotions once in a while for free Tahi Tea refills. I has the Pad Prik King with chicken and shrimp. It's was an exceptional meal. Oh yes the fried chicken dumpling was exceptional. For being deep fried it had nearly no grease and was very light. The overall food portions were just right. 

It also help that they deliver to the Las Vegas Strip. I will be dining here more often as well as utilizing the deliver option.

I think I've been here maybe 30 times ( maybe more) even though I've only checked in 17 times.. Regardless, I think it's time for a review! 

I believe I found this place after searching for "best thai food in vegas." It was listed among the top three along with Lotus of Siam & Komol so I had to give it a try after already trying the latter two restaurants. I am sooo glad I did because this has become one of my regulars/to go restraurants when I'm not sure what I'm really craving.

YUM I don't think there is a single item on this menu that I don't like. I used to order the same items every time I came.. so much that when I forgot what it was, the waitresses would finish my order for me! Some of my favorites here are: the panang curry, the green curry, crab fried rice, and garlic squid. I won't get into each thing individually because I just don't feel that any words can do it justice, but will note that everything is always fresh and PACKED with flavor. Just think of a regular thai place and multiply the flavor by 5. So. Good. 

I also liked the pad thai. Normally, I don't like pad thai because I find it to be waaay too sweet or saucy, but this is really good. I've ordered it a few times for delivery to school and never had any complaints. Speaking of delivery-- they deliver to a pretty wide area including the strip! woohoo.

My all time favorite thing though would have to be the thai iced tea.. yes.. a drink! It tastes significantly different than thai iced tea from other places (other places tend to have a slight chocolate-y flavor which I'm not a huge fan of). It's hard to explain the exact taste... just trust me & try it! After all it is $1 or 50% off during lunch/happy hour I believe. 

The service here is amazing. Everyone is very friendly. My only minor complaint is that the parking lot outside gets extremely full sometimes!

5 stars for the isaan sausages
5 stars for the Happy Hour Menu ($5 (some)appetizers 4-9pm)
5 stars for the catfish salad
5 stars for the Service

After two nights in Vegas, we were at the point where stepping out of our hotel room seemed like a chore and I was craving something other than buffet food. Luckily Weera Thai delivered, both literally and figuratively. Granted, there is a 5 dollar surcharge for the service, but at least we didn't need to step into the cold. The food was reasonable priced and plentiful. The chicken green curry came in one of those quart sized containers and was the perfect balance of coconut milk and spice. We also got a salmon red curry which was less successful but still delicious. The salmon was slightly overcooked and the portion was not as plentiful at the green curry. All in all, it was a welcome respite from the crab legs.

When we stopped in for a late lunch, we were pleased to see the customers were mainly Thais.  We ordered Pad Thai from the Luncheon menu as it is the dish we normally order to compare Thai restaurants.  It was some of the best Pad Thai we've had.  We were pleasantly surprised when our server brought us a starter of salad, egg roll and cup of Tom Yum soup since the menu didn't mention the dish came with sides.  These were also excellent and we will certainly eat here again on our next trip to Las Vegas.

Overrated restaurant. Red curry is flavorless, not creamy at all. Yellow curry is alright but not creamy at all. Spicy fried rice and Tom yum fried rice also falls into the same category of no flavor.

Loved their food and got a great yelp deal with $10 off our order! Came here with my cousin and ate a great pad thai as well as yellow curry. Super good and staff that was a little indifferent and seemed to ignore us unless we waved them down. Otherwise, we'll definitely come back on our next visit to Las Vegas!
This place is awesome.  Great portion sizes.  Happy hour specials.  Level 5 spice was intense, I'm going to go for 4 next time.

From service, to the quality and flavor or the food, both my wife and I were extremely impressed.   Pricing is great and lower than similar restaurants of the same caliber.    We will definitely return and will tell our friends about our experience !

We ordered online for takeout for a trip to Utah. They were friendly and simply wonderful!!! They packed everything neatly and the food fed us for several days. The beef salad is to die for! Everything else was good, too! 

I just wish they'd put more veggies into their pad see ewe and fried rice. They still tasted excellent but veggies would balance out the carbs.
Fast service. Delicious food. Thai tea is not too sweet and tastes homemade. And free ice cream for check in.

I ordered the Roast Duck Curry (side of steamed rice) to go.  ordered online and was ready by the time I arrived (approx 15 mins).  The preparation and ingredients were excellent.  A very tasty dish.  I eat Thai quite often (my go to takeout), this place definitely rates very highly.  Also, the to go packaging was done very well!  Included was some extra chilli sauce, fork, spoon, serviette.  The best Thai I have had in a while.

Still going here after 2 years and love it. They are always adding things to the menu. Love the addition of duck entrees. The Issan menu is one of a kind. Delicious!!! Try the pork neck dish! Very tender and flavorful. Yum!!

We came back from an 18 hour flight from Asia, hungry and tired. I had this groupon so we decided to check this place out. I was tired and did not want to get out of the car but the groupon does not allow for take out orders. So we went in. The food was so good it got me re-energized. I am glad we stopped by this place. It was busy but the servers were very attentive. Would definitely visit again.

This is my go to spot when I come Vegas! However this time around I was very disappointed. We ordered 6 entree ( for two people, I know we are pigs lol). First off customer service was soooo bad. I asked for my coffee because my thai coffee had to much creamer. I literally had to ask 5 times. And when they finally brought it we were done eating and waiting on our check. Our table next to us was complaining on how long they have been waiting for a waitress to bring them there bill. At this time there is approximately 5 tables and 4 waitresses.

The tom yum chicken was really good! ANgel wings, Papaya salad, nam KAO, pork sausage and basil stir fry chicken was not all that great. Everything is sour and the basil stir fry is an authentic Thai dish and I would have thought that would have more flavors. 

It gets worse *sigh* as the waitress was bringing our meal she pours the rice all over me!!! And breaks the bowl right next to me. Could you imagine if it was my soup? I didn't get an apology however what I did get was "I didn't mean to do that". I had rice on the side of my hair, on my pants and on my shoes. At this moment after waiting for some time, I became very frustrated. 

Overall customer service is very poor. Food quality is OK. However decor is very nice. 

I'm hoping when I do go back and give them one last try it will be better.
This place is very authentic... I like their larb phet, gang sap, and the service is is nice.

This place is seriously legit. We were impressed with the food (green curry, pineapple fried rice and pad thai), all were delicious beyond your normal everyday Thai place. However, the ambience in the restaurant was very nice! The decor isn't cheesy like most Asian places (you know, with hodge podge Oriental style decor picked up from discount stores), but with beautiful eye catching Thai style pieces. Adds to the deliciousness of the meal to be surrounded by such glittery beauty!

We're from out of town and had no idea where to go. So we did like a lot of out-of-towners do and looked on Yelp. The food here is very good the restaurant very clean and the staff is very friendly. We ordered pad thai for lunch that came with a bowl of soup and a nice fresh salad all very good

We first came here 3 or 4 years ago and remembered it was absolutely delicious! At that time, it was still the hole-in-the-wall place with sagging booth seats and friendly service. We were surprised and happy to see the place had doubled in size and updated its decor, as that meant business was going well for them.

We walked in and were directed to a table that still had water marks from the glasses before. No big deal. They brought us the menu and waters, and gave us a few moments to look through their extensive menu. Compared to a few years ago, they had definitely expanded their menu selection, which is both exciting yet overwhelming at the same time. It offered a chance to try new dishes yet we were wary of the chef being a "jack of all trades, master of none". Of course, the prices had gone up quite a bit, which is to be expected seeing how well they had been doing.

Pad See Ewe with pork was a pretty big portion, overshadowing the lunch portions at neighbouring tables. It had a sweetness to it, but not overly so. Other than that, the flavour was pretty bland. It was not bad but it reminded me of your typical Americanized-Asian takeout place.

My better half was a bit more adventurous, trying a more specialized Thai dish: Khao Soy with beef. It was a generous portion but again, very little flavour. We used to practically live off of Khao Soy when we were in Chiang Rai, and this was nothing close to that and even falling significantly shorter than the Americanized version of the same dish at Lotus of Siam.

It seemed as if the chef subscribed to the quantity over quality concept. Service was like a team effort: it seemed impersonal as it was always a different person who took our order, brought our food, refilled our waters, etc. Definitely not the mom-and-pop style restaurant we remembered it to be.

We were disappointed that one of our favourite Thai places in Vegas had hit it big and forgot where they came from. It has become so much more expensive while losing its bold flavours and personalized service.
I absolutely love their shrimp curry which comes with rice, salad, and soup all for a reasonable price . My fiancé and I go here all the time. Great customer service!! Their staff is so nice.

I love to eat here. The people who work here are friendly. When I get take out there fast. When I get delivery its never a long time. The Thai food here tastes so good. I recommend this place to anyone who loves Thai food like me.
Excellent service and great food! It's my 'go to' for excellent food and the fresh spring rolls are Devine!

Great Thai food! we used the yelp groupon and overall it was a great value. My pad thai was good, not the best I've ever had but good enough to make me happy. My husband ordered garlic shrimp and that was delicious. We plan on going again soon.

It's not heavily advertised, but they have a great daily happy hour that runs 4-8. Lots of food items under $6 and a good selection of reduced-price beer, wine, and sake.

My friend and I each had several glasses of $6 wine, and we split three food items: noodle-wrapped shrimp, Thai beef salad, and tom yum clam soup. Could have skipped the shrimp, but the salad and soup were great with just the right amount of heat.

Although I really enjoyed their happy hour, I want to go back and order off the regular menu, because everything looked delicious. And you can tell this place is popular because when we left at 8, it was packed!

This is our second time visiting vegas and we decided to try thai place other than Lotus of Siam. With good reviews, we decided to give this place a try. And we loved the experience!!! 

The servers were all welcoming and foods were amazing. We ordered crab rangoon, tom yun kung, duck pad thai, and red curry. All were delicious!! Crab rangoon was loaded with fillings inside with very thin wrap. Tom yum was great. Im not a huge fan of duck but since my fiance likes it we ordered pad thai with duck (which was listed as their specialty). Duck was really good! It didnt have strong duck smell and it was cooked perfectly. Very well done!!!!! Red curry was little too aqueous (i would have liked it little thicker) but it tasted really good. 

They have spicyness rating from 1-5 and i ordered 3 on all of mine and his was 4. If you love spicy foods then i think u can go for 5. Im not a big spicy handler but 4 was manageable to me. Definitely likes this place better than Lotus of Siam. I do feel Lotus of Siam may be more authentic and has more menus but Weera thai had plenty of menus to choose from with great atmosphere and friendly staff. And no waiting!!! We will definitely visit this place again

I can't say enough great things about Weera Thai! The food is plentiful and delicious, the staff here are incredibly kind, attentive, and helpful, and the wait time is short! We used yelp to discover this place a few months ago and we have been back 6 times since. By our second visit they recognized us and the manager always makes sure he takes the time to come over and say hello. There is not one thing I can complain about. The prices are beyond reasonable and no matter what time of day you go you will always be treated like family. I highly recommend Weera to everyone I speak to. I will be going back this coming weekend with a friend who has never been. I am excited to introduce her to real Thai street food.

I've been coming to this place for years, ever since it was just a small hole in the wall. It's probably been two years, but recently I went there and it's completely remodeled and nearly twice as big. So, I like Thai food. Usually I go to Archi's, which is a staple in Vegas. Other than Archi's, most thai places are all on the same level to me. The pad thai you get at one place is usually indistinguishable from the rest. Different story at Weera though. Even though this restaurant has grown and dolled-itself up since the hole-in-the-wall days, the food is flat out amazing. I moved about twenty minutes further away from Weera, but do not mind making the trek for food and atmosphere like this. I would say this is one of, if not THE best Thai restaurants in Vegas.

We came to this place based on recommendation. We ordered the mussel with chili sauce, dynamite chicken wings with larb sauce, yum naem moo yor and roast duck with red curry sauce. The food taste good. The service was pretty good. I gave them a 3 star just because the duck curry barely had any duck meat in it, there was only 4 pieces in it and some skin. I told our server about and she said next time to order extra meat and pay more. I am already paying $16 for the entree, I feel like I should get more than 4 pieces of meat and not to be told to pay more to get more.

Horrible waitress staff! Took 22 minutes to get asked for ANYTHING. Menu stated $4 Heineken before 8pm..got charged $7 each for Heineken even though I had them before 8pm! Silverware had dried old food on it from previous user wasn't washed correctly! Their was sticky rice all on the booth bench & a hair on my napkin. This place is gross! Now I know why they were caught 2 times on Las Vegas' dirty dining news!!! Never goin here again and I'll make sure to let all my friends know to NOT go here.

Clean, well taken care of spot that happens to deliver to my area so I am soooo lucky!
I am in love with their squid salad.
They love having kids at their restaurant too- with plates brought to the table especially for them. Excellent service!
Authentic Thai food, one of the best Thai restaurants i ate in the USA. The service was very good and the did a great job

Excuse Thai food quality food with good service 
Standard fare like Pang curry yellow curry and pad Thai were very good

Weera Thai is by far my most favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas.  The ambiance and decor is far from your standard Thai restaurant experience on Spring Mountain.  Sure, the prices are a little higher than others on Spring Mountain... but not by much.  Service here is on point.  We had two waitresses for our party of five and they did an incredible job of catering to our needs.  As for the food?  Money...

Sea Bass, Crab Fried Rice, Larb Chicken, Thai Beef Salad, Pad Thai, etc.  We shared the dishes amongst our table and and I will confidently say that everything was delicious.  The portions are a generous size and the dishes appear to be prepared  very cleanly (healthy) with little oil, etc.  I'm a fan and will be back again.
I like the new look, the menu is updated, the service is awesome! Food is authentically delicious

Checked in and got a free Thai ice tea.

Disappointed that what we ordered was not what was expected/ advertised. Pad see ew is my favorite and we also ordered Singapore noodle, and it depicted the Singapore noodle as thin angle hair noodles in the menu picture. However when the food came out, the noodles was just flat like the pad see ew dish. That in itself wouldn't be as big a problem but since the taste was so similar it essentially seemed like we ordered the same meal. Advise never ordering these two dishes together if you're sharing meals. Separately I'd rate it as average. I did enjoy the appetizer.
I love this place. Me and my coworkers always order at this restaurant. Very good food. I recommend this to everyone.

Delicious Thai option with reasonable prices. Worth going off the strip for! Mango salad was amazing. Crispy golden pouches and spring rolls were great. Tom kha soup was delicious. Crispy red curry duck was good as well.

I love the food here. My favorite is the medium hot beef salad. I called one day to make an order for pick up because I was sick, so I ordered the usual beef salad but this time I also asked for a Thai iced tea and asked if I could put a little ice. He said he would have to charge me extra for less ice. So I told them to scratch the ice tea off. Then he says, "ok, so you don't want to order anything" ummm. No why would I not want my salad I love and get at least once a week?! The fuck! I thought to myself. I should of gone somewhere else but I was sick and Hungry. Also what do you expect from an Asian place. Most Asian are bad with customer service.

Do not judge by location or outside appearance.... simply get yourself inside, meet the wonderfully friendly staff and eat some outstanding Thai! Start with the Crab Rangoon, it melts in your mouth, then move to the Coconut mushroom soup.... amazing! I finished with the Tofu Pad Thai (not a vegetarian by the way, just LOVE Tofu when it's cooked well). At the end of the night, for two.... WITH two glasses of wine and my partner had an entree as well (we split the "Small" soup that was huge) our bill was $35!! Yeah, that's right..... get there!

Giving this place 5 stars cuz they deserve it!! Good food good service, and they give you generous potions. 
This place is the number 1 on my list according to Thai food, even thought I don't live in Vegas anymore.. Thumbs up !! Weera team !!
we love the Thai food at Weera, can't wait to come back! the fried papaya salad is a gem, so is the happy hour. all the sauces and flavors are top notch. we are regulars now

I can't say enough good things about this place. Owners are terrific and the staff is fantastic. The food is terrific and seriously the best Thai food I have found in Las Vegas. It doesn't matter what you order it will be great. If you want pad Thai it's stellar, curry is amazing (all of them), the crab sticks are really a perfect appetizer, the spicy fried rice is epic, and the pork dishes are all fantastic. No matter what you like, veggies, seafood, pork, chicken, or curry dishes it is really amazing. See you there I am there all the time!!

Amazing place. I really enjoy the ambiance of the place- good music, good lighting, and clean. Was seated and served very quickly. Food came out fast and was delicious. I got the pepper garlic chicken and the flavors were mouthwatering.

We have ordered delivery several times via EAT24 and it is ridiculously fast!!!! Fresh, hot, and fast! 

Our favs are Pad Thai (no egg), Pad Kee Mao, and yellow curry. The crispy vegetable spring rolls we have also ordered before and they were yummy. Hot and crispy. 

The yellow potato curry is one of the best I have ever had. I love the way they cut the potatoes...big. 
It comes with steamed or brown rice. I love having the brown rice option! 

Pad Thai here is large and flavorful. We ask for no eggs and it comes with a large pile of sprouts and I love the ground peanuts and slice fresh lime.

The Pad Kee Mao (I get it medium and wow it's pretty spicy) is full of yummy Thai basil and big fresh flat noodles. 

The portions are big here and the prices are on target. 

We are fans of Komol but for different reasons. My husband said Weera's food is better...but I like Komol more because of their herbal salad. 

No mock meats here at Weera, just fresh Thai with the option of tofu. We get the extra veggie option instead of tofu.

Been going here for many years   best shrimp pineapple rice , and roasted BBQ pork are delicious. 

Good service , good admosphe , I tried most Thai in town this is my favorite. EM
Authentic Is all I have to add. I love the dining experience. Reminded me of my moms cooking. Not to the T but still a hint of home :)

One of my favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. Extremely clean and great food.

The reason I only gave them a 3 is because 50% of the time I dine here the soup is just warm and the food is not hot enought  (temp). They need to solve this problem and fast. Fancy decor and low prices are not the only thing customers want. Please turn your fire up and serve the food fast dont let it sit under a warmer.
Great food. Great service. Red curry is borderline perfect! I am now a regular.

Best Thai food that I have had in a while.  It is in a sketchy mall area, but don't be quick to judge. Been here twice and I haven't been disappointed.
