Food is very flavorful, spice level is accurate, plus a free thai tea with a yelp check in.  Friendly and efficient service. My new go to Thai place!

Wow wow weeeeee!!!! This is a great spot for some good authentic Thai food.  Service was amazing and food came out fast.  

Met the owner and thanked every table for coming in.  That is great service to me. 

Had the Thai basil chicken, spicy level 4.  It was soooo good and had me sweating.  (A good thing) They had a huge variety of lunch options and is great to take clients to or a great lunch spot for your lunch hour.  

Inside decor is very nice and comfortable.  

You will not be disappointed.  Best Thai food I have had in Las Vegas.

I've never sat down and ate here, but they deliver, and love ordering for lunch here my shop. The Pineapple Fried Rice with Chicken is my Favorite....always satisfied! and the Veggie Soup is the BOMB...

I'm a big fan of this place, we always frequent here when we get a chance to go. I know before they weren't open on Sundays but I'm glad they are now because we are able to go have lunch. I pretty much like everything they have, especially offering Thai-Issan food. My favorite I like to order is the beef nam tok (medium) with sticky rice and it does come out pretty spicy for me but it's good.

We've tried a lot of the soups and they are very good too. I would totally recommend this place to everyone I know because I thought I've had real Thai food in Vegas until I came upon this place. The staff is very nice and gotta love the Thai Tea :)
Very tasty...Rainbow fried rice was excellent...pineapple, avocado, peppers, cashews, onions. Thai Pumpkin Curry w/tofu was awesome!!! Definitely a good choice!!!
Chicken penang curry was on point. Took to go on a Saturday night. It looked super busy but it was good.

My 3nd time in this place but I am never disappointed. Their phad Thai is way much more flavorful and the Panang Curry has the right creamy spicy taste but of course you can always select the degree of spice you want in your food. Even their mixed vegetables with tofu  is surely a winner. If you check in in yelp, you also get a free Thai iced tea. They have a list of delicious desserts as well. I like this place compared to Archie's. I will definitely come back. Not only that they have fast service the price is great too. Sure win.

I really like this place.   The service is genuine and fast.  They have a dynamic Happy Hour menu with reasonable regional drinks.  There were so many tantalizing item on the dinner menu, we ordered quite a few.  
Had the Green Curry - spicy but good.   Definitely worth a couple of visits.

perfect thai restaurant in las vegas. if u missed thai food, u should go try it. u will not regret. friendly. good food. reasonable price. except one thing. thai tea is not refillable.  means they charge every order. if a lady asks u, "more tea?" u know what you have to do.

The food is great. But the DELIVERY service is HORRIBLE. I live fairly close to the restaurant, maybe a 5-7 minute drive. It usually gives me an estimated delivery of 45 mins from the time they receive and confirm the order. But it is never here within even 60 minutes, it's usually closer to 75-90 minutes. Always. And the order is wrong probably 25% of the time. And they NEVER even apologize, let alone offer to send me the correct order or give me some free egg rolls or something. That being said- the quality of food is still great.

We were in search of another Thai restaurant that was as good, if not better than, Archi's on Flamingo. Yelp reviews led us to this restaurant. I would have to say that this is an exceptional place for Northern Thai food! 

They have a happy hour from about 4-7pm, but they extended the offer until 9pm today. So, I tried their Crispy Papaya Salad with shrimp offered at $5.00. This was amazing! The dressing is a slightly sweet lime juice, which goes great with the julienned papaya, cut green beans, tomatoes, and peanuts. 

For an entree, I chose the Red Curry Pumpkin at spicy level of two. This Thai red curry has Thai spices, chilies, bamboo shoots & coconut milk, with your choice of meat. I selected the crab meat. It was served in a huge oblong bowl with brown rice on the side. The flavors were sublime! It was a generous portion for less than $15.00.

For dessert, I had to try the mango and sticky rice to compare to Archi's. Although it was a large portion with fresh ripe mangoes that were delectable, the sticky rice and coconut milk was a little too sweet for my liking. To avoid this in the future, I could order the coconut milk on the side.

I enjoyed their Jasmine hot tea with dinner and dessert. The china was beautiful. The service was excellent! The restaurant was super clean and nicely decorated, and the menu offers something for everyone.

Update:

Since my first review, I have been back to enjoy some of the same favorites with the same quality, presentation, and service as previously given - all excellent!

This time I tried a couple new appetizers like the crab rolls (pictured). They were really good! I also tried the beef jerky. This is another great appetizer (pictured).

I think this is hands down the best green papaya salad I've had in my life. If you love that stinky crab in your salad, you've got to give this place a try. Everything else we ordered was good as well, but what stood in my my is that green papaya salad. I can't wait until I'm back in Vegas again to pay this place another visit.
I'm not usually a huge Thai food fan, but this place is really good.  Authentic Thai cuisine with a huge menu. Tried the Issan sausage which was delicious.

When I think Thai food.. I say Weera Thai! This one of my favorite places to dine in with family and friends. The selections of appetizers, soups, noodles and the main entrees make it difficult to decide :)
Papaya salad with shrimp had the perfect crunch paired with a dressing that has a nice blend of sweetness and acidity. The Tom Kah Kung coconut soup with shrimp and mushroom is a family favorite. The broth is so flavorful with fresh lemon grass, cilantro and kaffir leaves surely revive my senses! The pad see ewe with beef never disappoint. The sauce is not to sweet or salty. It always has a good portion of meat, noodles and Chinese broccoli.
The Happy Hour menu is another added bonus! The service is outstanding and always open to accommodation. Take advantage and call ahead since this place can get super busy! This place is overdue. You've earned my 5 stars!

Found this place on a recent trip to Vegas. This place is one of the best Thai restaurants I visited in my 20 years in the USA from Thailand. This is the place for Isaan (northeast Thailand) dishes. My favorite is the Tom Saab-spicy and flavorful. Oh, the fried oyster is great, too. This is one of the dishes that not many places can do it well. But Weera Thai can make it so that I can say "wow!" after the first bite. The staff are very nice and friendly, too.

It is a nice ,clean place unfortunately located between 2 massage businesses. Its street location is not the best either. HOWEVER, the food was good. So was the service. To compare, I would say that it is as good as the CURRENT Lotus of Siam but not as good as the Lotus before its expansion and opening in NYC. The service is definitely BETTER than Lotus of Siam. We had the crispy shrimps and spring rolls for appetizers and would give a 4.5 to the spring rolls but a 4 to the shrimps. The seabass with garlic sauce was just right. The pangnan beef was good. So was the groundpork basil stirfry. It is a good solid 4+ Thai restaurant that appears to need a little help to stay around because of factors other that food and service. Best of luck. I definitely would return.

Weera is simply the best! We live on the other side of town but we will not hesitate to drive if we will eat here. Their food tastes fresh and authentic. They expanded their dining area and decorated it beautifully which adds to a great dining experience. 

Tonight we had their Calamari, Roasted Duck, and Pineapple fried rice with crab meat which are all excellent. My favorite was the Calamari which comes with 2 kinds of sauces (sweet and spicy) 

Service is also good, however not really a fast service and there can be quite a wait for your food to come but it's worth it.

Yesterday, we went to this Thai restaurant which the location was not that great but the food was delicious.  We started out with Tod Mun Pla (Thai Fish Cake) and it was very good and not hard like other Thai Restaurant. We also had the Larb Duck which the flavor was awesome. Then we proceed with the Kana Moo Krob (Crispy Pork Belly with Chinese Broccoli) and Tom Sab which is like the Isarn soup with a little spice and tangy flavor both of it was very flavorful.  If you are out of town try this little joint and you won't be disappointed.
Good value.  Great food.  Excellent Service!

Ambiance:  The location of the restaurant is in Sahara, the front doesn't look fancy nor does the signage show any type of flare. However when you get inside the restaurant the decor is really nice, Thai inspired decorations remind you that you are in a Thai restaurant.

Service: Service was good, the waitress that served my family was knowledgeable about the food and gave good recommendations which allowed us to try different entrees. The servings are huge and the wait staff was attentive.

Food: There has been a history in Weera Thai when the restaurant was listed in dirty dining a few months back so we waited for a few months for the restaurant to fix the issues. Weera Thai did not disappoint taste wise. The food we ordered was great, we ordered the squid which is hard to  time if it stays too long to cook in the hot wok, crab rice, papaya salad and some appetizers all turned out great. 

Overall: Great place for family style dining, the food is good and service is great. Overall this Thai resto is one of the good Thai resto's in the city of Las Vegas. Will look forward to trying their other entrees and will expect the food to be great.
Favorite Thai restaurant in town! And I've tried other places for convenience sake but nothing compares to Weera
Great food and excellent service! Our server was very nice. We actually came back because we loved it so much!
Incredible!!  Fresh food.  Restaurant was spotless.  Including the restrooms.  Great service.   Highly recommend!
weera thai has great food and service!!

Found this place on Yelp in the "nearby me" deals section.  

Great choice on our part! We got 3 entrees, a hot tea and an appetizer.  
-thick noodles, yellow curry and panag curry and fresh egg rolls....all were sooo yummy! We also got there at 9:30 which was perfect timing since they close at 10.  

With our deal from yelp the total was 22 dollars! so perfect and exactly what were were looking for.  The chicken is a much better option than the tofu.  We got the chicken with the yellow curry and tofu with panag....for some reason the yellow curry came out more like a stew and the tofu in the panag wasnt very juicy which was too bad.
If you are looking for awesome  authentic Thai food, this is a must stop. A must dish to try is the cat fish salad!! Finish the dinner with mango sticky rice.

A friend and i were in Vegas for a quick trip and looking for a place that would either deliver to the hotel or had a free shuttle to the restaurant. 

We found this place on a Las Vegas restaurant site; called and asked for the shuttle and the guy came right on time.
We got to the restaurant and noticed they had some regional Thai specialties so we ordered some, got the yelp deal on a smart  phone while waiting and enjoyed the great meal. 

Yelp deal was used easily, no hassles, then we asked for the shuttle to take us back to the hotel. Imagine my mortification when we were told the "shuttle driver" would be with us shortly because he was also the chef!!! He came out, told us not to worry about it and give him a couple minutes and then got us back to our hotel in no time after a short wait!

4 stars for the food
5 stars for the service!

Weera Thai is a solid restaurant. Fully packed around lunch time, has some good food.

- Lunch combo
- Yellow curry
- Crispy chicken

And finally, received a check-in bonus vanilla ice cream as a dessert. Pretty good.

Love this always amazing 
Clean place ,. Servers, and bathrooms.
I have been here several times and I am always pleased with everything.

First time here. Place very unassuming. Utter ugliness on the outside but beautiful inside. Came here for lunch. Quick service. Food is very good. Our waitress is friendly. Nice decor, nice plates, big serving. Allowed us to take out our Thai tea as we were too stuffed without charging us extra, against their policy. Got free ice cream for checking in on yelp. Will come back again. They have a stamp card.
This place has yet to disappoint and always hits the spot. The yellow curry is excellent.
Love it. So good and quick delivery if you're in the area. Green curry chicken and pad Thai are awesome. Also the fresh rolls with shrimp.

My favorite authentic thai food restaurant in Vegas!! Have been coming here even before their renovation & service is always great and consistent. We usually get the yellow curry or panang with crispy chicken, absolute best! But our order never stops there, everything is phenomenal!

10/10 overall

Costumer service: Exceptional, sweet and great mannerisms. 

Cleanliness: Most cleanest restaurant I've been to in Southern Nevada.

Food: There food was amazing! I got the Lao papaya salad combination with barbaque chicken and cabbage. The papaya salad was more Amercanized then I expected. I was missing my mom's homemade Lao food and it wasn't close to authentic Lao papaya salad. I do admit I choose to get mild spice flavor and it tasted so much like something my mom or step dad would make for a toddler's version of papaya salad. The barbaque chicken was amazing out of the entire dish! My boyfriend got crab rangoon and the plain beef and cashew stir fry. The crab rangoon was very simple and wonderful. Crab rangoon should be simple and other restaurants add too many spices to out do other locations to get the American market. The plain beef and cashew stir fry was 10/10 since he ate the entire dish without sharing any with me. Haha. 

Weera Thai has became our Thai go to restaurant and we'll be back. A wonderful hole in the wall restaurant within a plaza with a lot of sketchiness.
This place served a real authentic Thai food. reasonable price. Love it!!
The food is great! And love their soup. So tasty! The price match the quantity. Comes with lots of food. Would like to come back again!
My first time at this restaurant. We order many dishes. Papaya salad is excellent. Panang Curry chicken is to die for. The pompano fish is superb. Highly recommended.

I love Thai food. I know it is not the healthiest type of food out there nor is it doing me any favors in my quest to lose the rest of the baby weight, but I love it nevertheless. We have been here on a number of occasions for lunch and I have been pleased with my dish and service on all of those occasions.

From the exterior it looks like a dumpy place next to a massage parlor on Sahara, but as usual the interior tells a different story. It is warm and inviting with elegant decor on the inside. The service has always been friendly and to the point.

We tried their special which was Red Snapper in Panang sauce, and wow! It was such a flavorful dish masterfully prepared. Beware though, it is a large portion and enough for both my husband and I to share. We have also tried their appetizer sampler and absolutely loved it. It is rare to order a sampler and love everything on the plate, but I did. It consisted of cream cheese ragoons, stuffed chicken wings, spring rolls with several types of sauce including peanut, and sweet and sour type varying in intensity. I also enjoyed their combination drunken noodles with a generous portion of meats and shrimp. I intend on sampling more of their menu, but it is also hard not to stick to the dishes I've already tried since they are so good!

I highly recommend this place!
OMG it was so authentic Thai food. I am a native Thai and know what good Thai food is like. I would recommend anyone to try.

The mango salad is delicious and fresh.the chicken larb is very flavorful and has alot of texture to it. I love their thai tea and the crab sticks are the best I have ever had. They are crunchy on the outside with a delicious flavor of crab inside. The plum sauce if fresh and compliments them well.

Dinner on Mother's Day was superb.  We were a large group and they handled our table really well. The workers are all genuinely friendly and seem glad to serve. And the food is always excellent.  From the outside, the restaurant doesn't look all that appealing. Once inside, the newly remodeled place changes the whole atmosphere from iffy to really quite nice.  The price is super reasonable.  Can't wait to go back!
I absolutely love this place!!! When I'm in the mood for inexpensive Thai food this is where I go!!

I had the Chicken Panang curry, brown rice and some spring rolls to go.  The food was ready pretty quickly which is what I want when I'm hungry and driving home.  They gave me 10% off for Yelp which was cool even though it said "dine in" only.  There were a ton of spring rolls in the take out box and the peanut sauce was pretty yummy.  They asked me how spicy I wanted the curry so I said a "2" on a 1 to 5 scale.  2 was pretty spicy for this white girl but it wasn't too hot to eat.  I would definitely go back there.

I had high hopes for this place, especially since it is closer to me and less crowded than Lotus of Siam. Slowly my hope faded away.  We got seated right away and served glasses of water, but it took fifteen minutes before our order was taken...and we had our menus closed for about 12 of those minutes.  My waitress was not familiar with the wines they were serving and more importantly the food that they were serving. I do not eat any sugar, so I asked about the duck salad warning her I can only eat very little sugar.  I asked her what was in it, she couldn't tell me specifically, just said  vegetables and duck.  I asked her about the sauce, she said it was not sweet, I asked her if the sauce could be put on the side, she said, "No."  However, she came with the alternative that the chef prepare the Duck salad without using sugar. I accepted and ordered the duck salad with 3 star spice.  I then asked about the wines, she knew nothing about wines (fine, I understand not everyone drinks) and quietly flipped over the menu that showed "Pairings".  My husband ordered the Tom Yum Kai and Pork Ka Pow , without any modifications other than 3 star spice.  We shared the soup and agreed that if was mostly a premade soup base, which they used too much of.  The broth was too intense, yet not what I would think was 3 star spiciness.   His Ka Pow was very bland and had no resemblance to the Ka Pows we've ordered at other places or made at home.  We had to ask for the chili condiment kit to adjust the spice.  My duck salad was very disappointing given the price and alterations she said they could do...Very little duck, atleast a half mango (she didn't mention there was fruit- again I can't eat sugar including sweet fruit, and then the salad was dressed in a very sweet sauce...even my husband who is sugar tolerant said it was too sweet).  Needless to say, it was disappointing...my Thai craving is still craving.

I don't know why this place has 4.5 stars. The food is not really good. The pad Thai was orange, real pad Thai is yellowish light brown. The dishes don't taste like Thailand. They taste more Laos but Americanized. Fried rice was strange tasting. Service was okay. Location is far from strip or main areas.

I've been here maybe 4-5 times and I must say the quality seems to have gone downhill. I always order the pineapple fried rice and this time it tasted blah and they added carrots to it and I'm not sure why... Messed up on our second 2nd order (which should have been sea bass in garlic sauce, which the first time we ordered it was a very small plate for $17) in which we didn't try. Kinda wish we did because our 3rd order came out cold (spicy duck) so we sent it back and decided to stick with the pineapple fried rice.

Good thing I suppose because I had planned on using a $30 living social deal, but my friends used a groupon now deal and they refused to let us use both, even though it was separate checks and my friends came in and ordered way before we got there. They told us we could sit elsewhere and they would take it, otherwise the "big man upstairs" was watching and they would get in trouble if they took both. They were nice though and even asked if we wanted to still ordered which obviously we did, but it just turned into a big disappointment.

Last visit we had similar issues (cold food that was overly salty which they tried to fix, but ended up tasting even worse, but they took it off the bill at least) and while the sea bass in garlic sauce was really good, the portion size and sticker price left us feeling like we should have just ordered more pineapple fried rice.

Unfortunately I probably won't be coming back here if I can get a refund on my livingsocial coupon, otherwise it'll probably be the last time and I'll be just going to Pin Kaow from now on.

I actually live very close to this restaurant, close enough that I found their menu at my doorstep offering delivery. Being the cook that I'm not, I ordered food from them numerous times. With great prices and even better delivery time, I'm a fan of Weera.

I've eaten their green papaya salad many times. They always make it without shrimp as requested. My son likes their mixed vegetables with chicken and I've ordered their cashew nut dish with beef, too. Of course, sticky rice. Everything has always been good.

I've picked up food or had it delivered. The service has always been friendly and timely. I'll be ordering more again soon, especially since I've seen many deals going on now!

Great service.
Clean restaurant with nice decor.
We both had lunch specials. They came with soup, salad, AND spring rolls. So yummy and filling. So inexpensive. Highly recommend. 

My hubby had the red curry, I had spicy basil chicken. We would both recommend them and probably get them again.

Keep up the great work!

I dont know who thought this restaurant was one of the top 3 thai restaurants in las vegas, They definitely havent tried alot then. I could easily name 5 other thai places that blow this place out of the water. My wife and i went their because of a living social deal. And we ended up with food poisoning. The meat they served us was very questionable. I am pretty sure that beef that is white is not normal. I hope this is a good warning for people who want to try this place.
Love this place! I would highly recommend to anyone in town. Free Thai tea is an added plus!

Yummy food and very fresh even when delivered. We had the pot stickers and they honestly saved my life. We had the drunken noodle and chicken fried rice. They both were fresh and delic. Only wish they had cut the basil more.

Food is good. It's in an unassuming strip mall on Sahara so keep an eye out for it. Service is great and the lunch specials are even better. I've been here several times at this point. 

It's a good staple Thai place which I keep going back to if that's any indicator. 

I can't say there is one thing that  really stands out above the rest other than service, cleanliness, and overall price. But let's be honest, Thai food is the Mexican food of Asia. I love and crave them both...but it's really hard to differentiate oneself for any other restaurant.

It's worth the visit and the people are really nice. They have a decent beer and wine selection too.

BF and I had a god-awful thai experience at Pam Real Thai recently, but were still craving a good Thai meal. A friend recommended Weera, and in we went on a Thursday evening.

Happy Hour menu of apps and half price drinks from 6:00-9:45PM, we opted for the fresh duck spring rolls ($8)- a huge portion served with a tasty marmalade-like dipping sauce. The rolls were packed with duck and fresh herbs, most notably the flavorful mint that other places skimp on or leave out all together. Definitely a dish I'd order again.

Next we shared a hot pot of tom kha kai, which was delicious and boiling hot, packed with tons of chicken, cilantro, mushrooms, and ginger. Very flavorful, really hit the spot.

BF chose the beef pad se ew entree, at the recommendation of our super-sweet server- and we were not disappointed. The noodles were super fresh and chewy, great texture that was almost like velvet. I haven't had fresher noodles since we were in Chinatown in the Bay area.

Last, we opted to box up our entree leftovers and share a dessert: mango and sticky rice. It was plated beautifully, and the flavors were spot-on: mango was perfectly ripe, rice was warm and had the perfect texture, and the sweetness was not too overwhelming. 

Service from both of the ladies working throughout our visit was top notch: drinks were refilled before they even got half empty, we were checked on repeatedly between courses, and they had radiant smiles on their faces every second. I've received lesser service at five-star with much higher price tags (and expectations). The service here was genuinely the absolute best I've had in recent memory- and their food was top of the line, too. Food is priced well: for all of the above, our bill was under $40 before tip. This is definitely a place we'll be back.

This is a nice little clean Thai food place. I have eaten there about 9 times and I have never been disappointed. The service is great the servers know me so they always to take a seat any place they are very nice my food is fresh tasty and prepared in a timely fashion. And they never rush you to hurry up I want to give this place four and a half stars but I didn't know how to make that  star half so they got 4 stars good place to try it out.

Great food but better if you eat in.  The portions can be a little smaller when you order to-go.  I would have given them a 5-star but my husband ordered a full fish and asked for it be wrapped up.  It was a $40 item and did not get included in the doggy bags.  Service is generally great and very friendly.

Just got back from my first experience at Weera Thai and I am very excited. This place has really good Thai food for reasonable prices. The lunch special was $7 and  is the best Thai food I have had.  This place will be a regular spot for me and I will definitely be taking my friends and family there when they come to visit.
Big portions that are light on seafood or meat. Flavors ok, one dish was way too salty. Won't be back.

We ordered delivery from here twice while we were on vacation in Las Vegas. We were happy that they delivered to the Westgate Resort, though I had to meet them outside the hotel because they aren't allowed to deliver to the rooms apparently. They will instruct you to meet them at the valet parking (this is the main entrance to the hotel on the west side). However, it would be much smarter to meet guests either at the North Tower or East Tower entrance. It's less busy here and more convenient access from the guest rooms. Sometimes the valet/main entrance area has 50+ cars including buses and taxis moving in and out. Not to mention that it's a hike from here back to your room. The North or East Tower Entrances would be much more convenient for their customers, which should be the focus. However, delivery was quite fast and the food was great. 

During our two meals, we had the Mongolian beef, BBQ pork, beef stir fry with garlic pepper sauce (excellent), seafood soup w/shrimp, spicy pork, egg rolls, and papaya salad. Everything was very tasty, though my wife thought the papaya salad wasn't consistent with the Isaan-style papaya salad she's used to. And I wouldn't recommend the Mongolian beef as it is nowhere near as good as most Mongolian beef that I've had at Chinese restaurants. And that's probably the key - this is a Thai restaurant and the Mongolian beef is a Chinese (or Chinese-American) dish. The beef stir fry with garlic pepper sauce however was excellent. The Thai egg rolls also excellent. 

The total came to $50 on one occasion and $60 on the 2nd occasion. Which I think is a bit pricey for 2 entrees, 2 appetizers, and no drinks/desert. So minus -1 star for being a bit over priced.  Recommended.

I am a self professed noodle freak! Not to mention my burning desire to have my nose run, and lips sting. Bingo...Thai food is the answer to my burning question...whats for lunch?  The restaurant is small and quaint. The staff  is friendly. Thai Crab Rangoon are fabulous, small packages bulging with cream cheese, crispy and delicate, served with a lightly sweet sauce. Chicken pot stickers were meaty, yet tender. I chose the Pad Kee Mao to satisfy my noodle need. Add a heaping helping of the table condiments to assist in clearing out my sinuses and I'm a very happy girl, runny nose, stinging lips, and full tummy...mission accomplished!
Great food and the price is right. Love the papaya salad and the whole fish was great.

I would occasionally have intense cravings for Thai food. Today was definitely one of those days. Decided to see if Weera Thai could feed me delicious food and satisfy my taste buds. I rarely come to this area but it was worth the trip. 

Crab sticks- long thin deep fried rolls with crab meat inside served with a sweet sauce. Watch out! This one was pretty hot when it arrived at our table so wait a little for it to cool down. If your fingers find it hot, your tongue will hate you if you can't practice delayed gratification. It's delicious, with a crispy exterior and delicious crab meat inside. 

Pad See Ew with chicken- I thought this was decent. But then again, I don't know how you can screw up pad see ew. Or can you? Not bad although I've had better. No praises but also no complaints. 

Red Curry with Chicken- A tad watery for me but great flavor. I couldn't stop eating it. So good. Love the bamboo slices so much I almost neglected the chicken.

Thai iced tea here is super sweet. I always crave one when I'm eating at a Thai restuarant but I had to water it down to drink it. But then again, maybe it's me. My tolerance for sweets probably went down as I find a lot of things too sweet lately. 

Service here is friendly and attentive. They come by your table frequently to check on things. 

Would I come here again? Yes!

Service was awful. Person taking our order was rude and wouldn't let me speak as I was trying to explain to her I didn't want mushrooms or tomato on my tum yum soup
Unacceptable tone while talking to me. The only reason why I didn't complain is because i had family with me and friends. Disrespectful to speak over the customer. I work customer service and this people have no idea what that means.
Phenomenal thai food and one of the few places that delivers downtown. I think Lotus of Siam is best thai in town but Weera is a close second and delivers!
Mmmmmmm the Tom Ka Kai was absolutely delicious and hit the spot. Not to mention the pick up service was super fast.
Food is good. Service & environment a little strange, but it's doable.
Great Thai Food. My favorite dish is the drunken noodles with yellow curry-L7. My favorite appetizer is the chicken Satay. I recommend this place for anyone looking for Thai Food in Vegas

Food was pretty good. A little further off the strip than I would like & with so many options near the strip although ill give food two thumbs up slight chance I wouldn't go out way to visit again. However if I'm in dying need of an Thai craving while in Vegas this would be the place 2 go. Friendly Staff

Sio Mai was tasty, fried duck was superb, try the shrimp wrapped in fried noodles.  Pampano fish was crispy and good with the pineapple fried rice. Thai iced go wasn't too sweet, loved it. Ambience is awesome, food is definitely a competitor of Siam.  The staff was quick and ready to help. I totally would come back here.
Authentic Thai food .. Good service . My favorite place to eat . The staffs are very friendly and the price is very affordable
Favorite Thai food in town !! I'm very picky when it comes to Thai food since I'm from Thailand. Especially Issaan menu, papaya salad, sausages, catfish salad....Make me feel like home !
Come here during happy hour which is 4-8! Their food is awesome and the price isn't bad either. Our server, Tanita was awesome as well. Great food and great service. Definitely coming back

Been here several times but today we decided to celebrate my son's birthday here! Absolutely AMAZING! Really nice people and their food...DELICIOUS! The price is fair and food presentation is always wonderful.

I had ordered for fish cakes and fried shrimps. The fish cakes were ok and the shrimps were a bit heavy. The quantity of food was decent. I tried the yellow curry fried rice with Shrimps and Chicken and they were good. The coconut desert was pretty nice. Overall a good place outside the strip. Cheap, clean place and good friendly servers

The crispy duck salad is amazing! I have had this three times and they always put a lot of crispy duck that complements a tangy salad of greens, cherry tomatoes, Papaya, cashews and more. 

I have also had the pad sew eww which was great but I would have like more veggies, but the noodles and sauce are perfect- fresh and delicious.

One item that surprised me was the mango sticky rice. I typically don't indulge in these kind of desserts, but I was pregnant and it sounded good. Now it is a standard when I go here and I'm not even pregnant anymore! The sweet rice comes with a always ripe mango and a warm milky sauce. Delish!

Always great food and I have been and ordered delivery. Great service for both!

The food is top notch.  So is the service.  I have been to dozens of Thai restaurants in Las Vegas, and Weera Thai is one of the best if not THE best.  Quality is consistent, as is customer service, no matter how busy the restaurant is.  I just wish they were 24 hrs!  I'll be back very soon...

So impressed with the renovation and the new style and concept. I have been here twice but a few years back, today was the first time trying this place after post renovation. 

Food has always been good but the place went from casual, quick food to more modern and have more unique items. The new design is very pretty, more modern, brighter, nice and clean. They also expanded so the restaurant is larger now, great for large and small parties. 

We were greeted immediately, water was brought out as soon as we sat down. Their Thai Tea is soooo good, you can clearly smell and taste the tea and not too sweet to where you get sick of it easily, plus the tea came in a large glass, definitely bigger than other places. Our waitress Arunothai was so nice, she made recommendations, answered questions and was so patient as we looked through our menu (their menu is huge! so many options!!).

They have the big menu and they have a smaller brown menu that you should definitely ask for, our waitress said the items on the brown menu are authentic Thai items. 

We ordered total of 7 items and the two that stood out were the Pork Liver Larb and the Fried Catfish Papaya Salad. The larb is cooked medium based on our server's reccomendation, and it was delicious, the liver was so soft, the sauce tasted amazing! This dish was gone pretty quickly! The catfish was very different, have never had something like this. The catfish is shredded and mixed with...something...then deep fried with papaya salad on top with salted duck egg and pork skin on the side. First of all this dish is HUGE, definitely can be shared. We love papaya salad, order it every time we go eat Thai, the catfish and the salted egg are nice addition of the traditional salad.  

The stir fried clams was also very good, lots of clams compared to other places where you get a bunch of empty shells. The sauce was amazing, sweet and salty, and a little spicy! We ordered 8 items but only 7 was brought out, which was fine since we were stuffed. 

We ordered 7 items, 2 extra rice bowls, a pot of tea, and a Thai tea and the check came out under $100. Not expensive at all, great price, great portion, good service, and good food. Will definitely come back for more.

A locals favorite! From the exterior you may question if you should go in, but you should. The inside is very nice and clean! Weera Thai offers a huge menu with many options plus a great happy hour menu too. So many delicious options to choose from. My favorites: Thai beef salad, roasted duck pad thai, mango and sticky rice just to name a few.
Very authentic thai cuisine... love every dishes here. I'm thai and trust me when I'm saying real authentic I meant very real authentic thai foods!

Small restaurant but amazing food! I had the tofu fresh spring rolls and they were the best I've ever had!! Hole in the wall but decently priced for Vegas and a great place to have a peaceful and quiet dinner away from all the crazy nightlife.
Excellent food and service. Very authentic Thai food. Nice decor also.

Very good Thai food, nice and clean 
Great test I go this restaurant a lot when I go Vegas ,
First time here, and we liked it. Everything was fresh and delicious, except the clams were not very fresh and had some strange taste. The server was very friendly. Great service.

I've been eating here with all my friends and family since the day this place was open (without the remodel) and this review is way past due...
I tried a lot of Thai food in Las Vegas but the best Thai food I ever had was at Weera Thai everything about this place from atmosphere, people/employees that work there are really friendly. 
The food is delicious all the employees pretty much know me and I get the best service. I'm always happy when I leave this place I will recommend this place to everybody to go try their food; you will love it!

Excellent food. Fantastic service. Did I mention excellent food? From the moment we walked in to being seated to being served. It was all consistent. Food presentation and taste bothe excellent. Loved Weera Thai! It was our first visit. And, it was my birthday! Perfect ending to a great day. We'll definitely be back. Our new favorite neighborhood thai spot. Love it!

We found this place by mistake and thank you Lord! Everything was perfect. Had Tom yum soup, crap rolls, pepper chicken, and fried rice. 
A good sign was everyone in here was Thai. 
We only came in for a late lunch and 1 dish we ended up with all of the above. If you crave Thai try this and do not be afraid of where it is as it is in the middle of a strip mall with a few other restaurants. 
Give this gem a try you will not be disappointed.

I found an online deal for this place the last time my husband and I were in Vegas and thought that it would be fun to give it a try( we find that the restaurants on the strip are over rated) 

This place was just hat we needed! It was empty when we arrived, but everything came out of the kitchen fresh and favorful. The staff was also very accommodating(my husband and I are vegetarian...so they were great about not including any fish sauce, etc. in the curries that we ordered.)

My husband had the red curry with tofu, which was yummy and I had the spicy eggplant with tofu. Both dishes were piping hot and served with rather large portions. We asked for both to be medium spicy and the spice was just right. The red curry had great cocounut flavor(wasn't overpowered by the coconut milk). Both dishes were served with rice. We had little doggy bags to take home because we coudn't eat anymore!

I'm glad I found this place and it definitely satisfied our Thai craving.
Love these guys! My favorite thai in town! Always great customer service and ALWAYS great food!

I have been to Weera a couple times now, first for the Yelp deal, and recently for a quick, cheap dinner. Their crab fried rice is excellent, uses real crab meat and is a large portion. Their orange chicken is great! It is crispy, orangey, and hot when it comes out. Spring rolls and peanut sauce were awesome as well. The rolls were nice, crispy, and very fresh. The sauce was flavorful and did not taste like it was previously stored. The only downside I see here is the pop background music, not a fan of listening to top 40's while I'm eating.

Good Thai food and definitely 5 stars for convenience. 

We arrived to Vegas tired and hungry. Got to our hotel and ordered delivery for the Pineapple fried rice, Pork green curry and pad see ew. $5 charge to have hot tasty food delivered to us was an amazing relief. 

There wasn't much traffic on the strip so it took about 20 minutes to arrive after ordering. Thank you!! So much better than room service :)

Thank you Yelp for helping me find this gem! I was browsing through Yelp and they had a deal $10 for $20. The reviews were good, so I bought the deal. I am glad I did. I have been to Thailand and love Thai food. This place had Kana (Chinese broccoli), it wasn't listed as a side, but I requested a plate of it and they delivered. It was good. 
The best part of the meal was the Tom Yum Kai. It was like what I had when visiting Thailand. The lemongrass really shined in this soup. I loved it.
This establishment offers Issan style food, which is a great benefit and sometimes hard to find. Duck is all over the menu, which is a bonus as well. 
Everything we had was delicious and we will definitely be back.

Absolutely delicious Thai food!  We were in the mood for Thai food tonight and used Yelp as a guide to find a good place.  The reviews did not lie, as everything, including the superlative service, was awesome.  I ordered my Curry very hot (5, on their 1-5 scale), and although it was not as hot as I usually like, the heat/flavor balance was great.

This place would get 4-stars, if not for the service.  Their pad thai is some of the best I've ever had.  They have other solid menu items, and for a great price.

I have been here about 10 times.  On my last visit, I ordered a pad-thai with no spices (like I always do).  The dish came out very spicy, uneatable for me.  I told the waitress, who said that I couldn't send the dish back.  I told her to ask the manager, which she did, and was told I had to accept the dish.  I said it was too spicy, I don't eat spices and this wasn't what I ordered, so I wasn't paying for it.  She said okay, so I ate my other (I was really hungry) dishes and left for the Hawaiian place next door (which is amazing).

That was the most absurd experience I've ever had in a restaurant.  The management clearly didn't care that either their waitress (who barely spoke English) or their cook messed up my order and a repeat customer was unhappy.  With actions like that, I'm hard pressed to see how they will stay in business.

We just had the lunch special here. I had Mongolian beef, and my son had pad Thai. The flavors are really wonderful. The  spicy food is spicy or you can order less spicy too. Lunch specials a very reasonable price too. Try it, you'll enjoy it!

Love this place whenever I have a chance to visit Vegas I need to order food from Weerathai they have huge menu and authentic thai hard to find in other place. My all time favorite dish is Nam Khao Tod taste same like I ever had in Thailand love it so much...really recommended!!

I've been here twice. I've only tried their tofu pad Thai and it was really yummy. I also ordered a Thai tea... mmm. Customer service needs a little attention according to their friendliness. Other than that, a very nice place to eat at. Nice decor. Nice ambiance.
Best Thai food! I ordered yellow curry fried rice and it was absolutely delicious. They are generous with food quantity and the price is reasonable too.

I'm Thai and I love coming here to eat the food.  They have a great menu and wonderful service.  I've tried many different plates here and I haven't had a bad thing yet.  

If you like Thai food please come check this place out.  Great, friendly, clean and amazing food and service.

The people here,  especially TK the waiter, makes this place feel like walking into moms home kitchen after a long day.  The food is solid. The details like the decor and ambiance and presentation are well thought out. You can tell someone is putting the profits back into the place.   You can tell that this place is their baby and they're proud of it and spoil it.  There are are too many restaurants in town that feel like they're trying to give you as little as possible for as much money as possible.  I never get that feeling here,  instead i walk away feeling like money well spent.
Love this place! The pad see ew is amazing. I've had many other dishes but they can be on the salty side. Lunch special cannot be beat with Thai tea for only $1.50.

My friend who is a Vegas local recommended this restaurant. 

The food:

We decided to do family style. We ordered the Tom Yum Kah ( Tom yum soup with coconut milk), panang curry, pad thai and tung tongs. 

Disclosure: I love tom yum kah or kai and I ordered every time I dine at a Thai restaurant. The tom yum kah is good. I have notice that every Thai restaurant have a different spin on their tom yum kah. Some add more coconut milk, some add less and some are well balanced. This restaurant goes light on the coconut milk which is great for those who don't like too much. I prefer the creamy taste of the coconut milk so I couldn't say I love it. 

The panang curry is a sweeter nutty peanut version of the other curries. It was my first time trying it and it was good. I prefer the yellow curry over panang curry. Again, this girl loves her coconut milk. 

The pad thai is exquisite. Order yourself a plate, you won't regret it. 

The tung tongs are so cute! A friend of mine ordered them because he wanted to take a picture of them. They are taste just like regular gyoza or fried dumplings.

I'm Thai.  I was born in Thailand, I grew up on Thai food, and I cook Thai food myself.  When it comes to Thai restaurants, I am extremely critical of the food and I hate it when Thai food is Americanized. Well, I can tell you that this place is authentic. The food is absolutely delicious...better than a lot of places I've eaten in Thailand! I travel all over the US and the world for work...and this little gem is the only Thai restaurant that has driven me to write a review.  

Even the service was good (not usual for an Oriental restaurants).

Don't miss an opportunity to visit if you like truly authentic Thai food.  Recommended items that I liked:  Laab ped (duck), ka pow moo krob, tom saab pork, ba mee hang, pad see ew, spicy clam with basil, and papaya salad (som tum). Yes, if I stayed in Vegas more than 3 days, I probably would've listed the whole menu :) oh, and my husband thought the mango and sticky rice was the best he's ever had outside of Thailand.

My most favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas and I've been to quite a few. The most authentic tasting one I've found so far. My favorite dish is the Panang curry which is made with coconut milk.... #4. I love spicy!!! You won't be disappointed with this one.

My date took me here a couple weeks ago
Now my other date took me here on V-Day
Bring a lover here ;) you might get lucky

I think their dishes is better than Lotus, without the wait.  We had crispy duck with panang curry, the seafood pad cha is very good, the squid is very tender.  The papaya salad is good (it will be better if they have dried shrimps, but maybe their customers are not Thai).  The fried banana desert is very tasty.

I checked this place out after a nearby specials search, and I saw that Misty had been and gave it high reviews. 
So I took advantage of the yelp deal, ($10 for $20 worth of food) there wasn't any problem at the restaurant using this deal. simple, no hassle. 
The food was amazing. We got three appetizers because there was a photo of happy hour specials for $3.33 between 5-8pm. The crab rangoon, crispy shrimp and dynamite chicken wings. all amazing and delicious. especially loved the crab Rangoon. 
for the entree we took misti's suggestion and decided to split green curry, and we got it with duck at a level 3 spiciness. It really wasn't spicy at all but it was SOOO good.  indeed the best green curry Ive had in Vegas, with huge chunks of eggplant and duck meat. mmm. I also had the Harney & Sons tea, it was very good. 
Everything was perfect except for the bill at the end of the meal. They did take off the $20 from the coupon, but the appetizers were not $3.33 each. When I asked the waitress about it she said that they no longer did happy hour. So I said to her, but I asked at the beginning of the meal if there was happy hour and you guys said there was...she looked confused and blank, and apologized that her English wasn't that good. I believe it was the drink waitress who said the deal was valid and the food waitress that said it wasn't but in the end, we paid $21 for appetizers instead of $10, which was really disappointing. 
Still, I'll go back, it was fun to discover a new place, (and there was a promising korean restaurant next door too!) I recommend you check it out too, but don't count on happy hour appetizer specials. at least, get it in writing first. :P

Lots of duck dishes offered here.  And, if you are brave, durian sticky rice.  It's actually pretty good.  The coconut tempers the durian flavor.  But later on you will realize that you ate durian.  Your breath will be horrible.  And if you don't know what durian is, don't try it.  You will regret it, eventually.  I'm apparently a glutton for punishment.

Service was good.  A little timid but good.  The servers hovered with concern a lot but ultimately knew when to come in and ask if we needed anything.

I recommend trying the pork jerky.  And let me know if you actually get anything spicy here.  We asked for food as spicy as possible and it came out not so spicy.  But maybe we did not look Thai enough?

Interesting variety of food and good service garners this establishment a "Yay!"
Very good food and excellent service. Definitely a hidden gem in the city. I would absolutely recommend.

The food here is 100% authentic Thai food. The service is superb. We wish we could have eaten more than the 5 appetizer and entrees that we ordered! Highly recommended and we will be back.  The Chiang Mai sausage, papaya salad, and stuffed chicken wings were excellent. We cleaned up the whole Panang curry soft crab.
We drive a good twenty minutes from home to get here past maybe a dozen other Thai restaurants. That should say a lot.

I feel like I am always mentally juggling Thai restaurants, trying to declare one as my favorite. I usually use either Panang or Red Curry w/Tofu and a Tom Yum Soup w/Chicken as my lab standards. After 4 meals at Weera Thai over the past month, it has because obvious that Weera Thai is my (current) favorite!

Very generous portions and generous proteins in the portions. A large Tom Yum w/Chicken is easily a meal in itself, as is the Panang Curry w/Tofu. Flavor and thickness of curry is spot on, and the price is the best quality-to-value Thai in town. The Tom Yum broth is kept hot in a flame-pot. 

The restaurant is extremely clean, the waitstaff and chef are super nice, and their Sahara Avenue location has proven to be very convenient, inspiring some last-minute Weera Thai redirection when deciding where to eat. Cleanliness was the reason we dumped our old Thai restaurant crush in search of a new one. Weera in love!

I am so confident in Weera Thai that I took my visiting East Coast family (party of 12) there for dinner over the holidays. One of my sisters and brother-in-laws declared Weera's Tom Kha as the best they'd ever had in their lives. 

With the current Yelp Deals promotion ($10 for $20) you cannot afford not to try Weera. Weera is also doing a 10% off special when you check-in on the Yelp app. Yelp friendly indeed. Go tonight!

I loved this place before it remodeled. SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE!!!!!! The only time I saw a waitress was when I sat. Waited for 10mins before they took my order and had to wave the waitress down for another drink. Order took 40mins!!!! Such horrible service. Then I had to get up and ask for my bill and to ask for to go containers. Just slow horrible service!!!!!

I've come to Weera Thai several times since moving to Vegas. Their spring rolls are fantastic. The rest of the food is superb, and their service is pleasant. Our waitress Supachai was kind and informative and I would definitely recommend this place for a first date, birthday party, or gathering of close friends and good food.

Food is great.  Flavorful and big portions.  Sometimes I order by phone for delivery.  I tried today and was told I could only order online.  After trying to order I was told I had to have an Amazon prime account to order.  I can not see getting an $11 monthly charge just to pay for food from weera thia.  I don't know when or if I'll order again.

Whop whoop!! My fave place for now. Why? Because they have fried papaya salad. It's to die for. Their tom yum gong is perfect taste for me. The curry and pad see you (don't know how to spell) was ok for me. A little too sweet. 
Food taste and price is decent. I will always come here if i want to eat fancy Thai food.

Excellent. Very clean inside and very large portions of good food. The price to portion ratio is excellent. The pad see ew sauteed in curry sauce was something I had never seen before and was delicious. The Chiang Mai sausage and yellow curry I had were also very good. Overall, excellent flavor, huge portions, reasonable price, lots of other good looking things on the menu. An excellent choice for Thai.

The best... Yes, THE BEST THAI!! Every dish is consistently amazing. The waitresses are so friendly and cute. Their larb, Tom kha gai, pad ki mao, beef salad, papaya salad, etc melt my brain every time! I don't watch tv, but if you like to watch it, there's about 20 TVs packed into this tiny restaurant. The happy hour drink specials are great. If you don't like Weera Thai, I don't like you.

Yay for authentic thai food in Vegas!

My cousins were visiting from Thailand and we decided to go off the strip to find dinner that would make my cousins feel right at home. And we found it! I thought the prices were quite reasonable for a thai food place, especially in Vegas but of course my mom and cousins thought it was a bit expensive because they're use to good cheap thai food. Sorry guys. We ordered soup to share which was really good but my cousin said a little bit spicy and it wasn't spicy at all, cream cheese wontons, chicken wings with sauce on the side, and other stuff I can't quite remember but everything was really good and had a great taste to it. 

My favorite was the mussel cake or hoi todd which I thought was cooked perfectly. Not too crispy, not gooey at all, perfect texture, perfect sauce. I really enjoyed it and felt like it really hit close to home. 

Overall I would definitely suggest Weera Thai if I'm back in Vegas and my friends are craving authentic thai food.

Delicious! We eat here every time we're in LV. Try the fresh springs rolls and the Pad Thai Woon sen. 
It's location is an unassuming strip center west of the Strip, but it's a very nice inside.
This place is really good and staff is extremely friendly. Food is always fresh and the presentation is beautiful and you can't beat their happy hour!

Looking at Weera Thai Restaurant from the outside you'd probably think it was a little divey but it's not. The interior is comfortable, clean and not shabby at all. We ordered the Panang and Massuman curries and they were quite tasty and seemed a bit creamier than usual. The portions are huge and two people could share one curry and be full afterwards. A nice little Thai place just a couple miles off the strip.

As a first time experience having Thai, it was excellent! We had a friend with us who is a Thai fanatic and has been to several other restaurant and said this one was amazing. Just be carful of the hotness as you can always add but can't takeaway!

My wife and I are visiting from Khon Kaen, Thailand.  Everywhere she goes, she HAS to find Thai food!  We THOROUGHLY enjoyed the food and atmosphere of Weera.  VERY authentic and presented rather nicely.  The menu is HUGE and includes specialties from the Issan region of Thailand.  The lunch special is priced nicely as well.  So, stop reading this, and get on down to Weera.  You won't be disappointed!

This place has been on my radar for three months now. I finally made it for lunch a few days ago, and I have to say -it was a disappointing experience.

  I chose menu item F-6 (Spicy Thai Holy Basil with chicken) -which was stir fried chicken, onions, chili, and Thai holy basil leaves. The chicken itself was sliced -not ground and was a little tough and dry. The dish appeared to be swimming in grease -instead of a sauce. I didn't know sliced chicken could be greasy... 

The level 3 spice out of 5 barely registered as spicy, and as a result the food was bland. Why do most Thai places skimp on basil? I thought this was a dish that featured basil?  Instead, I found myself on the hunt looking for basil underneath the rubbery overcooked chicken. 

The restaurant itself is clean, quaint, and inviting. My order was done in 10 minutes which was nice considering I was on my lunch break. However, I would rather they took their time to make sure the dish actually tasted good. 

I won't come back as there are just too many good Thai places to choose from in Las Vegas.

This place is a beautiful hidden spot. The food tasted okay. Just ask the cooks or waiters if there are nuts in any of the dishes or if anything is made with peanut oil/sesame oil (for those who have peanut/nut/tree nut/etc. allergies). We were told there was none, but my boyfriend still had an allergic reaction to one of the dishes. Just be careful!

I love the interior design and general atmosphere here, as well as the food! There was a lot to choose from - we tried the panang curry and the tom yum and "zaap" happy hour wings as well as the crab rangoons. All were amazing! I will definitely be back here to try all of the other delicious looking foods.

Drove out here because we wanted thai food badly but didn't want to pay $22 for a pad thai on the strip. It's not that far either.

Came right in time for happy hour. The thai ice teas were around $1.50-score! Great prices, and great portions. We ordered the duck pad thai, pad sew ew, and panang curry. The duck was kind of dry, and I wished there were more veggies in the curry (was literally all meat and sauce)- but other than that everything was great!

Would return again

I saw a Groupon for dinner for 4 at Weera, checked it out on Yelp and decided to purchase said Groupon...glad I did!

We shared everything family style and the highlights of our meal were the Green Curry (Thanks Misti) and the Pad Kee Mao.  The green curry at Weera is one of the best in town!  We were all totally happy with it!  The pad kee mao was very good as well.

Nothing was bad here...the only thing that was just okay, run-of-the-mill-good, was the appetizer sampler.  There were four of us so we went with the normal app sampler that comes with 4 of everything instead of Weera app sampler that look a little more appealing but only came with 3 of each item...next time we will just draw knives to see who gets left out and go with the namesake! 

The prices are spot on here as well.

Would have been a 5 star experience if the app was better and if the atmosphere matched the quality of the food.  The service was friendly, but a little slow as well...I never like it when more than one person runs out of water at the same time.

Food and service are always great!

I come here regularly and they've never disappointed.

Looking for a new place to try out, this is the place you NEED to try when in Vegas.
The crispy papaya salad is my favourite, and they have good dessert, i almost like all the food here except the angel wings taste so baddd.

I LOVE this place. They have really decent pricing comparatively, and the food is delicious. I can pretty picky about curries, and I love the yellow curry here. Perfectly thick consistency, and great flavor. I usually call to pick up, but I have sat and dined before with a large group, which was also wonderful. The Pad Thai is another favorite of mine, I love that when you order it togo it comes in one of those reusable containers. My only qualm would be that when you call to pick up, they won't let you order unless you either give them your card number, or are already in the system. If you're like me and like picking up food, make sure you get in their system in person for future orders. It's not secure to give your card info out over the phone.

This was a recommendation from My and Thao T, and I think they got the recommend from Bobby and Misti... thank you guys!  This place is wonderful.

I asked the server what her favorite dish is, and she recommended the steamed sea bass.  This is what I recommend to all of you in yelp land, because my god it's so good and so unique (at least to a gringo like me).  I'm a huge fan of steamed fish in the first place because it's not greasy, but the bass is served on top of a a broth that is sweet with just a slight tang to it.  That was the first dish to go.

Side note, they have bottles of chinese wine on display. Go ahead and order one, they are not expensive at all and a great complement to the meal.

I also got the pad se ew (yes that can't be spelled correct) and the grilled beef salad.  No complaints.

Staff is so generous, place is really clean and quaint.
This is a great location for Thai Thursdays. All the food is flavourful. Sasi is wonderful
Lunch special only  till 4 pm . $7.99. Okay food nothing special that would make me want to come back. Service was just OK. Overall, I have had way better thai food else where .

Very good food  super tasty the place has beautiful atmosphere and great service and super clean I forgot to mention the food was really fresh and so cute decorated we will be coming back again for sure

We broke up.

This place is heaven. The food is unparalleled. I can barely enjoy Thai food elsewhere, even in other states, including LA. I've been eating here since like 2010.

But last time I called to order (which is like once a week if you know my love of Thai food), I was disclosed that many options I long consumed under the title of "vegetarian" weren't & couldn't be made specially for me, either, because of shrimp paste, fish sauce, chicken stock, etc. that were already added beforehand.

Just heartbreaking.

Glad they were honest, but wish I'd known sooner.

Please fix your veg menu & be able to accommodate! I miss your food dearly. It wouldn't take much to carry veggie stock for your soups, to reserve a portion of pad thai base without fish sauce/add it to the portion itself instead, and to have at least ONE CURRY without shrimp paste for your vegs! Please!

This place is amazing! Can get a little bit crowded during lunch, but that's only because the decor is awesome, food is great, the staff are attentive, and the prices are fantastic. Highly recommended!

One of the best happy hours in Las Vegas! Their happy hour is everyday from 4-8pm and features wings, appetizers, and a large variety of drinks! Two appetizers and a drink ran me less than $20 including tip. The staff is very friendly and accommodating.

Had to review again!!!!!    Forgot how much I love the food.  Had the pineapple fried rice for the first time and it's and explosion of flavors, the crab sticks were crispy and delicious and the pad Thai and beef salad still are the best in Vegas.  I am just disappointed that I forgot to order the mango sticky rice.  The delivery guy was really sweet and I just have to add how much I love this place.

We go here so very often and never been disappointed with the food and the service. Chicken satay , curry puff, clams,, curries and try anything on their menu and the flavor is always so rich and different. This is our favorite Thai food place. We never fail to order the mango stick rice .. that is to die for. One of their servers PIKON is amazing..She remembers us every time we walk in and even reminds us what we order normally. Very attentive always.

Great food and service. Reasonable prices, with large portions. We ordered the clams and chicken satay appetizers; shrimp pad Thai; pork prig-king; large Singha beer. Bill was about $51. The location isn't the nicest looking strip mall, which is why I give this hidden gem one less star.

Today Weera has shown me that they are very interested in offering Las Vegas good, fairly authentic Thai food.  Every time I come here, the owner asks me if there is anything he can do better.  And every time I come here, the food gets better!  This is a respectful business that could easily turn into a regular spot for me.

Today I had the Rad Nah, the Pa Cha, and the Roast Duck with Weera sauce.  

The Rad Nah was spot on in the gravy department.  It was thick, tasty, and smokey.  The noodles were pretty good, and the pork was really well prepared.  I would say that Weera does a pretty good Rad Nah, and that makes me happy.  

The Roast Duck dish we had was really tasty.  It was just a bit plate of sliced duck, along with a sweeter sauce.  The duck was well prepared, not fatty or gristly.  Another solid dish for Weera.

The Pa Cha was really spot on.  The Pa Cha isn't as strong as the versions I have had at other Thai restaurants that make this wonderful Thai dish, but the fried catfish was really yummy. We ordered it a 5/5 spice level, and it was spot on with flavor and heat.  I really recommend this dish at Weera.  They do it well.

Due to the A+ service and the improved food here, I am happy to say that Weera has earned a star in my book.  I will definitely be returning more often.  I have yet to try the curries, but I believe that Weera's specialties will be the soups and the stir fry dishes.

24hr location amazing!!! Really nice and clean restaurant. Bar area is completely in closed separate from the family dining area which is really cool! Lots and lots of T.v.'s to watch the games. Service and food was great! Thanks Xenia our waitress.  It was a Sunday and im sure people were at the sports betting areas in the big casinos getting second hand smoke but definitely come here to get away from the crowd and enjoy great drinks and hot fresh wings amazing place.

We were here with friends about 7 times already! Best thai food ever! Believe me, I lived in Thailand for 2 years (Koh Samui). Also its very cool that u can get free thai tea if u check in. Our thai friend, found that place, and she told us that the food is really good! I totally recomend that place! And service is very friendly!

This is one of our favorite Thai restaurants in Vegas. Food is good, clean and fresh. Although it's in a strip mall, the inside ambiance is modern and clean.

The beef salad is delicious and the beef is nice and tender.

I just wish this place was near or house or it might be a weekly spot for us!

My only complaint was being sat by the kitchen door. Each time it opened a gust of cold air came out. I'm normally cold where ever I go, so I wear a jacket, I didn't even take it off the entire time I ate, and I was still cold. The food was great and the service was decent. It was the weekend and they were very busy so I will go back sometime soon and hope to update this to five stars. A little on the pricey side, it isn't fine dining, or a take out spot, so if the food quality is decent I don't mind spending a little extra.

If you love duck, thai basil, and curry, get the duck with the green curry and mixed vegetables. I took Misti's advice and ate the most delicious curry of my life. Duck is one of my favorite proteins, so you don't like duck, you can skip the rest of my review, but for those duck lovers out there, they keep the crispy skin on, and then pour delicious green curry all over it!! The mixed vegetables are the way to go as it makes the dish taste more fresh than a bunch of eggplant. We got everything at level 4 (out of 5) spice and it was very modest compared to other Thai restaurants in town. 

We also ordered tom yum soup (first time trying it), and pad see ew. Tom yum is an interesting soup being sour (really sour. I was puckering at almost every bite) but I don't like spitting out all the random things in the soup that look innocent, but end up being crunchy (lemongrass?). It was listed at #8 on CNN's list of 100 foods to try before you die. I've tried it, and now I'll know not to order it again. Pad see ew was standard and mango sticky rice had a pretty sour mango for a $6 dessert, although the rice was cute in the shape of a heart. Service was sweet and they made sure to ask if we had any coupons before getting our bill so as not to waste time. 

In summary: duck lovers, do NOT pass up the green curry with duck and mixed vegetables.
Great authentic thai food and exceptional service!

Extremely baffled at our experience here. From the phone ordering process until the moment I left I couldn't stand another second in there. It was all horrible. 

Fail# 1: we called to place a take out order and was denied because it was our first time ordering from the restaurant. 

Fail# 2: the time we wasted sitting and waiting for our takeout food - 30 minutes. That is why we called in the first place.

Fail# 3: the food was bland, watered down
Food is good but the worst Server I ever had in my Life he never ask ME Hows the food I have to raise my hand & ask what I need I Will nerver come back

Was looking for a nice Thai restaurant and I was recommended this place, and I am very pleased. The food is amazing!!!. Spicy or not, they are very good. The flavor is not crazy and it was just right for me. Service was excellent too. My favorite Thai restaurant is this one. I highly recommend it.

Are there any sucky Thai restaurants out there?  I'd be hard pressed to find one.  The small differences in flavor I believe are a matter of personal preference.  So it really boils down to the dining experience for me.  Weera is a low-key, intimate space with soft lighting and a conservative selection of sakes and wine.  When we went, there were couples on dates, families with kids, groups of friends and a table of 6-footer models.  I think anyone would be happy with this space and food.  Service was great but quite slow on a Friday night.  

The first bite we had of their pad thai was bit of a letdown, but the next few bites we took must've had some voodoo spice or spell because we were loving it more and more.  It was a dish that did not wow you with a punch, but the flavors crept up on you like the butler on Mr. Deeds... very very sneaky.  We also had the Thai chicken wings, sauce on the side for my little man.  Bad idea.  There wasn't any flavor on the naked wing.  The final order was Crispy Pork Basil.  I haven't heard my hubby say it in a long time but he muttered "Holy Lord God."  He was enamored.  To me, it was very good, close to perfection with its slightly sweet buttery sauce, the balance with crisp vegetables and the yummy fried pork (normally I like to keep the sauce off fried skin to keep it crisp).  Overall though, we were very happy with the food.  They even provide kiddie plates.  50 brownie points right there!

So many Thai options... but we would definitely go back to this one.  Wee heart you Weera!

The service here is atrocious and the food make me so sick I went to the er! I asked for s refund and was told they don't give refunds. There are plenty of other places within a couple miles I've had that are clearly better... not to mention, they charge for everything you may want to substitute! I'd love for this place to go out of business!

Went for lunch here for the first & last time. I ordered the lunch special & a Thai iced tea. When I got the bill, I saw I was charged $3.50 for the tea even though the lunch menu showed it was $1.75. I informed the server & she replied "that's only with the lunch special." When I let her know I had ordered the lunch special, her response was, "well you got the large tea, did you let someone know you wanted the lunch special one because that is a smaller size?" Uh okay, the tea is listed right on top of the lunch menu that I ordered off of but whatever. I did get the price corrected but I wonder how often this happens to other unsuspecting customers.

Also an fyi for vegetarians, I asked if the other items that came with lunch special were vegetarian. I was told yes: no meat in egg rolls & soup is a tofu soup. Luckily I asked about the broth because I was told it's a chicken broth. 

The two stars is because food is okay. Service is lacking. There are too many other great Thai restaurants in Vegas to have to deal with this place again.
The best place to get some awesome thai food! Best service, their wontons are amazing! They have become are go to place for Thai food since Archi's kind of went down hill.

Wow, couldn't be more impressed! After trying to find a decent thai place on Yelp, we decided to go here.. and I absolutely love it! Located in a run down strip mall on Sahara, its always hard to venture off into some less lit parking lots. 

Great vibes from the moment you walk in, the decor makes it feel very home-y and authentic. 

I ordered the shrimp and mushroom Tom Yum soup, and with every bite it kept getting better and better. I should've ordered a large it was so good! 

Next you can never go wrong with some Thai Beef salad but this one was amazing. On their range of spicy-ness from 1-5, I ordered a 3 and it was perfect. Not too much spice you burn your mouth, just enough to enjoy the salad. 

Finally we asked the waitress what dessert she recommends, and she mentioned the Bua Lua (Taro) dish.. oh my.. what a way to top off the whole meal. Its a warm coconut milk with boba like texture balls..  definitely ordering that again! 

The whole spontaneous decision to find a thai restaurant was totally worth it after finding this place, my new go-to spot!

I arrived here at 3:25 pm. When the waiter approached 5 minutes later, I ordered the crispy duck salad (about $16.95) and asked if I could see the happy hour appetizer list.  I was informed that the happy hour didn't start until 4.  I then said, ok, I will have still have the duck salad, but its not enough, so bring me the lunch special pad thai.  He then told me the lunch special is only good until 3:30.  I said, it is 3:30.  He said its only UNTIL 3:30.  I asked to speak to a manager. He said there isn't one. I asked if there was anyone else I could speak to.  He went to the register and spoke in Thai to a woman there, then came back and said, we can't give you the lunch special or the happy hour menu, but we will give you a free house salad with my order.  I said, so, you are going to give me a free salad with my duck salad?  and he said yes, as if its the most common thing in the world to have a salad with your salad. Unnacceptable.
It was my first time and surly not the last. I had the duck and it was outstanding, the red Carrie dish was very good and over all a great experience.

Love it here! Their panang curry is my favorite! Only thing I don't like is they don't do refills on plain hot coffee which they serve in a small tea cup to begin with, so 3 sips and you're done... I'd understand if it were a latte or thai tea but plain coffee? Hmmm

Came in on 7:30 on a Saturday night to a nearly empty place, was briefly worried. The very pleasant waitress made me feel like I was back in Thailand, and brought me a Singha beer. The green curry was VERY GOOD and VERY BIG with a mountain of eggplant! This is easily the biggest $9 curry I have ever had, and also one of the best. Any future trips to Vegas will include a trip to Weera Thai!

One of the good things about my job moving to the new office...we found this place. Their food is amazing! The shrimp (honestly any pad thai) is great there. I haven't been to the restaurant yet, but the delivery service is great. They are very friendly and apologetic if they run late. If you're looking for good spicy Thai give this place a try.

Beside Lotus of Siam this is probably my new favorite Thai restaurant.  
Love 4/5 dishes that we ordered:

My favorite would have to be the Crispy Duck Salad
And least fav. Was the beef salad  (beef was chewy and no flavor) won't be ordering this anymore!!

Tom yum shrimp  was good, crab  fried rice was good, there was a lot crab meat but it wasn't wow.. 

Chicken  pad thai was really orange but good..

Service??? It wasn't busy when they open but yet I've to ask twice for my Thai ice tea, extra plate and chili fish sauce.

I still want to come back and try their crispy fish salad

This is probably one of my favorite Thai places in town. I'm an avid seeker of quality Thai Resteraunt (that haven't been closed down) in the vegas valley!my formed turned me on to this whole in the wall a few years back! Since then I'm never disappointed!

It's small and unassuming. You walk in and expect decent cuisine but then they hit you with fresh, crisp appetizers and the immense aroma of curry!! The senses are on over Drive! They service is quick and friendly and the Resteraunt is clean. 

My lunch special was accompanied by a soup and egg roll that was out of this world. Lemon grass and broth that soothes the soul! My lunch came out with a decent sized portion.  Of course I ordered pad Thai! It's like the benchmark maker of all Thai Resteraunt! It wasn't greasy and had the perfect amount of sprouts and peanuts on the side! I was full! The experience was nothing short of excellent. I'll definitely go back!

So far my favorite Thai! 

The outside doesn't look like much it's a few doors down from more Asian choices. You walk in to a small restaurant with a wine rack on the back wall. Went in around 3 had a choice of happy hour specials but I already had a game plan. I had take out once from here that a friend ordered and it was so good I wanted the flavors again. 

I was greeted when I walked in and told to sit anywhere. The nice lady came over brought me water. I ordered pineapple fried rice with chicken, pad see ew with beef and a Thai iced tea. 

The pineapple fried rice is amazing you have your choice of meat. The rice is cooked with yellow curry, big chunks of tomatoes, big chunks of pineapple, cashews and green onion. Huge serving. I chose chicken which was big chunks. 

Pad see ew is sooo good too! Be careful there are two one is made with curry. It is stated. This one is the regular you pick your choice of meat. Large flat noodles and bok choi in a brown sauce with you meat. I chose beef it compliments the everything very well. Huge servings.

I was going to order egg rolls but I forgot. I always order Thai iced tea it's always soooo good.  I took lots of left overs home but that was the plan. Both heat up nicely and gave me enough for 3 other meals. 

Price wise it averages about $10-$13 an entrée. The flavors and portions are worth the price. The staff is nice and attentive. My suggestion would be go in two or more and sample each other's orders or plan on a lot of leftovers.
They deliver, which rocks! We have tried 6 or 7 things on the menu and are always very happy with the quality of the food and great tastes!
