In town with 3 golfing pals and decided on a Thai restaurant. We were not disappointed!  The food (Calamari, spring rolls, vegetable fried rice, chicken Pad Thai,crispy duck in coconut milk) were delicious and served quickly. Our server, Jiu, couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. She was wonderful!  The prices were very reasonable, and we all had a great time!!  We may go back tonight!!

Terrible service!! But great food. Appetizers came after entrees. Asked to cancel it but they said no bc it was almost done. Charged me for it anyways. Ugh. Coulda been 5 star but put me in such a bad mood bc they didn't really seem remorseful after all their mistakes. Whatever. If you eat here order takeout.
Spicy Thai basil dish is good. I like the sauce a lot. Eggplant is good too.

5 Stars. 

I would say, LOS is King of Thai food in Vegas (not anymore)
Weera Thai is the Queen.
Le Thai is a prodigal son.

I have eaten several times at Weera, and I have to admire them because;

1. portion is much bigger than LOS.
2. price is cheaper than LOS.
3. and best of all, they use really good vegetables. It doesn't simply mean it's fresh. They are tasty. Tomatoes, eggplants, etc etc,, Sweet and TASTY,,, I wonder where they get these veggies. Great that they don't overcook veggies, too.

Oh, yes, you gotta try their coconut ice cream. It's the best I have ever eaten.
Thai ice tea/coffee is dense and really good. 

Atmosphere and the location is not that great, but I don't care.

I will definitely go back.

I'm excited to find another delicious thai spot in LV. Like I've said in my previous reviews, I'm picky about my thai food. Mainly because I come from Seattle where the thai food is top-notch. We ordered a few of their lunch special orders which included tofu phad thai, chicken phad thai, panang curry, and a gingered tilapia dish. Although the food did take a while to come out, it was VERY good. The phad thai was moist and tasty, and the panang was delish. The portions for lunch are fairly large too, had to take some home.
Tried the fresh rolls with tofu(the sause was a delight) and pineapple fried rice. Excellent taste with good ambiance and service.
Had the spring rolls, pad khi mao, and the egg rolls..  everything was amazing.  Highly recommend this place!

weera Thai , I can never say no to! They have great lunch specials , great food, place was just remodeled and it's a beautiful place for dine in , the service never disappoints and to top it off they deliver as well which is awesome. Anywho my FAVORITE plate is the pad Thai which is a must try.

OMG!! Hands down, this is officially theeeee best thai food place I've eaten at...EVER!! From the service to decor to the taste, everything was superb. 

It was late when my friend and I yelped this place. Pics were enticing and reviews were great. We had a little over an hour before closing and rushed over. It's off the strip in a neighborhood not too far from chinatown. 

Walked in, was immediately greeted with smiles and escorted to our table. Our waiter was the best! He was so attentive and helpful. He was patient even though we asked several questions about unfamiliar dishes. He offered honest suggestions and had a smile to go with each one. We were curious, indecisive, and wanted leftovers. We ordered yellow curry w/ shrimp, spicy basil fried rice w/ shrimp, crab rolls, chicken fried rice, chicken pad thai, mango sticky rice, and a few alcoholic beverages to go with our meals. Mmm...mmm...good is all we could say. Every forkful was flavorful. 

Curry was the right consistency. It was loaded with plump shrimp, potatoes, and carrots. The other noodle and rice dishes were full of fresh veggies and herbs. Portions were large and they did not skimp on meat. The crab rolls were like long egg rolls. They were a tiny bit fishy and may have been better if we ate them right away. Instead, my friend was busy sipping her wine and I, my special menu mojito with fresh chunks of mango. Yum...theee best!! The late night happy hour made them even better. We had plenty of leftovers to take back to the hotel. My friend's boys were still up and ready to eat when we returned. They had never eaten thai food, tried and liked everything. The next day, leftovers were devoured by all of us. 

As for the restaurant...decor was gorgeous and authentic. Lights were dim, service was quick. There was plenty of tables and the restaurant was clean. The menu is large!! There is lots to choose from. Excellent recommendation for locals. I will definitely return next time I visit Vegas.
Great lunch specials and they give you large portions as well. Will definitely be back.

Food was great!  Clean quiet place. Started with wonton soup....absolutely delicious!!  Then shared orange chicken and shrimp pad thai with cold thai tea!! Everything was great....will definitely come back.
This is now my favorite Thai restaurant.  Have been there about 6 times now, and each dish was Great!  Whoever the chef is,  they know what they are doing!

Still a solid choice.  Came here after seeing The Book of Mormon for a late lunch, dined on their larb again, chicken panang and some other items.  All was excellent, except the BBQ pork was on the fatty side.  Servers here are always super friendly.

The ambiance in this restaurant is nice. The servers are kind and accommodating but the 2 STAR rating is really based on the food. Being Thai and understanding how the food is going to taste gives you high expectations of any Thai restaurant. But Weera just misses the mark. I took my mom here and we order a lot of food to eat. The portions were humongous! Which can be a good or bad thing. We did the appetizer combo. But the Crab Rangoon was all cream cheese and no crab. The dipping sauces confusing. My moms pork came out and it was dry and overcooked. They charged $3 for sticky rice. But I get it, it's a restaurant. My duck noodle soup was not what I expected. The soup was so...bland. It was not what I wanted so I just took it home to fix it. 

Overall, if you're not Thai or have super high expectations, I would recommend the lunch special. It's good pricing. But the rest is a bit much for not so over the top food.

This place gets better every time! Since my first visit, they renovated the interior, and that has added so much to your overall experience there. That's now somewhere you take your out-of-town guest to.
Customer service is great, food and drink are awesome. Just love this place :)

Great food. In many Thai restaurants the food is too salty, too spicy, too much. Everything was excellent here and tasted special.
The spring rolls were wonderful, the soup was delicious, and Kung pau was perfect.

We will come back when in Vegas.

Love weera Thai. From the atmosphere to the food and service! Ordered fried rice and squid salad both tasted amazing. Presentation was very nice as well. My water never left empty. Definitely come back to try more food. Oh they also have happy hour menu too I think it's starts from 12-3:30 pm.

I absolutely love Weera Thai. There are SO many Thai restaurants all over & around Vegas, how do you know which one to go to?! Well, I suggest here!! 

Their lunch specials start when they open & end at 3:30 pm, & they have all their best entrees offered at this time. You get a soup, salad, & egg roll before your meal. Lots of food for the price! I've had a few different dishes here & I have not been disappointed once. Everything has so much flavor, is fresh, authentic, & just plain amazing. 

The interior is romantic & calm. The waiters & waitresses are friendly, polite, & fast. 

Their Thai tea is perfection. I can not have another Thai tea anywhere else without wishing it tasted more like Weera's. (Which is only $1.50 if you add it on to your lunch special!) 

I highly recommend giving this place a shot, it's not super busy like some of the other places & the food is always better here!
They have the best green curry. I will always order green curry and pad thai from this place.

We love Weera Thai! We order from them frequently and their food is consistently amazing! I genuinely think they have the best Thai here in Vegas! Definitely try the Yellow Curry and the Thai Iced Tea! 

My real reason for review however is how they handled a problem... I ordered a vegetable soup that was described as "Mixed Vegetables in Clear Broth" when it arrived it was loaded with mushrooms. I can't eat mushrooms. I wasn't expecting mushrooms since they aren't a vegetable and weren't listed. So I explained the situation and Weera promptly refunded my credit card for the cost of the soup... 

HOWEVER what really impressed me was following that conversation they went online (I order online) and updated their whole menu with the ingredients to protect anyone with food allergies in the future. That is what I'm talking about people! Customer service at its finest! 

Thanks Weera! Me and you are gonna be GOOD FRIENDS!  And I'm off to order some curry!

I have heard such great things from friends and co-workers about this place for a while. Saw all the glowing reviews on Yelp! and decided to check this place out.

Just not impressed at all. Sorry, not sorry.

Positives:
(+) Love the decor! Place was very clean and beautifully decorated. Love all the gold gilding in the wall art and sculptures. Very, very Thai atmosphere.
(+) Pad See Ew was pretty good. Probably in the top 5 I've had in the city, but nothing to lose it over.

Not so positives:
(-) Service was alright, but quite slow, especially considering that the place was nearly empty on a Monday afternoon. 
(-) Kao Moo Dang tasted good, but portion size was pretty underwhelming. Very unsatisfying and disappointing. 
(-) Ordered Pad See Ew with no veggies and still got plenty of veggies. After the long wait I certainly was not going to send it back. 

This wasn't a terrible experience. I guess underwhelming and disappointing would probably be more accurate. There are just too many good Thai places in the city to even entertain a repeat visit.

2 stars.

Oh, I have definitely experienced better.

After walking crazy at the International Business Show by chance I exceeded my daily goal of 10,000 steps by an additional 2,000. 12,000 baby hip hip Horray!!! Actually more like take me Back to the hotel. I'm hungry and sleepy at the same time I don't know what I wanna do first. (Dragging feet) 

As I lay in the hotel bed on my tummy browsing yelp for good yummy vegas eats. I couldn't decide between  between Thai food or indian food. Hmmm...which one? (Thinking mode) I called Weeras and placed an order over the phone. 1) Thai tea 2) Dessert: sticky rice with mango 3) Pad see ew 4) Mango shrimp salad. Order was successfully placed with a long 45 minute wait. Oh boy the nervousness kicked in..." I hope this food is good." 
 
I reminisced about my day at I.B.S. What a spectacular day it had been! My smile was quite frozen in place after meeting Ty Pennington. My 1st real up close celebrity meeting. My thoughts were eventually interupted by my 2 year old who called me from his ipad. My little precious nephew. Never fails to make me smile. He kept me busy until *ding dong* "Yesss" the food was here. With a quick bye I raced to the kitchen. 
Standing over the dining table. I reached into the double bagged goodness. Everything was wrapped great. Out came the Thai teas. It almost felt like xmas. Unwrapping all the goodness. I opened the sticky rice mango dessert. Yes!!! Im guilty. I had dessert with dinner. I couldn't get enough of the rice and coconut flavor with a bite of sweet ripe mango. I felt I had landed in tropical heaven. 
Just when things couldn't get better. I opened the shrimp mango salad. Tasted very similar to papaya salad. But with huggggggeee shrimp (which I didn't eat) and loads of cashews. The combinations were orgasmic. Ba baM! 
The pad see ew was yum. Only one bite. I was 2 busy drooling over the mango goodness. Taking one bite of salad and another Bite of sticky rice. It was a tie between both!!!! 
So with that said this place is a .....
Must Try!!!
-delivery charge $3 +tip 
-order placed with ease over phone. 
-food arrived in 30 min instead of 45min
-leftovers next day taste just as great.

This is officially one of my top 3 favorite Thai restaurants here! 

We came here last night and ordered Beef Panang Curry, Rainbow Fried Rice, and Tom Yum Kai soup. The soup was super flavorful and had the perfect amount of spice. The thought of it makes my mouth water! The Rainbow rice was a little too sweet for me, but I could see it being a popular dish. My boyfriend liked it, but I liked it better without the pineapple bits. The Panang Curry was to die for!! After our first bite we both just stared at each other and said, "oh my god." I don't know what kind of coconut milk they used but it was probably the best Panang curry I've had here. We got it in a spice level 3 (out of 5), but I'd probably get it in a 4 next time because I think it'd be even more amazing with just a little more spice added. It came with a side if white rice, but after we ate all of it we ended up pouring it on top of the Rainbow rice which proved to be a good idea. 

Since we ate so much rice, we got full pretty fast and got a little of everything to go. Needless to say I'm pretty excited to eat leftovers tonight!

5 stars in my book


Bonus: they have drink happy hour from 4-8 (possibly 3-7, so you might want to verify)
The service is great, always friendly and attentive.   The food is awesome.  So much flavor and authentic Thai Food.

Had a couple of very spotty lunch take out experiences here but the last dine in lunch was very good. 
Used the 20.00 for 10.00 through Yelp so that made the deal even better. Had the dynamite wings, pad Thai, & mixed vegetables. All very tasty. Would definitely go back regularly for the lunch deals.

In October when I first found this place I was a little off put. It's in what seems like a run down strip mall on Sahara Ave. reluctantly we walked in and it was like going through the closet to Narnia. (Ok, I exaggerate, but it is much nicer than the outside portrays.)

We ordered fried tofu, tom kah Kai, and orange chicken. We were hooked. It was a lunch date with a co-worker and we have been here almost every other week since. I'm addicted to their chili basil chicken and they are the only Thai food place that has the really spicy chili oil. I mention this because perhaps you are a chili/spicy lover like I am. My co-worker loves their cashew chicken, so that also comes highly recommended. The service is great and you can sign up for rewards to earn points for free food on future visits.

Great waitresses. They always check in on you, always smiling, have good recommendation. 
Food= tasty.
Affordable. 
Clean restaurant. 
Try their Palms coconut nectar!

For service I give them a 2 star our server Preeyaphan was pretty rude,  how can you tell someone , thai eggplant doesn't taste good with thai style papaya salad had you tried it?, you dont tell a customer that when a customer ask to put it in there, only Laos style taste better, and then to add thai eggplant on thai style $2 for slices of thai egg plants for the lunch special papaya Smdh the guy servers were good they kept coming around asking us if we need anything our server Preeyaphan never came around not even with our bill.

Fast delivery, predictable quality; that's all I ask for when in couch potato mode and too lazy to even walk across the street for dinner.  Over the course of about a dozen home deliveries, I've only been disappointed once and that was due to a forgotten item; oh well, life goes on, Corky.  Delivery to the door is usually less than 30 minutes, sometimes as quick as it takes to travel down the elevator and walk the dog.  The food always, without fail, arrives piping hot...they either have really insulated containers or travel at the speed of sound.  I have tried everything from their curry meals to all the other usual Thai dishes that the white man enjoys; all taste good to me, delivered on time with a smile.  Hay! I'm a fan!

I am usually not a big Thai food gal.
I will say it: I take Vietnamese over Thai any day of the week. Not even looking back, asking questions or wondering what I missed.
Because in my experience - I never really missed much.

Don't get me wrong; I enjoy pads, tom kah kai, curries and papaya salad once in a while, and really, nothing is wrong with them. They are even quite good, most of the time. But what makes me really sad is that I KNOW that they are only the tip of the iceberg, and that there are many, many other treasures to be found. Well, eaten. But most places don't bother, or choose to "hide" these culinary pearls in secret menus that I am too scared to request upon ordering after being told once that they don't exist.

Bummer.

Now you can lure me in anyway. And Weera Thai did just that, with the promise of Issan food. Northern Thai Issan cuisine is more sour and spicy than Central Thai food and is cooked in hot chili peppers, rice powder, served with sticky rice. The result? My nom tok which was thinly sliced grilled beef with rice powder, spices, lime juice and chili. Just to die for, and accompanied by the best tamarind-based sauce ever. There are a whole variety of similar dishes using beef, pork, duck and fish.

Not in the mood for Issan?
What about crispy pilot fish stir fried with Thai holy basil? Or ground pork stir fried with Thai holy basil & preserved duck egg? Or squid sauteed in a garlic, cilantro and pepper sauce?

And for the least adventurous, Weeara does classics as well, and perfectly so. The simple spring rolls and the crab sticks we ordered were by far the best I have ever had. Fresh and vibrant - they redefined what they could be in the best of worlds. Wide rice noodles had just the right bite, and the green curry of my friend was outstanding.

Skip Lotus of Siam, and come here. To top it all, service is absolutely darling!

If you like fllavorless food and bland Thai food, Weera is your restaurant. We ordered fried rice, sliced duck, chicken satay, and drunken noodles. Not one of these dishes was tasty or appealing. I would have appreciated salty, spicy, or anything to hit my tastebuds but there was simply NO FLAVOR in the food. Don't waste your money at Weera Thai, there are a dozen better Thai restaraunts in Las Vegas, Weera is at the bottom of the list.
I love the restaurant. The food and staff are exceptional. I have never been disappointed. Thank you Weera!

Awesome service, delicious food. We are not from Vegas but everyone at our table agreed that the dishes we order were all fantastic. Besides the wonderful food the prices were much better then the overpriced restaurants in the casinos. Not to mention some of the casinos even have the nerve to charge you for parking. Will definitely come here again.
Excellent service! Food has great flavors. Portion sizes are good. The outside appearance is completely day and night.

A place we always head to when in Las Vegas. This time we had the shrimp and spicy apple salad. Yum yum yum. Penang curry shrimp medium always great. Large plentiful well cooked shrimp. Great happy hour including food!

Not the best thai food restaurant as I expected. Me and my family came to this restaurant on Sunday, June 11, 2017 around 5 p.m. We were greeted and seated very quickly. We were offered the Happy Hour menu, but we weren't interested since they probably give less portions. We took a few minutes to decide what to eat at this restaurant.

We ordered:
- Thai Style Chicken Fried Rice
- Chicken Pad Thai
- Chicken Green Curry
- Beef Salad
- Shrimp Fried Rice

The service here is good but the food is not good. VERY DISAPPOINTED. The food didn't taste good at all. It only has little flavor and not as tasty. When I go to thai restaurants, I always order the Chicken Pad Thai. At Weera Thai, everything is the opposite. The pad thai noodles is big and flat. The flavor of it doesn't taste good.

Also, if you want additional rice, you have to pay $4 for a medium sized bowl. Forget it. Instead, we order Shrimp Fried Rice and it is much more portion than that medium sized plain rice. 

I DO NOT RECOMMEND GOING TO THIS RESTAURANT! The food is NOT GOOD! The portion size is SMALL! The food here is EXPENSIVE! I would go to my favorite thai restaurant and is much better than this restaurant and is the same price as Weera Thai. Trust me, I've eaten many thai restaurants in Vegas.

not a fan.  the food was meh, the service was horrible.  went there for lunch today with a small group, ordered an appetizer for all to share and each ordered an individual dish.  i also ordered an ice tea - they were out.  i believe this has to be a first for a thai place.  

one of our dishes came out about 15 minutes of waiting, still no appetizer.  finally after about  30-40 minutes the appetizer came out followed by the other two dishes spaced out about 5 minutes apart.  ???  lunch took  about 1 1/2 hours and the taste wasn't worth the time it would take at panda.  f this place.  don't go.

I had the lunch special (Chicken Katsu and Yellow Curry) with an iced coffee. The place was spotless, service was fantastic, incredible value for the price, and super delicious. I will absolutely be back. I'm so happy I found this place. It was lovely. My only "complaint" is that they warned me against getting the spiciest option of 1 out of 5. I went with a 3 which was not spicy at all for me - so next time I'll go with a 4!
Definitely coming back again. It was about 15 minutes to close when we showed up , got in and ordered 7 items it was the fastest service ever! Good food good service!

I heard about this place because one of my patients told me that they have the best thai food! She brags about how good it is and not even other thai place could ever compare to it.

I see how a lot of people like this place and gave such a great ratings but for me its good but its not the best thai restaurant here in Vegas. 

I didnt like how the noodles for the pad thai is overcooked!!!! It also lack of flavor!

We also ordered this shrimp that is wrap in crispy noodle which is really great and the papaya salad. They also have happy hour!!!! I also liked the crab fried rice!! I cant say much about the food because it didnt really surprised me on how good it was. 

The service...well theres this one guy who is very attentive!! He's the only guy I saw checking up on everyone. Our other server (wearing glasses) shes also pretty nice...but I think they could do better especially how if we mentioned their names on survey they get a trip to Disney!! They also need to smile a lil more often!!!

Excellent food! We tried the pad see ewe, the pineapple fried rice, the veggie egg rolls, papaya shrimp salad, and some interesting shrimp with fried noodles around it... all of them were super good!!! The spice level 3 was perfect for me and I'm a fan of spice. The atmosphere was pretty chill and the waitresses were really attentive. I like this little hole in the wall, I'll definitely come back!

Avoid weekends at all cost.....service becomes subpar and the quality and the,temperature  of the food becomes an issue. They are so popular that waiting lines form on Saturday and Sunday. We find that when you eat their 
During the week it is much much better. Overall the quality of the food is excellent, however the service is disorganized, sloppy, I n attentive and unprofessional. Their dishes and authenticity are superb.

Went back to Weera Thai- glad to say they are back to their stellar ways.
Had Jungle Curry- which was amazing.
Took friends with me and they also loved it.
They are the best

We came to eat here many times . And i finally have time to rate 5 star for one of my favorite thai place . We love all of their menu even appetizer, entree , desert and the chef's recommend. Their food are delicious . Service is great .

Hidden gem on Sahara Avenue! Seen their IG Page and decided to give it a try!

No wait time, and we were seated right away. We were a party of 4 and ordered a variety of dishes. 

The staff were friendly, the atmosphere was clean and the food came out in a timely manner. 

Also the prices were pretty reasonable.

I deducted one star because our waitress took a long time bringing out the drink menu and she forgot about our drink orders. We had to wave them down for water refills. Apparently, there was a celebrity sitting next to us and everyone was attending to them and taking pictures.

Stopped by because a friend recommending it, I had the sweet and sour chicken and shared some soup a friend. Both were very good, the service was fast and the Tom ka gai was amazing. Looking forward to going back and trying the curry!

What an amazing gem in a multi decade old strip mall. Weera Thai's service, food quality, and ambiance is spot on! Our family ordered a few Happy Hour items like the delicious chicken wings complimented with a Thai sweet chili sauce-DIVINE!! The Glass noodle salad was perfectly flavored. The wok heat infused fried rice was amazing---everyone competed for the last grain. The Red Curry was creamy and smooth. Prices are unbeatable for the authentic flavored!!

I have to admit I was pretty skeptical at first when my friend found this place. The parking lot seem a bit run down and space was limited. But the steller yelp reviews convinced me to give it a try.

We ordered the lunch special Chicken Pad Thai and Beef Pad Thai. The pad thai noodles is well-cooked. The flavor was on point and the dish was huge. It also come with a spring roll, salad and soup. I highly recommended the pad thai because the taste of the dish was really unique and amazing. We also ordered the Chicken Teriyaki and the serving was also huge. The chicken teriyaki has a lot of sauce but other will enjoy it.

This place is incredible! The food tasted so authentic that I can't wait to give it a 5-stars! The only reason that it loses a star is because the waiter seem to only be serving the large party and neglected the other tables. I will be back soon!
Food is so so, order super spicy. It's the weakest I've eaten in my life, as if they did not add any chile to it at all.
Delicious food! Large portions! Heard about it from a friend who always eats at Weera Thai when she's in Las Vegas. I will definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas as well.

best thai place i've ever been to in the west coast. seriously changed my mind about thai curry and overall quality of thai cuisine. came with my best friends for dinner after a long work day and sat bar-side with Ken as our bartender/server. 

he highly recommended the crispy duck panang curry so i ventured to get it, and boy did i not regret that! it was honestly so delicious with enriching flavors of fresh herb & thai spices wrapped in a subtle coconut essence. so so good! not too thick and just so delicious!! 

we shared a sampler plate for an appetizer and got some desserts as well! 

the main meal left me craving more even the next day! overall, the quality of everything we ordered was astounding and we went back for take out the next day!

My wife and I come here about twice a month and always enjoy it.  The staff is always smiling and friendly.  The food is very good, especially the Tom yum soup!!! The fresh spring rolls are a great appetizer!!

The spicy beef salad is my favorite here!! I don't even like spicy food. But I will eat this every time I'm
In Vegas !

The staff here is very terrible service, first time there our party of 16 they said we too loud, second time there, we left over with some food they said we can't pack to go because it happy hour special, and today we were there party of 14 , my son come before us around 10 min the servers said he can't sit there and wait for everybody, I want to know what kind a service they serve here? needless to say we will not be coming back.

I went for their lunch special, but they ran out of soup. They also ran out of eggrolls. They also ran out of curry. It took forty-five minutes for them to make new curry. 

The extra star is for the service. Our waitress was very nice and apologetic about things which she couldn't control. 

After I ate, I also ran out. I'm not running back in either.

I found this place on Yelp and was extremely disappointed! First off, the hostess quickly seated me. Unfortunately, I had to ask for someone to take my order after waiting 10 minutes. 

I was also appalled that it shows that they have happy on the door, which is the reason why i went out of my way to go there as it was also advertised on Yelp. I was told by the server that the won't offer happy hour until February 2018. 

That sounds like false advertisement to me and very deceiving. I decided to order the papaya salad, and the spicy friend rice. I must say they give you a lot of food. I'm giving it a the lowest star due to the false advertisement listed on the door and on yelp.

I love the food, but on today the service left something to be desired. First others order were taken before me when I was seated before them. Then I watched as their water was topped off 3 times while mine never got topped off, I was never asked. 

I am a great patron and my office is closeby. I order large for my meetings and staff but after being treated poorly, I'm not so sure. 

Do better with treating all of your paying customers the same regardless of their differences?
One of the best Thai places in Las Vegas. Ordering out is awesome, dining in is a bit cramped but worth it. Great lunch specials.

This place has become one of my favorite Thai restaurants here in Vegas. The restaurant is very sanitary with  delicious food and great atmosphere. Their customer service is on point. All the employees are very friendly, especially TK. If you're looking for a great quality Thai restaurant, I definitely recommend this place.
Very good Thai food in Las Vegas and really authentic If you fine Thai restaurant I really recommend this restaurant for you. You will be happy and enjoy.

Great Thai food! We made a spontaneous decision to stop in here for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon. The place is nice and clean and the service is friendly. The best part is the food, though! I had the sweet basil with chicken and my hubby had the duck ka pow. Both were excellent! My only complaint is that we like really spicy, so we ordered ours as a 4 (out of 5.) Both were very flavorful but not spicy, so next time we'll order 5s. But there will certainly be a next time, because we'll be back! This place kills Archi's, King & I, and other local Thai restaurants.

Yelp convinced me to try it.  Just as good as the Noodle House and more decorated.  Pad See Ew noodles were best entree we had.  Not all thai restaurants have green papaya salad so this suggests more authentic cuisine...the papaya salad was good too.  Ultimate test though was that both of my kids liked the food!

I only gave this place 1 stars because the staff is so friendly. However my husband and and I ordered 2 orders of Basil chicken and the chicken was tough, the sauce was extremely liquidy, and it didn't come with much meat. We wish we would have stuck with our Thai place Thai St Cafe which has fresh delicious food and you get a great amount. Sad to say we won't be back here.

Yum... Wish it was open late night... That being said there papaya salad is fantastic they have fresh spring rolls that are delicious with shrimp or tofu...and there Tom Yum soup is outstanding.  Any time I visit my Nana or I am on this side of town, I always order Thai from Weera.  They also take American Express #bonus
Amazing mixed vegetable with shrimp. I can see why this place is busy on a Tuesday night at 8pm.

We must've ordered the wrong things off the menu because the food isn't as great as everyone said. The Massaman curry was very liquidy and doesn't have half the flavor as the authentic curry I've had. But I do have to say their service is nice and quick.

I probably won't be coming back for the food considering the flood of Thai restaurants in Vegas.
One of the best places I've been to for tai. Great food and service. Highly recommend.

We ate there last week and we are still  raving  about the food. The restaurant  is on the opposite  side of town from where we live, but was well worth  the drive. Everything  we ordered  from appetizers  to desert  was excellent. I especially  liked  the fresh spring rolls  with peanut sauce.

Some of the best Thai food I've had in Las Vegas. Even though it took me YEARS to walk in the door.  The staff is very kind too. 

PROS: Mee krab
            Khao Soi (Northern Thai dish only available here and Lotus of Siam)
            Grilled ribeye Thai style
             Papaya Salad

CONS:  Fried Papaya salad
The food & service are excellent. We were in Vegas for 4 days and ate at this restaurant twice. Price is very reasonable for a big portion.

Quality Thai food for a great price! Especially their lunch specials, you get soup and salad, along with your dish which is a food portion. Everything was flavorful, service was quick. Would definitely recommend!

I come here more than I'd like to admit. They're service has always been great they are always very attentive and make sure everything comes out great. They're good is mouth watering good even when you are done eating. Their curries are my favorite, along with the papaya salads and chicken satay.

Just had Panang curry(the best thai food ever) w/spicy level(5) + Phad thai + Fried rice  GREAT FOOD 
2000% recommend this place!!!

Had dinner here with friends.  Totally forgot to take pics before we dug in.  The crispy duck salad was wonderful!  Had green curry and yellow curry and fried rice.  I'm thinking you can't go wrong with anything you order here.  Used Open Table to get a reservation, very convenient, good service and good food.  Great place would definitely go back again!

For the last two years my fiancé and I have been coming here at least once every other week, and we've never left disappointed. Their food is always delicious and hits the spot, their servers are always nice and recognize regulars, which makes you feel welcomed and at home.

Every time I come to las Vegas, I can't wait to get my Weera Thai! I always get the Massuman Curry with tofu and pineapple or Panang Curry with pineapple. So addicting!  Oh.....and don't ever forget the crab Rangoon! :)

Authentic Thai food! Tom Kha served in hotspot was outstanding...so was Pad Se Ew yellow curry. Excellent and efficient service - one superwoman of lady who took orders and served and brought our check and everything else!

I tried this restaurant on my birthday 2 days ago because I love Thai food. I'm so happy I went here. This is by far, hands down the best Thai food I've had in all of Las Vegas. The ambience is just right , service was great and the food was excellent. Hubby had the crispy duck curry. It was superb. I ordered the soft shell crab papaya salad but did not realize till I got to the meat, that they had given me the crispy duck salad by mistake. Brought this to the waitress attention, she took responsibility and compt me the dinner. Told her I will be back to try that crab salad.! I've had duck in a lot of Thai restaurants and been so dissatisfied because they give you all the fatty and skin parts. Here you got succulent pieces of duck meat. The appetizers tasted like authentic meat not meat fillers. The mango mojito was absolutely delicious.
I was looking for a Thai restaurant and found this place on my way. I have to say that the Food was great !!!! Nice atmosphere and service.

Enjoyed all the food we ordered, spicy was just right, and service was super busy and we got our order taken.  Only gripe was we didn't get the happy hour menu, later saw it at table next to us and wanted mussels but it was too late!

I love Weera.. my go-to thai place when I'm at work. The restaurant has been recently remodeled, really nice inside. Bigger space, too. I like that they have Isaan food, they have tons of stuff you can't get at other thai places. Place is always busy now during lunch time, be prepared for a long wait.

The people seem nice when i order take out. It was also really good the one time we ordered from their lunch menu, but unfortunately, that was the only time it was good. 

Ive ordered the pad thai two other times and though it wasnt bad, it was just lacking in taste. 

The crab ragoon are 99.99% cream cheese. I had to open them up to even check if there was any crab in there. I love cream cheese, but even I dont love it that much.
Delicious. We had delivered. They were quick and friendly. Highly recommend the Pananag curry and the pad se ewe.
The food was affordable and staff was very friendly. I'm vegan and they were nice about making changes to the dishes on the menu for me.

We went here because of a Living Social and man was it worth it!  We ordered two wonderful soups, Tom Kha Gai and another soup with shrimp in it.  Delicious.  The papaya salad was beautiful, but my favorite was the Pineapple Fried Rice, a must try.  We also had a seafood dish with various seafood, salmon, shrimp, mussels in a wonderful broth.  We will be back and we are fans!  The waitresses were very sweet and extremely polite which isn't a regular thing in LV.  Namaste Weera Thai!

The place is decorated very pretty and intimate. I came with my friends and family for a celebration. The food was fantastic. Some dishes tasted just as good as when I went to Thailand. The spices were  so fresh and fragrant. The service was excellent. I will definitely be back. Thank you to Weera Thai. Las Vegas local Thai spot

Not good. Red curry had lots of spice and no flavor. Chow mein was a thin ramen looking noodle. Tons of MSG! Made us sick. Very overpriced! Cloth table cloths were covered in glass, but the part that hangs over my lap was VERY dirty!
Great food at the right price this close to the strip. Make sure to ask for TK for all your dining needs.

Don't let the sketchy strip mall exterior fool you -- Weera Thai is beautiful on the inside. I can't believe I waited this long to visit. 

It was a joint birthday dinner for yours truly and three other celebrants. We were a party of 15, plus a baby... That undertaking alone deserves 5 stars. Sure, there were a couple of entree mixups and blunders on the receipts (yes plural, we were one of those tables that night, sorry), but overall we received attentive and friendly service from the waitstaff. 

The red interior with golden trimmings is such an elegant look. Definitely complemented our photos for the night. From the chandeliers to the miniature bells in the divider wall, you can tell they put effort into what I'm assuming is a fairly recent renovation.

Food was delicious and comparable to most Thai restaurants. The plating made the cuisine all the more appetizing. I tried a few, but here are some highlights:

-- Sliced duck (the sauce made it taste less gamey)
-- Yellow curry (holy smokes, probably the biggest portion I've seen)
-- Pad See Ew with tofu (I confess that this my go-to)
-- Durian dessert (deep fried with a dipping sauce)
-- Coconut ice cream (crowd favorite, at least with our table) 

Happy hour every day from 4-7pm, not 8pm.

Great restaurant with excellent service. I went in for lunch with my boyfriend and we loved our food! I got the green curry with Tofu and some vegetables. Since i ordered a lunch special, we also got roll and salad. Salad was very basic and sauce was okay but things were delicious after that. 

I also ordered a coconut drink on the side and display was amazing. :) Overall, i loved this place and the service. Check them out
My wife and I have visited this restaurant  twice and we love the food and service.  We are their customers for the foreseeable future unless a disaster occurs.

Great food quality.  First off, parking can be a pain if you're there during peak meal times, as it's right off of Sahara in a mini strip building.
We ordered to eat family style and got:  Calamari, Yellow Chicken Curry, Duck Pad Thai, Seafood Pad Thai, Fresh Spring Rolls, Spicy Eggplant and the Mango with Sweet Rice for dessert.  Everything was delicious.  The Seafood PT had calamari w/o the batter and even had muscles.  Something out of the ordinary for me, a seafood lover.  The Eggplant had a good kick to it, but delicious and is great to have as a veggie dish.
The Crabstick appetizer is very popular because we originally ordered it to start with, but they were out.  So probably a must try!
The 3 stars is only because of it's location, parking, and distance from my house.  I feel as though with all the competing restaurants in Las Vegas, I'm sure to find one just as good closer to me.

Not fancy just plain good. I felt that this is one of the better Green Curry dishes out in the land of Thai food. Appreciated the mix of red and green peppers in the sauce as well as eggplant. It was a nice change from a massive amount of green beans. 

There is a discount for patrons if you go on FB and like their page. 

Service was excellent. The restaurant was empty but it was close to closing time also.

I'm a fan. Lunch specials every day -- that includes weekends -- are from 11am - 3pm. Each item includes soup, egg roll, salad, and rice. And they don't skimp on portion size. Chance are you'll leave satisfied. The yellow curry was awesome, although could have had a little more chicken. Pad Thai and the cashew nut chicken were excellent too. Service was friendly and quick and prices are inexpensive.

Based on the reviews given, we decided to purchase a $30 Living Social deal.  The spicy scale level is from a 1-5.  We ordered the Duck Curry, Spicy level #3 and the crab fried rice.

After reading others review about how their spicy isn't really spicy, we expected just that.  To our surprise, the spicy 3 is quite spicy!  I love to drench my brown rice with the curry, but not for this meal. The crab fried rice was good.  There were chunks of real crab meat in this dish.  I really liked it.  We ended our meal with the durian on sticky rice.  I enjoyed it so much that we went to China town on Friday, picked up a durian and will try to duplicate that dessert today.  Yum.  But again, durian is an acquired test...
Great Thai delivery! Consistent and never disappoints. Lotus of Siam is my dinner favorite but this is my favorite Thai lunch.

If it was not for the fact that it took about 15-20 mins for them to remember us after we were seated then I would have given them a higher rating. By this point, no one had came over to get our drink orders, but we were well prepared with both our drink and food orders by the time that they remembered us. During this time frame, we both tried to make eye contact with one of their 3 servers to no avail. 

Onto the food!

The Crab Rangoon was definitely packed in there and it had too much cream cheese for my taste, but my boyfriend loved it. Continuing my quest for my favorite panang curry in town, we ordered the Chicken Panang Curry at Weera. It was pretty good here with just the right kick of spice and there was a lot of chicken in the curry. We also ordered the Kao Moo Dang and Moo Grob and it was pretty tasty. It has BBQ Pork and Fried Pork Belly covered in sweet tamarind sauce and served with rice.

I love Weera! A friend introduced me about a year ago and I have brought my family and other friends to try since. I tend to stick to the same things (tofu spring rolls and tom ka gai (coconut soup), but they have an excellent selection of appetizers, noodles, and curry too. During my last visit, I wasn't feeling that great so when staff attempted to sit us close to the door, I quickly requested another seat to avoid the draft. We were quickly accommodated and served hot tea, which made me feel really great. I will definitely be back in the future!
Wow we came here last night we really enjoyed the food and the price no one can beat the service is perfect as well of course ! We will be back and highly recommend!
had dinner and place was nice, service is good. had a good dinner with my fave phad thai.

One of the best Thai restaurants in all the Las Vegas Valley. The quality and freshness of their food, as well as the unique tastes they bring out of traditional dishes like Panang chicken or Pad Thai is as good as I've seen anywhere around the world. Friendly staff, good service when dining in, great take out service as well. Highly recommend trying this gem of a spot.

This is probably my favorite Thai spot in Vegas. I've been to many Thai restaurants in Vegas, and this place tops all of them. Every dish is just so flavorful and the quality of the food is exceptional. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The restaurant is well-kept and clean, which for me is a BIG deal. 5 stars well deserved, for sure.

I love this place so much. We lived in Thailand 3 years, I'm crazy about Thai food. And here it's super delicious! Also it's very big portions. Nice service and helpful waitresses. You should definitely visit it. My favorite place in Vegas with Asian cuisine.

Well as far as strip mall Thai food goes, this place is pretty good. We were greeted promptly and seated immediately. It was a bit drafty as we were seated near the door, but you could always ask to be moved farther away. 

I ordered Pad Thai with a level 5 spice. I got Pad Thai with maybe a level 3 spice. I asked for a spice rack though and was able to add mine own spice. Otherwise the taste was good and the noodles were cooked just right. The Riesling I ordered also went well with the dish. 

The wait staff was courteous. The menu went on and on but not in a good way. Too many options was a little overwhelming.

Fell involve with this place. My friend had suggested coming here for our lunch break. Initially, I was reluctant as I did see this restaurant in a segment on dirty dining. I didn't really trust that this place would be decent. But that exceeded my expectations. 

As soon as you walk in the place is nicely decorated with the theme that seemed like black and red. It was fancier than I thought it would be. The waiters were dressed nicely and they had nice decor on the walls, TV, and nice murals on the wall. They also had some fancy chandeliers hanging up. The place looked very clean overall. 

Since our purpose here was for lunch, we had ordered from the lunch menu. I ended up getting the tom kha with rice noodle. My friends ordered the ground beef with basil and chicken panang. They first served us with the side of soup and salad. The salad dressing was so good!! And for the soup, they served tom kha! Which was nice, since I thought they would just include some cheap soup that included with our meal. When our meals came out, they were a big portion! much bigger than we thought. The food was packed with flavor and I loved my order! 

My friends and I also got a free thai tea when we check in on yet, how great is that! Also our server ying was super helpful and patient with us. 

Ever since then this has been our go-to spot for lunch! I heard there's a happy hour with a different menu so I definitely want to come back to try that next time!
I'm from Thailand, and I can say that "Weera Thai Restaurant" is one of the best and most authentic Thai restaurants in the US!! Believe me! My Thai friends and family love this restaurant too.

Delicious Thai Tea and free refills really put a smile on my face while eating here but sadly that was the highlight of the meal. I ordered the Pad Thai and much to my surprise it was bland. I've had better at Pei Wei to be honest. I also had some orange chicken and it seemed to taste like a jello packet mixed with warm water drizzled over some chicken that was severely over fried. No heat from either of the dishes and what seemed to me at least to be very small portions. Based off how other people feel about this place I have to assume their real chef took a day off and some waiter was the one cooking. 

Thai Tea was truly amazing, the food was not.

Ordered the chicken pad Thai. Level 3 wasn't as hot as I would have liked but good flavor. The Thai tea was delicious. The salad dressing on the lunch special salad was awesome as well! Will definitely come again!

Amazing service and even better food! Thai food can be found almost on every corner here in Vegas, so it's not always easy to find the good ones. I ordered the vegetable spring rolls as an appetizer and they were absolutely incredible. A vegetable curry followed. The service was quick and the flavors were spot on.

Great lunch specials that include a drink for 8 dollars! Their shrimp spring rolls are  delicious but the peanut sauce is a little bit sweeter than I prefer.  Small dining area that recently expanded to accommodate more guests.  Fairly fast service.  It's a very popular place for my coworkers.  The lunch special comes with soup and includes your drink I believe.
This place is AWESOME!!! Excellent Thai food, service, and atmosphere! I started coming here recently and it's now my favorite Thai food place in town. Eat here, you won't be disappointed!
Food was great but the service was a little slow. Maybe it was an off day but the waitress was really nice.

Love this place! Incredible service, great food and awesome atmosphere.
The cost is great too for a budget! 
May be my favorite in Vegas!
best effen thai i've had in vegas!!! pad thai, curry, fried rice, thai ice tea all amazing!!!
It is all or nothing of for me in the food industry. Great place. I have enjoyed the food and prices every time. I drive across Las Vegas to come here to eat. Orange Chicken is delicious.

Good ambience and service. We got the Tom Yum Kung, Pad See Ew, and Papaya Salad (Spiciness level 2) and it was all really tasty. The Papaya Salad was one of the best I've ever had, but, good lord, was it spicy! It really whetted our appetite for the other food, though, and after the first 5 minutes my tastebuds settled down to a mild buzzing. I downed the huge Thai tea I got so quickly... If you have congested sinuses, this will definitely open it up, haha! 

The atmosphere here was relatively relaxed and didn't overstimulate our child. And the food came out pretty quickly, which was great because we were really pushing our 10 month old's bed time (our dining out is completely dictated by our baby, lol). Overall, very satisfied.

Wonderful service. Wonderful food. Very clean. My new favorite Thai place in Vegas !!!! 
Yass

I can't believe it's my first time here, I've been missing out!  Everything was really good! And we got a lot. Also, my cousin is vegan so we got no oyster sauce or egg on the pad see ewe and it was actually probably one of the best I've had. Pumpkin red curry was out of this world
Love the food! The duck curry is delicious.  Been going here for years. The service is good and the owner is friendly. Lunch specials are quick and easy too.

Great authentic Thai food. Highly recommended by a thai friend. 
Tom kak kai (coconut milk chicken soup) was delicious. Will definitely be a regular.

This my go to spot for Thai Cuisine. Coming from California, there are no places that can compare in my opinion. The food is delicious, the portions are more than enough and the price is definitely reasonable. Thai tea is always a must when I come here. If you come from 11am-3pm you can get lunch specials that come with a delicious soup and salad and for a good price. Don't be drawn away from the exterior look, you'll be surprised when you walk into the door. This place is a must of you have a taste for genuine Thai Food.

Weera is a bit of a drive for my husband and me, but we heard lots of good stuff, so we made the journey down Sahara.  

When I walked in, I stepped on a piece of gum on the carpet.  Hm.
We were shown to our booth, which are in desperate need of restuffing.  I literally sank into a hole. Hmm.
I ordered pad kea mow and my husband ordered a garlic shrimp type dish.  In both of our dishes, the vegetables were still raw.  My pad kea mow was bland.  Hmmm.

Considering that Weera is pretty far from us, and there are places like Archi's or Pan Asian closer...I don't think I'll visit this place again.

With a redesigned interior that adds a genuine Thai feel to it, Weera Thai is a nice go-to place for lunch or dinner. Since it was our last day in Vegas, my family and I decided to head to this Thai place (recommended to us by one of my father's friends). It sure is a great place for lunch.

SERVICE: 85 / 100
The servers were quick and attentive to our needs, refilling water whenever it was empty, and fulfilling our requests for additional napkins or condiments. That's about it; they were nice, but not intimate and conversational.

FOOD: 75 / 100
Salad and Soup: This was included as part of the lunch special. While the greens were fresh and the cherry tomatoes were nice and sweet, the zesty vinaigrette proved to be overly sweet and overpowered the freshness. The soup had a nice kick of spice, but otherwise lacked depth of flavor. The tofu was unnecessary. Overall, not a bad side to the lunch special, but simple is better.

Fried Calamari: The Calamari was nice and crunchy, yet maintained its al dente on the inside. The flavor was nice and subtle, and the dipping sauces elevate the calamari to a whole new level!

Weera Sampler Plate: The crab rangoon weirdly felt out of place, as rangoon is not a side dish Thai people usually eat. That being said, avoid it at all costs; very bland, lacks in flavor, and full of cream cheese! The spring roll (no, it isn't fried) was very fresh and minty, though note that without the dipping sauce, the mint overpowers your mouth fairly quickly. Sadly, I was unable to try the chicken wings and the crab sticks, as my family demolished them!

Beef Pad Thai: Pad Thai is a classic dish, and the flavors have replicated well here. While a tad bit too sweet for my tastes and the beef quite dry, the spice is there and the overall flavor is something that only genuine Thai chefs can replicate. Noodles were nice and al dente.

VALUE: 80 / 100
Had we forgone the Weera Sampler Plate, this would be an excellent value. $70 for a family of four isn't bad, but the appetizers simply don't add on to the value. The lunch specials are an amazing value; if you get the chance to stop by for lunch, do so!


OVERALL SCORE: 80 / 100
Service is fast and attentive, and the menu selection is vast! Sadly, some of the dishes are underwhelming and flavor lacked a bit in the dishes I did order. Nonetheless, this is a great go-to for lunch with their Lunch Special!

----------

TL;DR: A nice go-to Thai place a short drive just off the Vegas Strip. You can't go wrong with the value here, but choose your dishes and spiciness levels wisely.

This is a hidden gem on the busy side of Sahara.  Decided to go for lunch with some of the coworkers. You wouldn't expect this restaurant to look so nice based on the location. Service was amazing, the owner was great and the food was delicious!!! 

We had the soft shell crab salad. I didn't even have time to take a picture because we were like scavengers who hadn't eaten in a week. It was gone in an instant. The mangoes were so yummy in it and the crisp of the deep fried crab made it even better.  I really don't like to order salads because I'm just not a salad person but would order this salad again and even try some of the others.  

We also had some of the norms; yellow curry, panang, spicy basil, and some orange chicken. We tried something different on the yellow chicken and opted for fried chicken instead of the regular. 

They have a pretty extensive menu which I also noticed other items such as crispy duck. How can you not go back to try that? Definitely a place I'd like to revisit and try some of the other not so popular dishes.

This small wonderful place away from the Vegas strip has the best Chicken Curry I have ever had. I would recommend this place to Everybody and the workers are very nice too. Great price and that is all about that - go yellow chicken Curry :)

Really authentic Thai...don't judge this place by it's location!(shady strip mall.....) Extensive menu, reasonably priced and really nicely decorated inside. Free Thai tea when you check-in! Crab Rangoon is some of the best I've had in town! Perfect balance of crab and cream cheese! Definitely my new go to Thai spot in town!

Came here with a party of five close to closing time. The staff were very friendly and didn't seem too put out when we stayed a bit past closing. The food was all very good, especially the Green Curry. We all managed to scrape the plates clean and the bill for the five of us was $100 before our wondrous Groupon, which took off $40.  The neighborhood was kinda shady looking though.

TLDR: Excellent customer service, $7.99+ lunch specials from 11a-3:30p, FiveStars rewards program enabled, upscale ambiance, Thai Issan flavors for all  flavor palettes.

While no restaurant in the United States can ever be exactly like the flavors back in Thailand, this place comes really close! I actually came to eat here by happenstance. In what appears to be a sleazy strip mall, the diadem of Thai flavors is hidden amongst the now-gone seedy massage parlors. I walked into friendly greetings and a warm smile. As the years past, this restaurant has expanded into an upscale ambiance, where you can dine in dressed-up attire or gym clothes, as I have often done.

At first, I kept coming back due to their lunch specials. A heaping portion of THE BEST pad thai in the Western United States, a bowl of field greens salad, and a cup of soup de jour ranging from tom kha to tom yum to accompany the egg roll allowed this pescatarian to enjoy great food without having to pick out bits of chicken or beef or pork. I have tried other pad thai dishes in Nevada, California, and Arizona based on Yelpers in those regions and nothing has come close to the sweet and savory flavors in Weera Thai's pad thai.

Albeit the food warms the soul, I keep coming back due to the consistency that Weera Thai provides during lunch and dinner. Yeah you get the occasional heavy hand with the same spice level, but the food and customer service always remains top notch. Refills of water without asking, new silverware and plates between courses, and a rotating "specials" menu will have you asking how such a 5-star location continues growing its business off the Strip.

Chef Peter and Sasi is the duo you wish to grow up and emulate when you find that special someone. Their hearts are just as big as their creative ingenuity. You are always treated with the utmost respect from the staff, even the people that yell angry epithets at them for their food not coming out as quickly as fast food. They are always appreciative of your business, feedback, and happy demeanor after sharing a meal with them. Kudos to Weera Thai. You'll be sure to see me here at least once every week. :]

First time for Thia food. But oh my!  I thought was alotte hole in the wall.  When you walk in it is a total surprise.  There is a drink that is locked a mint julep  but with sake.   Will going back and explore.

So we were visiting Vegas and we really wanted to stay away from the restaurants on the strip for some quiet time then I remembered, I got this Groupon deal online.  Since we have a rental car, it wasn't a big deal driving there.  The place is located in a quiet strip mall with tons of parking.

My husband was craving for some real coconut and being from the Philippine Island, we grew up eating this stuff.  I was really surprised that it tasted exactly like it was in the islands - fresh, sweet and refreshing.  If I didn't eat too much, I can probably finish another one.  So when you come, make sure you order that!

To eat, we had the Crispy Duck Salad and the Garlic SeaBass.  If you know me, crispy duck and sea bass are two of my favorite things!   They were wonderful.  The servings were enormous and can actually feed 4 people total.   We decided we didn't want to waste any food so we sat there for hours and savored our food down to the last morsel.  In the end, we had difficulty standing up and walking to our car but no regrets!  The best Thai food we ever had:))

And as a bonus, the staff are all very friendly and nice.  They never stopped checking on us and they're always smiling.  That's probably the reason why we ate so much!

5 stars for the service! Super friendly. Ive heard about this place for awhile and decided to give it a try today, we got curry puff, beef jerky, crab rangoon, sticky rice, wonton soup, mongolian beef and crispy duck panang curry. I have to say I'm not a fan of the food unfortunately. Just my taste? The crispy duck is the only thing that I loved.
Service sucks plus they charge you for easy ice! Wtf?????? They took forever with the food and the check. Food it's just ok

Great little hidden spot for some great authentic Thai food. Good lunch special for I believe 7.95 or 8.95... I get the red curry chicken ( really good and a nice big portion). Located in a strip mall - this place is lean and nice inside with good service!!
The food taste and the services are consistent. A perfect spot for authentic Thai food!

First thing I noticed was how clean the place was. Also (I know this is going to sound weird) but I really appreciated that the bathrooms were in the back and had a door separating them from the restaurant. The dining area is small, and I can't stand when you can see a bathroom from where you are eating, the last thing I want to hear is a toilet flushing while I'm eating. 

Onto the food. My friend I was with had never had a papaya salad before (one of my staples when I'm eating Thai) she doesn't like spicy food, so I had to tone it down for her, we ordered 2/5, it is true Thai Chili spice, so be careful when ordering. This was perfect. I ordered the Garlic Shrimp, this was the chef's special, it wasn't your typical garlic shrimp that I'm used to ordering. The shrimp are actually pan fried and served with the shells on. I was trying to be healthy, so I was a bit disappointed when I saw that it was pan fried, but it was really good. If you're not ok with eating the shells, I wouldn't bother ordering this dish. My friend had the Tofu Panang, she raved that it was the best she has ever had. 

Their menu is $3-4 higher on each dish than other Thai places in town. They do have a full Issan style menu.

Came here on a Saturday night thanks to groupon. Paid $12, but worth $25 at the restaurant. When we walked inside no one was eating and I thought it was kind of odd considering it was a Saturday night.  We immediately ordered our Thai Teas and since I have been craving curry for so long I ordered the yellow curry with chicken (yes, I know I like to play it safe). For our appetizer we had the fresh spring rolls with tofu. And when I took my first bite I tasted the rice noodles and something else almost like meat. But it was actually the tofu! The peanut sauce was also a nice compliment!  Very tasty and I recommend ordering this if you're contemplating on ordering an appetizer. The curry was pretty good hardly any spice at all because I requested for level 1 (their spice scale here is 1-5). The dish also had carrots and potatoes. Does this normally come with potatoes because I wasn't expecting it at all? The servers were very friendly and checked up on us regularly. They require a $15 minimum with card or they charge you a .25 cents fee, which is not bad at all. I don't think I'd be back here again, but worth going to if you're going to use a groupon, yelp deal, or living social coupon.

Aside from Lotus of Siam, Thai restaurants in Las Vegas are a dime, a dozen. It's very difficult to differentiate Thai restaurants because after a couple of visits, they all start to meld into one another. Every restaurant offers pad thai and every restaurant offers some rendition of red, green, or yellow curry. But, at least Weera Thai attempts to satisfy both Americanized taste of Thai cuisine as well as bring in regionalized Thai tastes on their menu. For example, Weera Thai has an entire section of their menu dedicated to the Issan, northeastern region of Thailand. 

In addition to lunch specials, I love that Weera Thai has a happy hour from 4-8 pm daily. Beers and wines are $3 and appetizers such as an assortment of different mussels, chicken wings, and soups are $5-6. My favorite was the tung thong, crispy fried dumplings with shrimp and chicken with a delicious, sweet chili sauce. For additional value to your meal, mobile check-in on Yelp nets you a free Thai iced tea (one per person).

As for dishes, I'm a creature of habit and although most Thai plates are the same throughout, I've had some pretty poorly cooked noodles (the ones that just come clumped together). The pad thai is better than your average in terms of freshness of ingredients. I've always found every single time I've ordered this dish, the chicken is overcooked and rubbery, but the peanuts, bean sprouts were all placed on the side for you to mix and egg and noodles were well done. The tom yum kai was also better than your average. The panang roast duck curry came highly recommended by the waiter and was full of coconut flavor. But, for some reason, it's hard to enjoy both flavors of the curry and the duck when both are too bold for one another to go together for me. Overall, I enjoyed Weera Thai and find it as a legitimate, cheaper alternative to Lotus of Siam.

Really good Thai Restaurant. Great service too. Yummy Pad Thai and The coconut sauce for their Panamg is simply the best I ever had. Spicy and Sweet Basil, crab fried rice, calamares and beef salad are so good. Desserts are amazing too. We tried the Mango sticky rice and roti with taro ice cream and we loved it! We'll be back for sure.

Classy joint, OK taste-wise, and service was not bad. The staples were ok, (I'm secretly on a world mission to try all the Tom Ka Kai from all the Thai restaurants around the world. The 4 stars reflect my impression of this)

The yelp deal brought the total price down to about 20 bucks, so expect about 30 if you're two guys whom are suffering from the First World ailment of overeating and gorging yourself.

You might be able to eat cheaper. 

I dare you.

Was delicious food!

We ordered shrimp Tom yum soup, chef's choice: soft shell crab w panang curry, and beef pad seew. Yum yum yum. 

I would go there again.

This Thai spot has got to be one of the best Thai restaurants I've ever experienced in my life. Of course, I've never traveled to Thailand, and am as white as a person can be without being a ghost. But I know what I like!

Weera Thai was a whole new experience on Thai food, and this started as soon as I stepped in the restaurant. (The outside signage doesn't exactly capture the magical atmosphere of inside.) The decor was plentiful, bright, and detailed. I recall reddish papered or textured walls and lots of statues/figurines. I assume it was a (super successful) aim at engulfing customers in Thai culture.

The environment was obviously stellar, but the food was 10x more so! I ordered the Pad Thai as I am not usually fond of Thai curries due to coconut after tastes. (And who doesn't love fried noodles?) Now, I am accustomed to Pad Thai dishes having strong spices/flavors, but this was like tingles-your-tongue-with-every-bite type of deliciousness. And I love how they used thicker rice noodles rather than the thin ones that most Thai restaurants go with for this dish. A different texture worked great in this case. Also, the balance of toppings (tofu, veggies, etc.) to the carb base (noodles) was spot-on. 

Our server was also super sweet and accommodating. I definitely want to go back to this restaurant the next time we find ourselves in Las Vegas.

If this place was closer to my house I would be here all the time. 
Absolutely love the stuff chicken wing appetizer. They also have a combo appetizer which includes regular chicken wings that are so delicious. 
I always get the Tom kha Kung soup. 
Their Panang curry is the best I've had. My least favorite was the pad z ew noodle which was disappointing since that's one of my favorite Thai dishes. 
I look forward to trying it again as they have tons of items on the menu that I need to try
Immediately after my review I was messaged by the manager and I was extremely please. I came back to give it another try and I couldn't be happier. The food was fantastic and the service was superb!

I am a fan of this small but nicely decorated Thai restaurant.  I was there for the first time--certainly not the last time--Saturday night.  I had the Yelp deal and it worked beautifully.

I started with the crab stick appetizer.  Here's how the menu describes it:  Deep fried rice paper wrapped with mix crab meat & cream sauce, served with homemade plum sauce.  When I saw 6 sticks, I thought there was no way I could eat all of them and have room for dinner.  Wrong!  They were so very tasty you could never leave one to be taken away.  The plum sauce was good, and my server brought me the hot spice holder and I used some chili paste to spice up some of the sticks.

For the main course, I ordered from the Issan (northern Thailand area) part of the menu which offers foods with more spice kick.  I got the Ped Nom Tok, and the menu describes it like this:  Sliced boneless roasted duck home made with chili paste, herbs, spices & lime juice.  I asked for a spicy level of 4 out of 5.  It was spicy, but from my little array of spices, I added some extra red pepper flakes.  The dish was superb!  The mint that garnished the dish and the raw cabbage gave you something to cool your palate when the red pepper heat got to be a bit much.

Time for dessert.  I had two things in mind.  Durian sticky rice or coconut ice cream.  I had been warned that the durian would cause horrendous breath.  Anthony Bourdain describes durian this way.  "...Your breath will smell as if you'd been French-kissing your dead grandmother."  Since I was going to a show after dinner, I opted for the coconut ice cream.  It was the safer choice, and it was very good with some small chunks of coconut mixed in.

I started dinner with a Thai iced coffee and I had an order of sticky rice.

The service was fantastic.  There were three ladies who were very attentive and answered a couple of questions I had.  I thought the one was going to say "chicken" when I opted out of the durian sticky rice dessert.  

The Yelp deal worked fine.  I paid $10 and received credit for $20 from Weera.  She took the code off my iPhone and asked me to mark the deal used which I did.

As I said before, this won't be a one time visit.  It is good, and I am a fan!!  Thanks to my fellow Yelpers for letting me know this place exists.

At first, the outside did not look inviting but the minute I walked in....I felt like I stepped into Thailand....Lol.

This is definitely the best Thai food restaurant here in Las Vegas. The food is outrageously delicious! I highly recommend this place.

Good place to get good food, it's that simple. You'll get what you want and you'll probably like it. No drama. Just leftovers.

Portions are good, and since you're in vegas, that's saying something. It's clean and the servers are friendly and attentive. Heck, they even have a yelp deal, what more could you want in a restaurant?

Santi and I came to this Northern Thai restaurant after an extended search on Yelp. I wanted to find an authentic fare, and became intrigued after reading several reviews about their Issan cuisine. The squared-shaped interior started with center tables vertically arranged, followed by booths, wall-to-wall cultural artifacts, TV, and a small bar in the back. The atmosphere was casual with lots of foot traffic throughout the day.

The Khor Mee Yang ($9.95) arrived with strips and pieces of marinated charbroiled pork nicely blackened on the ends. The mix of tender charred, lean, and fatty textures was highly addictive, but the marinade and spicy tamarind sauce could have been better, as the level of spiciness was not as robust as I like it to be.

The Khao Pad Pla Salid ($9.50) included a huge portion of fried rice filled with deep fried salid fish, basil, and peppers. The fried rice carried a decent airy texture. Too much fish sauce made it too salty to my liking, but the fried fish was crispy, moist, plentiful, and nicely flavored. The server initially described this dish as "spicy fried rice." However, we didn't find a hint of heat even after we had requested these dishes to arrive Thai spicy.

Overall, portions were excellent with discernible authentic flavors. However, the level of spiciness was the absent element that could have advanced the flavors further. Contrary to other reviewers' account, our service was timely, attentive, and friendly. I would be interested in returning to give them another chance.

This review is long overdue, my apologies!! If you're looking for authentic Thai food this is the place to go! Typical Asian restaurants have subpar customer service but the ladies here are awesome! I've dined here numerous times, with girlfriends, with family, for business.. And the times we've brought our children here, anyone with kids know how hard it is to keep them quiet and their dining area as clean as possible but at times this is impossible. The ladies here still smiled, still serviced us like they did on every occasion, now that's excellent customer service! 

Just a warning on the Thai Chile, they're spicy!

There are great Thai restaurants in Vegas, but this is the best one in town. You get real authentic Thai cuisine, excellent service, and the cost is very reasonable...its a steal! Definitely my go to for Thai food.

Food: It's just okay if you like dry cardboard meat. 
We ordered stir fried rice noodles with beef ( beef is hard ).
Chicken green curry with chicken, chicken is hard too. 
Chef's special garlic spare ribs, dry again and lots of bones. 
Disappointed. 

Service: The waitress was just doing their job. Don't feel like welcoming. Also they rush to send us check, which I think it's kind of rude. 

Well not again for me!

Great food and even better service. 

The portion size is huge! And the flavor stands up to the best thai places in town. 


Enjoyed a nice glass of Riesling with our meal the sweetness balanced out the spiciness of the curry nicely. 


Me and my wife will defiantly be back again.

This place has that old school Thai restaurant vibe. The servers were very nice and helpful. The food here was really good, I ordered your typical Tom yum Kung, red Penang curry, and curry fried rice. Everything was very good, full of flavor and  the spiciness didn't over power the other ingredients. The menu also has a good size Isaan section for you Laos people out there. I will definitely be back.
They have lunch special come with salads and soup with good price. PadThai not as good as Malaysia style. The place is nice and neat.

We came here for lunch/dinner 3 days in a row during a 4 day visit to LV - it was THAT good!!! Here are my recommendations: 

Lunch or dinner: Both! I've come here for lunch, happy hour and dinner, and each time was an amazing dining experience. For best value, I'd recommend the lunch special, as it comes with soup and salad, as well as a specialty drink for only $1.50 or so. 
Drink: Thai tea! (Their tea wasn't overly sweet like some others I've tried and comes in a giant glass. Soooo good!)
Happy hour: Get the authentic Thai beer - Singha or Chang beer, or both. 
Appetizer: do yourself a favor and get the fresh spring roll. It was such a large dish for an appetizer and the peanut sauce that comes with it is the bee's knees. I got this every time I came here.
Main course: Try the Tom yum soup with noodles or the Kao Soy (spicy). The fried rice is on its own level of amazing so try that too if you can! What I loved about this place is you can adjust the level of spiciness for any dish. 
Dessert: save some room for the mango with coconut sticky rice. It is well worth it! 

You honestly can't go wrong with anything here, so just pick something and enjoy!! 
I'm so sad I don't live here so I can't come back more often. I think I am actually in love with this restaurant.

One more thing: the staff is so friendly and helpful. They were all super sweet and made dining here even more enjoyable! 

THANK YOU Weera Thai for your INCREDIBLE food and service! I will most definitely be back next time I'm in LV!

After moving to Vegas finding a good Thai Restaurant has been hard but we finally hit the jackpot! For a family a 4 expect to spend about 60 dollars on average but totally worth it! 

I can truthfully say they have THE BEST chicken pad-see-ew I have tasted! Shrimp Pad-Thai was my hubby's choice and he loves it, which is strange ... satisfying his taste buds is HARD (trust me I know, I cook for him everyday...not saying I am a bad cook, or am I?) any how, fried rice was excellent as well. I can easily say customer service was good! They made our favorite cucumber salad, our special way and nail it! Writing this review is making me hungry again!!! Anyway if you are ever in the mood for Thai please pay them a visit you wont regret it!

Wow ! Best papaya salad in town. So fresh 
I always take to go my dinner because I don't wanna wait 
Last time I waited 45 min and more
 but check in offer for yelp is only Dine in only :( 
sad :(

Love the atmosphere of the restaurant!  I had some kind of seafood green curry.  It was my first time trying green curry, I'm still not sure if I like it.  I am looking forward to going back for date night as the atmosphere is so nice but also cozy.  I will try something I am more accustomed to like yellow curry, or noodles.  I would also like to try the soups.  Service was great!

I ordered here today, for myself and 2 others from work.  First time ordering, was able to do phone order.... you just need to have a credit/debit card to ensure the order.. Understandable.  I ordered, said 15 minute pick-up time. I was there in 15 minutes. Was ready within 2 minutes after.  I LOVED the food.. Was the best I've had in Vegas..  this will now be a once a week stop.  Awesomeness !!!

Where do I start? When we got in we were seated at our table and was given our menus! Then the chick brought us our water! Not a min later asked us if we were ready to order after barley looking at the menus! We told her we weren't.There was a group that came in and was seated right behind us! After waiting about 20 mins for her to come back which she never did! While watching the whole time that waitress taking that groups order and one by one bringing them their food! After about 35mins my sister went up to the other guy waitress and told him we were ready to order and asked if our waitress had taken our order he was nice apologizing! After we were done and was about to pay never asked us how the food was but asked us how the service was! He knew we were pissed! We never got our water refilled and also had to catch the guy to ask for more water!My sister told him this is the worst service I've ever had! Mind you she's not a very picky person! I gotta give them props their food its on point! But seriously!

My favorite Thai spot in town. I do wish they had stuffed wings, but the amazing peanut sauce they serve with the fresh spring rolls makes up for it. I love the pad Thai lunch special. You get tons of food for a measly $7. They also have $1 Thai tea during lunch. The service is always fast and the staff is friendly.
