Our experience on the first visit was way better than the second time with regard to taste and portion. I thought I was the only one who noticed but my husband did too. Tom Yung Shrimp was way too salty and the portion of the Pad Thai was cut in half for some reason. Anyway, will still be back and give it one more chance.

I've been going to or ordering from Weera for the past year. The service and the food have slowly, but surely gone down hill. I ordered squid salad that was obscenely rank and when I told the server she rolled her eyes and snatched the plate away without replacing it. We were still charged. I have ordered take out for both lunch and dinner a few times a month for the past 3 months. Every single time, and I do mean every single time, they leave something off my order. It's frustrating that Weera has become such a disappointment.

I have been going to Weera for quite some time. So we decided why not dine in! When we first walked in, we were shock with the new interior of the restaurant. The interior is very inviting and you can just tell the employees love their job!! We decided to order the Penang crispy duck and crispy pork stir fry. Both were delicious. Those dishes are some of our go to dishes. If you download the app five stars, you accumulate points with Weera Thai. You can get free entrees, appetizers, etc. What's nice about Five Stars is that Weera noticed my birthday was coming up so they offered a complimentary dessert. You know I can't pass up dessert, so we decided to get the sticky rice with mango. :) soooo good!! And the portion was perfect!!! That was really cool!

If you find yourself in the mood for some Thai food. You are in the right place. Love this place. The service in great the food amazing and to top it off they have happy hours. Great deals on appetizers drinks and Vine. Personally I love the yellow curry and the Thai tea.
Omg this is crazy good!!!!!!!! Nice portions and so on point. This just isn't right  I think I may have died

My first time here and the food was awesome. The food reminds me of when i am in Thailand. Besides the food being so great the waitresses were really nice and very friendly. Will definitely make this my regular stop when i visit las vegas again.

In the mood for Thai our friend suggested this place I was up for trying a new spot.  After pulling in I started to question his choice but upon walking in, wow really nicely decorated and everything was sparkling clean!  

We came right before happy hour ended (it ends at 7pm) so we ordered a couple of half price apps to start.  We decide to eat family style and just try a bunch of new stuff.

Our appetizers included fried tofu, thai egg rolls.  Our dinner included the specialty that everyone who comes here seems to talk about fried papaya salad, amazing but eat it fast because after it cools not as good.  Pork Larb, a new dish for me it is a citrusy  mint meat dish, delish when eaten over rice and definite redo.  Panange chicken curry my boyfriends favorite dish quite good here.  Fried Mussels coated in egg batter, not my favorite dish seemed overly oily but the size of the mussels were large!  We finished with the sticky rice and mango, mango perfectly ripe and the creamy flavored rice do to perfection.

I tried a bit of everything then went back for seconds on the items I liked best which was everything except one so needless to say I was beyond stuffed.  I think this place is gonna give Lotus a run for it's money.  I will defiantly be back!

Oh goodness this Thai restaurant was unexpected! Don't let the outside fool you! The inside is nicely decorated and this place has a great ambiance. We were greeted and seated. There were a lot of choices and we went during lunch so they had their lunch specials. Ordered the Panang Curry and it was sooooooo yummy!!! The wait time for the food was a little overdue but food was really great. My boyfriend got their green curry too and rated the spiciness level as Thai spicy. We also got their mangoes with sticky rice and it was fresh. If I'm coming to Vegas again I'll visit here!

I fear I may be falling into a trend.  I have reviewed several other Thai restaurants and this will not be my last on the subject.  It turns out I happen to like Thai food.  Quite a lot in fact.  Weera Thai is one of my favorites.  The food here is more flavorful than that at Pad Thai restaurant.  Especially when it comes to spice.  Their spice level goes up to five though I am only willing to try a three at this point.  After that, it becomes too much for me.  Typically though, I order no spice.  I like to let the true flavor of the meal shine through and not be concealed by overbearing heat.  Some dishes just don't need the heat.  Like sweet and sour chicken.  Let the sweet and sour stand on its own.  The tempura is perfect thickness.  The sauce is tangy.  They vegetables are crisp and fresh.  No change necessary.  The pad thai here is some of the best I have had.  The rice noodles are chewy.  The flavors are intense.  The chicken is tender.  A great dish.  So far the only dish I have ordered that I did not enjoy is the pepper garlic chicken.  Actually, I ordered beef and received chicken.  I did not care for it at all.  First of all, I prefer white meat when eating chicken.  This was fatty dark meat.  Second, I was not expecting black pepper.  I thought it would be very garlicy with fresh chili peppers.  I don't care for the taste of massive amounts of black peppercorn.  I will not order that again.  

All of the lunch specials are served with steamed rice (unless noted otherwise), an egg roll and a small salad.  For a price ranging from $6.99 to $7.99, depending on your choice of protein, Weera Thai is a little higher priced than some other Thai options but the price shine through in the quality.  This is one of my go to places for Thai take-out in regular rotation.
I love this place. One of my favorite Thai's restaurant. The food taste very original which were super delicious! Employees are very nice. Definitely will go back again!

I have been coming here for 4 years and through the all the changes the food has Leah's been great! It is just delicious.  Some of my favorite dishes are mixed vegetables, yellow curry, pad Thai, fried rice and cashew chicken. Since the my have expanded and remodeled, the  atmosphere and ambiance is very relaxing. Which is had to find with affordable prices. This truest is a diamond in the rough! Looking to good Thai food, this is the spot!
This is the best Thai food we had recently.. 5 star to their spicy food and 5 star go their services.. thanks to chef who made great food when we were in great appetite.. kerp going

Service is top-notch; always pleasant.  Foods are excellent.  Atmosphere is modern (and clean).  It's, unfortunately, located in the area not so pleasant.  But a real gem.  We go there at lease once a week.

This restaurant was recommended by a local bartender, and it was outstanding all around. The food, service, and prices were all outstanding. The atmosphere is a step up from casual, but the place was hopping with parties both large and small. This is clearly a neighborhood favorite!

The waitress was careful to ask how spicy I preferred each dish--suggesting that each plate was made to order. I always first order Pad Thai and Tom Kha Gai from a new Thai restaurant in order to establish a comparative baseline. Both here were outstanding, and I can't wait to get back to explore more of their offerings--and will update this review accordingly.
Great little restaurant with excellent food, and good value for the $$. Parking is an issue. The lot is small and narrow.

I went her Friday June 30th. Been to a few Thai restaurants but this was the best I've ever had. Went with my parents, Aunt and Uncle (he is from Thailand) who helped us order. Loved the mango and sticky rice dessert. Tried my aunts kao soy with beef it was awesome.
I come here a lot with my family. We always receive great service and the food is good. Prices are okay. Nice and clean restaurant.

Great food and very friendly people! One of our fave Thai restaurants here in Vegas along with Lotus (cheaper prices here though!)

Get their coconut shrimp salad!!! It's very spicy so ask about that before you order. Their panang curry is delicious too! 

Not too busy on a Friday night... It was perfect! I noticed they get a lot of takeout orders so I'm sure they deliver.

We have had delivery from here oh like 15 times now over the last 2 months since we moved in the neighborhood.  We LOVE it!!! Every meal has been amazing.  Couple tips - stir fried clams amazing!!!  Seafood sauce is a great hot sauce on the side with amazing flavor.  Super solid food.  Today I stopped in for a takeout order and saw the restaurant in person for the first time..cute!  Never would guess it was stylish from the outside.

So even though Yelp didn't show my first review, I still wanted to update this. My friend was really craving Thai food. I told her Weera had gone downhill but she wanted it anyway. I said fine. We ordered around 9:30 (they close at 10) for delivery. The guy delivers around 10, and when we get around to eating we see that they left out a thai tea. I paid for it, but they left it out, and they were already closed. Thank goodness I ordered from eat24 cuz the guy took it off for me. Fast forward to today and I really wanted thai food so I tried them one more time. Ordered online, and this time I decided to have my hubby pick it up. He got there and they asked him for his credit card. I already paid online. Basically I was charged twice. Is everyone over there new and they don't know to check if things have already been paid for? Why does the service suck so much these days? I used to love it but they just keep messing everything up.

I'm totally in love w/ Weera Thai, 2yrs ago my department decided to try something new for lunch. So we ordered from Were a Thai for the 1st time: GREAT lunch special, a entree, salad, egg roll AND soup. Yessssssss, all for $8.50 I was hooked. 

To us born Americans Thai for is well known for PAD THAI and Weera Thai does not disappoint. Noodles are aldente, veggies are crisp, meat juicy and tender and peanuts on top CRUNCHY. We eat w/ our eyes right? The plate is very colorful, it's so fresh looking, steam rising from your pile of noodles, I wanted t dive in head first. Be careful when you order HEAT aka "SpicYness", I'm all about spicy food and then I met my match. I asked for a level of 5, thinking that it was going to be some type of mediocre heat, baaaaaaaaby I couldn't finished my food was so hot. My eyes got watery, nose started dripping and I started sweating. BUT I couldn't stop eating it was so good. 

If you find yourself on Sahara/Valley View try out Weera Thai, if you are in fear of paying full price for something you may not like then go at lunchtime (you get a lot of food w/ the lunch special) or grab the Groupon or Yelp deal. If you are a foodie, you will definitely enjoy Weera Thai's food. By that's only my opinion, try it out yourself and see if your opinion about this place matches my opinion about this place.
Great delivery service and great thai food. I've had the beef noodle soup, crab rangoons and pad thai many times. All are great

The best Thai Food in Las Vegas. Well, that's just my opinion, but I've eaten a lot of Thai Food. 
The Duck Spring Roll was unbelievably good. Huge portions and so fresh. My Pad See Ew was perfect. Noodles were really soft and the flavors were spot on. Sticky Rice with mango excellent as well. 
They also have a happy hour starting at 6 pm which I would also recommend checking out. There is a huge difference in quality of the Thai food restaurant to restaurant here in Las Vegas and I would put this place as the Golden Standard.

This is by far one of my favorite Thai food places because over the years it has evolved to make you feel appreciated for your patronage. They constantly upgrade the decor and the menu to keep the customers returning. It is a great place to host a party and to enjoy excellent Thai food. 
I have enjoyed many menu items and would have to say everything I have had is good. They take special requests to tailor the dishes to your liking as I did with the pineapple fried rice with crab meat. 
Service is always friendly and enjoyable. The wine selection is pretty good too.
It is a very comfortable restaurant to eat at with Buddhist Gold Symbols all around you.
Terrible Thai food and even worse service.  Don't bother with this place.  Look for a cleaner place with friendlier service. Cashier handles money then serves food without washing hands. Yuck!

My FAVORITE Thai restaurant in town! Very clean and always has fresh ingredients in the food. All the menu items are very flavorful and tasty! They really know how to spark your taste buds with true Thai Flavors. I love the Thai Tea as it's my favorite. Stop by morning,noon, or night they will take care of you! 11-9pm everyday!

Food was good..... but has slowly went downhill. I've ordered pad see eww from them for a few months about twice a week. It's usually good but it's slowly has gone down last time my order was super bland and this time around there was no Chinese broccoli in it and it was bland again. When I called the lady offered me 20% off my next order! Unacceptable I told her I will no longer be ordering from them and she just said sorry lol. There are 40 more Thai restaurants that are better with better customer service. Save your money for a place that has better food and appreciates your business.

I come here about once a month for lunch. My favorite food item here is their Shrimp Pad Thai. Spice Level 4. I love it,but warning itll give you heartburn if you are not used to the spice! lol. Their spring roll it comes with is delicious as well. I need to try their other menu items as all the photos posted here on yelp look soo good!! Great place! Definitely Recommend!

I eat here once every 2 weeks (at least). The food is the best in town and the service can't be beat. Seriously, come here for date night or whenever you want to eat great food in a casual atmosphere!

I came to visit from Maryland and was really anticipating on trying Thai food here in Vegas. It's great that they have a wide variety of food selection. I got the Pad see ew and I liked it a lot . Everyone else ordered some of the food from the lunch specials and food looked great. I also tried the crispy pork in some type of bbq sauce and that also taste good. Waitress very good with service and prices are decent . I will definitely go back and order other different dishes. Oh yea I loved their sweet sticky rice and mango!!!:):):):):):):)
Food is pretty good but I think the portion sizes are a little small....they would be okay for a party of 2 but 3 or more isn't enough. The crispy pork with Chinese broccoli is good!

yep - A-OK.  Heard about this from a friend, tried it this afternoon for lunch.  Pad Prik chicken, two scoop white rice, mix green salad, 1 egg roll, sweet sauce, thai tea, $10 something.  
Quick service, maybe 10% occupied.  Lunch prices till 3:30.  

Lunch sized entree, smallish egg roll.  I have a food allergy to onions, so the soup was suspect - when questioned, it was removed to be sure.    

Condiment jars: Thai "chilis" were jalapenos in vinegar, no peanuts, three versions of red sauce.  I prefer bird's eye that chili in fish sauce.  

Heat: Ordered a 4/5.  Nice glowing heat, but half the jar of vinegar jalapenos climbed it up to face sweat under the eyes.  Happy.    

In conclusion: reliable thai food, looked at what others ordered and wondered what it was as it looked very good.  My onion allergy limits my options, but always looking for good food.

I ordered take-out for my girlfriend and myself as this is one of her favorite restaurants. I'm very glad that I did, it is definitely one of the best Thai places I have tried in the valley. The food was delicious and fresh and the employees greeted me with a smile when I picked up the food. They even gave me free drinks! I'll definitely go again.

I've lived in Las Vegas for 22 years and have recently traveled to Bangkok, one of the main reasons? Because I loooove Thai food! And from personal experience, in my opinion, this is ABSOLUTELY the best Thai place in Las Vegas and seems the most authentic thus far! Their Kao Soy, Green Curry, Panang Curry, Pad Thai, and Papaya Salad (although the most popular dishes in Thai cuisine in general), are definitely one of the best dishes at this restaurant!

Hopefully that I can expression in words how much of a delight this place was every times when I landed into Las Vegas. The first thing that's I would love to come it's my favorite Thai restaurant. This place never make me disappoint for every bite I have. Excellent and fantastic real Thai food.. Services always amazing. 
5 start from Yelp.com, Really is not enough for this place. I will give them all of the stars in Galaxy!

This place is all right, very tasty thai food but for the price we paid per person....let's just say we could've fin to AYCE sushi and be satisfied.

Everything we ordered was actually pretty good, but not really blown away to actually go back. If you're looking for something fancy at like a pricey yet small entree....you could give this place a try. It might be to your taste.

Was ok the spring roll was pretty good... Can't say too much about the seafood soup..... Wayyyy tooooo salty.... The service got better at the end but it should always be consistent... Took too long to place my order... They need a little more staff. Very pleased about the Thai rice... I gave 3 stars due to lack of service and salty soup....

Consistently delicious.  I frequent this place about once a week.  I have not had a bad dish yet.  My favorites are beef jerky, red curry, massaman curry, curry fried rice, and spicy eggplant.  Their heat scale is 1-5.  I usually stick with a two.  Anything more and I will go through a gallon of water.

Ordered delivery here for lunch. I got the Lao Style Papaya salad with the Pad Ka Pow chicken lunch special. When you order the papaya salad if you want it Lao style it's called Isaan Papaya salad. They have normal Thai style but if you want Lao it's under Isaan category when you order. I ordered them medium spice but it was pretty spicy so if you can't handle spicy choose level 1 or make a note that you can't handle spicy. I got a salad and an egg roll with my lunch. They packed it very neatly and I appreciate that. Everything was organize and well presented when I got my order. I also ordered a Thai Tea which was yummy. It was cold and nice when I got it. Refreshing! The Lao style papaya salad was good. I liked the tomatoes and green beans in it. Flavor was good and it's exactly how I like my Lao style papaya salad to be. Comes with crunchy cabbage on the side. I like how they put it in a box and tied it up in a bag so the sauce or salad doesn't spill out because it can be stinky if it spills. The Pad ka Pow was delicious as well. I liked everything I got in my meal. I definitely recommend this place. They give you authentic flavors.
I love this place! The presentation is 5 star alone, and then you get to taste the food! The food makes me want to kiss the cook!

My wife and I love to try  new Thai restuarant anywhere we travel. We had the $20 for $10 deal from yelp so we thought we give it a try. It was a Monday night and we were the only one there.  Sometime it is a good thing if you are in a hurry. We usually compare all thai places by the way they make papaya salad. and it was delicious.  We had the crab stick appetizer and it also was really good.  Everything we had was delicious. Service was great and we recommend this to all Thai food lover.  I know with  all the buffets and different places to choose from in Vegas, it may be difficult to try this place out, but if you can find the time, try this place out, you won't be disappointed.

This place was recommended to us by a friend. Definitely worth the drive off the stripe for such great food, great service. Will be back for more next time I'm in town. Dreaming of it now that I'm home.

My coworkers picked Werra Thai for lunch.  I had yellow curry with beef off the lunch menu and had a water to drink.  I think it was $8.95 plus tax.  Great meal for a reasonable price.  There were four of us.  Each dish came out as it was ready instead of waiting to serve everyone at the same time.  A little awkward for some to people to eat while other wait, but not really a big deal.  It came with salad, soup, egg roll, rice, and the curry.  I really enjoyed it.  Very flavorful.  My coworkers complained that it was too spicy.  They ordered zero or one on a zero to ten scale.  Perhaps a one to a Thai person is an eight to an American.  he he he.  I recommend Weera Thai.
The place outs packed so it must be good . Tasty and delicious the way Thai food should be. They have a happy hour menu 5-7pm. Definitely a must try place for foodies like me.

I really, really enjoyed this place.

Having been to another small Thai restaurant just a minute down the street (also delightful) I wanted to give this place a try, so I met up with a good friend of mine and we tried a few dishes family style.

Great crab fried rice, everything else was also delicious. Our server tolerated my rusty Thai speaking abilities, and in we had some left-overs which were still delicious the next day (Thai food does tend to stand up in the 'fridge).

Definitely up at the top of the list of Thai places in this area, and I always like small business, family-owned, traditional... great place, definitely check it out.
The best thai food I have ever had. Their fresh spring rolls are amazing and pineapple fried rice is a must try. Definitely recommend this to everyone.
Love there curry, spring rolls and sticky rice dessert was the best!! Great customer service and also very clean.

This is a must to try. The food is absolutely Scrumptious.  We had been going to another place which I wont name but now we will only come here.
The Panang Crisy Chicken was incredible. Simply an Authentic Place. So glad we were told about this place.
Just Amazing Flavors all put together Perfectly.

The Weera Thai restaurant is a great find in Vegas. The restaurant is clean, inviting, the price is very reasonable and the service is excellent.

Our party ordered the following dishes and we all thought they were really terrific. The ones that were exceptional were the shrimp mango salad (spicy level 3 - ranges from 1 to 5 and 1 being the mild), Tom Yum soup, fried rice and the Thai nacho was interesting and rather tasty. 

Shrimp mango salad
Tom Yum Kung/Soup (Large)
Green curry with chicken
Salmon Panang
Thai combination fried rice
Nachos with larb and basil
Mango sticky rice
Beer - Heineken

We also got a complimentary ice cream sundae for checking in on Yelp!
It pays to be an Yelper!

Awesome food and great quantity with excellent flavors..

Problem is its in a dingy stripy mall. seating is limited. Service was okay. But food was excellent..

Will definitely visit again for the excellent food.

I'm in Vegas for 2 days. I had to have yellow curry. Thanks for delivering to my hotel today. It is delicious!! Absolutely delicious. Also got the fried tofu appetizer. The bag had plates and forks and we were able to set quite the spread. Great job. Thanks a lot! Love you.

Not sure what happened when they reopened after their remodeling... I would always eat here and it never made me sick but since it has reopened I have ate here 3 times and got sick every single time. This last time it gave me food poisoning and I'm currently dealing with that now, up all night throwing up. Also this place made 4 other people I know sick with food poisoning as well. Usually places will give you a bad meal once and it's over with but now there has been MULTIPLE different cases of actual food poisoning ever since Weera opened back up. I'm not sure if they had their health inspection or not but someone needs to get in there and see what the hell is going on. I'm extremely upset with this place and will never go back or eat Thai food again. I have never been so sick in my entire life or had food poisoning. All I ordered was pad Thai which I get at any Thai restaurant and it's always fine, but there's clearly something wrong going on in the kitchen. My friends ordered the sweet chili basil and different curries and got food poisoning too. We all had to go to the doctor because it was that severe. I do not recommend this place,  unless you want to be sicker than you've ever been before. Disgusting, unsanitary and the kitchen needs to be inspected. This is not cool. Be careful if you do decide to go here.

I always have green curry to every Thai Restaurant I go to plus other dishes. But definitely love the green curry with eggplant and bamboo shoot with tofu and spicy level of 2.5 here. So good! The curry size is pretty big and I can get lunch and dinner taken care of! But if I'm hungry, I eat the whole bowl and am full for a long while! Try Weera Thai! (I've seen monks eat here couple weeks ago!)

The restaurant was located close to downtown where I work.  I took a coworker there for lunch  We ordered 3 dishes to share.  I ordered from the back of the menu where they listed their specialties, duck salad and spicy clams.  I also ordered one of the noodle dishes that started with an "r."  The noodles were in a brown sauce and pretty good.  The duck was savory but you're caught unexpected with the sourness of the initial flavor.  The yummiest dish was the clams. It was awesome and had I known, I would've ordered two orders of the clams.  I ordered the spice level at a 2 for my coworker but the dishes would've been better at a 3.  The service was excellent and the prices were very reasonable. I had paid $10 for a $20 groupon so the value of the meal was awesome for what I paid.

We came for lunch today and ordered from the Lunch Specials menu.  They had 9 entrees to choose from which included Tom Yum soup, salad, and fried egg roll.  The Thai Tea was only $1 at lunch.  They were located in a small strip mall on W Sahara Ave/S Valley View Blvd in Las Vegas. 

The Tom Yum soup and the salad came out at the same time.  The soup was warm and was served in a tea cup.  The salad was of good size and had a ginger dressing.

I ordered the Pepper Garlic Sauce Shrimp Thai Hot.  It came out at least 10 minutes before my friend's entree.  Awkward.  There were 6 shrimp with the tails on with carrots, mushrooms, green bell peppers, scallions.  There was no spice at all.  I had  to ask for a spicy tray.  The vegetarian egg roll was bland.  The amount of sauce with it was sparse and watery.

My friend ordered the Yellow Chicken Curry.  She ordered it mild and wished she had ordered it medium.  She took half of it home.  The server boxed the leftovers.  

I wish I had ordered one of the curries, because it looked good.  I really enjoyed my Spicy Shrimp Salad that I ordered last time.  It had the appropriate amount of heat. I would not order the Pepper Garlic Sauce Shrimp again.

I will give them another try.

Food was very good. Started with hot tea (they charged us $3 but we didn't mind since everything was so reasonable) and crab rangoon. Was my hubby's first time trying it, he's skeptical of seafood, but he loved it. Says it is his all-time favorite appetizer now. I ordered the Panang beef and it was yummy. Ordered it 5 out of 5 and it came out spicy though, honestly, I expected it to be a little spicier. Still good with fresh ingredients and nicely cut beef. Hubby got pork pad thai and it was also really good. Noodles were a good texture, sauce was perfect, veggies were crisp and pork was tender. We'll be back. If only they delivered further than 1 mile!

We started out for a return visit to Baan Mae Toy.  When we got there they were preparing to close.  They would have served us, but we found out that, despite the long conversation we had with the owner the last time we were there, they still had only a very limited selection of wine, and nothing we'd drink.  The owner suggested we go to Weera Thai, just a few doors down.  Alas, he may regret his decision to send us there.

At nearly 10 p.m., unlike the empty restaurant we'd just left, Weera was hopping, and we got the only available table.  And they had the Riesling we like to drink.

We ordered soup, and when it was served, it wasn't the Tom Kah Kai we usually order, but the Tom Yum Kai.  It was my mistake, and the waitress (owner?) offered to change it, but we decided to keep it.  And it was beyond delicious!


We shared a Mussamun Curry with beef, and for once I gave in to hubby's Pad Thai request.  Both were excellent, and the Mussamun had the distinction of having much more "stuff" than the vacant bowl of sauce that we've experienced at too many other Thai restaurants.

Service was excellent, and we think we've found our new favorite Thai place.

Went here for dinner the other night and really enjoyed the experience!  Small, intimate restaurant.  Everything we ordered was great.  The crab rangoon was sooo tasty.  Service was good, just a little slow.  I would definitely come back.

I Wasn't pleased with the service and the food is slowly losing the charm and great taste. One of the example; the clams with garlic is painful to eat..why? Well because the shells are breaking into small peaces when (not carefully cooked) that can be mixed with the clam meat and when you chew it, it can really break your tooth. It happened to me with the whole serving and was truly disappointed because it was one of my most favorite food. Pad Thai is also going down the drain..
The older waitress with shoulder length haired has some kind of issue ether with me or she's just a b rude individual. She made me and my husband feel so uncomfortable when waiting to be seated which it takes a whiled, plus we have to always stand and look awkward when people are eating, just watching us stand there waiting for someone to appear and hopefully to help us. We are always so kind to all, and love the waitress with the short/short hair she's always kind and helpful beside the other one mentioned above. 
We found this place a long time ago before any upgrades were ever made. It's unfortunate that the small, cozy, great food, and great customer service is diminishing by the minute. 
My disappointment is so greatly and so upsetting to have been placed in such uncomfortable place due to the waitress that it's disgusting and needs to be taken cared of that issue. If she can't handle a busy place she needs to be out! 
We will never be back to Weera:(

GREAT place for a little get together or so large portion Thai food. The steam clams are to die for and they give you ALOT! Parking is easy to find and they take credit cards. Average food wait is 8 minutes. Clean and remodeled.

I love this place! Their portions are sooooooo big! And the food is great! It tasted like Thai food like I excepted although it's not like Thailand. But very close. I would come here again. And also their dark chocolate Thai tini. Was a great drink!

My wife and I went for lunch and we received terrible service. Her order came out 20 minutes before mine. I ordered the catfish with lemongrass and vegetables and it was simply not edible. It was awful. I asked for it to be a 2 out of 5 on the 'spicy scale", and after about three bites I couldn't eat any more it was so hot. The lemongrass tasted old and gave the whole dish a chemical taste. I would have sent it back, but we had been there for almost an hour and the two tattoo guys who were swearing in the table next to my 5 year old. Overall, it was just a bad experience with bad service and bad food.

***First I want to start this review by saying this is one of my fav Thai spots in town. I use their delivery service all the time!  The food is always, hot and delicious, and they even use great little cardboard Togo boxes. This review is long overdue!***

Experience:  I came in for lunch after one of my chef friends told me to try the Crispy Duck Salad. I've tried many things here, but this is my first time trying this dish. 

Facility:  it's located in a tiny strip mall along Sahara.  It's pretty small, but it has booths, tables and chairs and even a few bar seats.  It's a quaint little place that has a small diner like feel. 

Service:  They sat me immediately in a small booth in the back. Perfect because I'm rollin solo today and prefer not to sit in the middle of the room looking lonely. 

Food:  love that they have Coke products!!!!  
Crispy Duck Salad - (5/5) wow!  He was right!  I don't think they make anything bad here. The duck is crispy and amazing!  The greens, carrots, and tomatoes are fresh and tossed with a sweet and sour type dressing with garlic and cilantro. I ordered it spicy, which adds the perfect balance of heat to the sweetness of the fresh mango!  It also has cashews that add slight decadence and nice crunch to the salad. Great dish!

Overall:  love this place! The worse part about eating here is deciding which dish to order and which dish to forego. I use them regularly to deliver food and stop in from time to time for some eats too.
Until someone shows me different...this is my number 1 Thai restaurant!

On point with the flavor and polite customer service. I tried ordering through Yelp, but the menu wasn't quite the same (either missing menu items from Weera's website and/or there were items on the Yelp order menu I didn't see on the Weera website). I ended calling Weera Thai to place my order for pick-up because I wanted to order Tom Kha soup.

Easy placing my order on a Friday night and it was ready in 15-20 minutes.

When I picked up my order, glanced around and saw that it was quite busy. Families, couples, groups of friends were enjoying their dinner in their nicely set-up restaurant. This is my 2nd time ordering for pick-up, but next time I would love to dine-in so that I can enjoy their alcoholic beverages and dessert. Plus, I love how their soup is presented when dining in.

I showed the guy the Yelp offer that if you check-in, you receive a free Thai Iced Tea, but he said it was for dine-in only so I will just use it next time I do so. He told me it is better to call in to order because Yelp doesn't really update the order menu on the app even though they've sent it in. Plus, it is better to call because you can ask for specials or what they suggest is the best dish.

I only did mild for my three dishes and it was perfect that way because I can taste the hint of spice with the Thai spices! I ordered the Tom Kha soup with tofu, Fresh Ginger Stir with shrimp, and Panang Curry with Shrimp. Order came with two smaller containers of rice. My order was enough for 2-3 people. Prices are decent from $10-28. The seafood (fish) dishes are the ones that are in the $18+ range. I've had the fish with ginger last time and it was super tasty and cooked just right!

What was nice was that the guy was very kind before I left and gave me the Thai Iced Tea. I appreciated that and that customer service and his order tips makes me want to return in the future and tell friends to go here for Thai food when in Vegas.

Simply amazing food the best Thai I ever had from mango salad papacy salad drunken noodle fried rice every single item we ordered was 10/10 I will decently come back every time I am in Vegas. Lastly best customer service.
One of the best Thai restaurants, I've ever been to in Las Vegas! Great food, awesome service, nice ambiance, and amazing HAPPY HOUR!
Great food, great portions, THE best thai iced coffee, friendly service! WHat more could you ask for? Don't let the slightly sketchy location fool you, this place is VERY good!

We stay at hotel n have it be delivered directly to hotel. On time n excellent delivery. 

The food's so delicious and very good choice for lunch. We are 2 people, totally full with chicken panang curry,pad thai combination n crispy duck salad. The pad thai is new to me. It's ok. Not so impression. But the crispy duck salad is so so good. I'm addicted to it. Still want to eat it more even now so full. I ordered spicy level 8 for panang curry hwever it's still medium for my indian bf. next time I should make it level 10. Lolz.!!! 

Thank for the free Thai Ice Tea. It's so sweet to me but very nice after having full lunch. 

I'll come here for next time visit Las Vegas.
Excellent food, I had fried Duck with Penang curry and hubby had Roast Duck Pad Thai and both were delicious.

I worked at as a Server for an Authentic Thai restaurant back in Seattle for 4 years so I am super picky on my expectations of Phad Thai to be particular, but this is the 5th Thai place I've tried here and I must say the Phad Thai is great! I came to meet a friend for their lunch special and find it nice to have the salad and soup as a starter which comes with it! Also the soup was their Tom yum so that is nice because I had the chance to taste it for future reference and I would be in favor of it as well. Great portion for a special. This was my first visit which was recommended by my friend so as far as consistency, I will update in the future. I know how much they make you walk past your tables to check on the guest but that would be the only thing I would say that was a little annoying. Only because there were only two tables in the restaurant and I had a small 1 yr old and a 2 year old who were frigidity but not anywhere else but the table. That can feel unwelcoming if I cant dine comfortably without feeling like I'm being watched every 3 minutes or so. I am not exaggerating, and I know this because there was one lady coming to fill our waters but the guy was pacing back and forth looking at our table. When it came time for the check he didn't come back which was also annoying because you would assume he would be on top of it as many times as he passed through. We had to go to the register. All in all, still a great place, maybe just a little space for the customer to not feel like they can't eat in peace.

Best Thai meal I have ever had
I can't explain why. I have had Thai that I've liked, and even loved, before. Weera is located in an area with tons and tons of Asian restaurants, so I imagine competition is fierce. All I know is if you are in the area and you choose Weera, you won't be disappointed.

Enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Had the chicken larb, chow mein, fresh shrimp spring rolls, and spicy fried rice. All of the dishes were very tasty, not overly sauced, and fresh. Would definitely recommend trying them out. When in the parking lot keep your eyes open otherwise you'll pass their store front!

Not only this place is trendy and the service prompts but the food in 5 stars as well! Super clean restaurant, the menu has varieties of food. When you are on vacation of course you want to have a great meal. Give them a try, don't waste your time if you are craving for Thai food! Oh they have a full bar too!!!! I wish where I live has a food like Weera Thai! I love this place.

Have to say I am so impressed with this place. The food was great and the service are awesome. I'm from Florida and we have some authentic Thai restaurant but this place is out of ordinary ... Thank you Yelp for leading us to this great restaurant ... We salute you ...

I'm sure the food is as good as everyone has reviewed it to be.  Sadly, at 90 minutes and counting, I don't know.  The delivery via bitesquad.com, their online ordering platform, is expensive and slow.  There are better options.

I love Weera Thai! It's about time I write a review after eating here so many times. The recent expansion is great. I hear they now have boba thai tea!

I mainly visit here for the lunch specials. There are many options to choose from; you basically choose your flavor, meat, and spice level. Thai tea (without boba) can also be included in the lunch special for a dollar.

The best thing I had from here is the soft shell crab. It is definitely worth that hefty price tag! If you come here often, you should at least try it once. My favorite lunch special is the Fresh Ginger. It is not overwhelmingly ginger-y at all - they add some other vegetables in it. I usually get it with *crispy* chicken (extra charge) and it always comes out delicious.

If you're wondering what the spice levels are, it's from 1 to 5... or 0 if you're weak like me.

My family and I love and enjoy Thai food and this place has great tasty thai food offering a fabulous variety of flavor and styles. Will be returning again and often. Definitely good and fast service, very attentive to the customers. We tried several dishes that we had not eaten or tasted before. All were winners and we would certainly order again. Highly recommend you give this place a try!

First off...I don't like curry, so I don't often go to Thai restaurants. I got the groupon that was listed because my bf loves thai food. I ordered the wonton soup and kung pow chicken...it was so delicious! yum! My man ordered pad thai and some sort of curry tofu dish. I really liked the pad thai and my bf liked the curry dish. We're going back this weekend, I hope it's just as good!
Ive ordered food to go and i dont know if they intentionally forgot the panang beef!!! Im soooo pisssed!!! Never come back here!!

I have been eating at Weera Thai restaurant for almost 3 years now. Weera Thai has become my favorite go-to Thai place and I eat lunch there at least once or twice each week. The evening dinner service has always been Excellent and the wait-staff are all friendly and attentive. Prices are moderate and food quality/presentation is 5-Star, as are their delicious seasonings and freshness. They have remodeled & expanded their restaurant with tasteful interior decorations appropriate for the Thailand & Laos origins. I have Never experienced an unsatisfactory meal at Weera Thai. 2 of my favorite dishes include their fresh Papaya Salad, and Tom Yum Kai (with chicken or shrimp) soup.

This place is oh so good!!! 
So they have happy hour from 4pm - 7pm. And the choices under the happy hour is pretty good. They're pretty filling too! I got the mango mojito, and it's sour but it was a good sour. It balanced the taste well! 

Appetizer from the happy hour we liked:
- papaya salad 
- weera chicken wings 
- Tom khan soup (coconut soup) 
Drinks: 
- lychee mojito 
- mango mojito 
- cold sake 

We came here with a vegetarian friend so we ordered some with tofu as protein. I was very surprised by how good the flavors were regardless if it had meat or tofu. We got tofu pad Thai and spicy eggplant with basil. We also have got spicy basil and everything was just an explosion of flavor in our mouth! My friend recommended the catfish dish with the fish sauce, she swore it was yummy. Although to me, it tasted a bit more like crumbs and not fish. So next time, I would pass on it. 
Oh! And not only do they have good food, they have great customer service too. They joked around with us and recommended food to us. They also was attentive and our water was always filled. I'm definitely a fan! I will be coming back for more happy hours ;) the parking lot does get a little crowded though so sometimes, you'll have to park across the street

What a great hidden gem - my girlfriend recommended this place and I habe to admit where its located is not some place I would normally stop at.  
Stopped in for lunch - and it was pretty busy which is always a good sign. 
I had the Tom Yum soup with tofu and rice noodles - so delicious.  The vegetable egg rolls were also yum. 
I look forward to returning.

Ugh!! Where do I start? I've lived in Vegas my whole life and Weera is by far one of my favorite Thai restaurants to frequent. I honestly could have it once a week and lately have been. Everything I order from here is soo good and all my friends I've ever brought here end up enjoying it too. The staff is always nice and the restaurant is always clean. Again, one of my FAVS!

This was the 3rd consecutive trip in which we dined at Weera so you know we are fans.  It is a small mom and pop restaurant that excels at dishes from the Issan region of Thailand, but everything we have tried has been good.  This time we shared orders of Pad Thai and kai soi with chicken.  The latter, also known as Chiangmai, is made with wide noodles, coconut milk, chili paste, fish sauce, ginger, curry powder and a touch of sugar.  Both were very good renditions of these popular entrees, as was the service.  Pricing is moderate and becomes a bargain with the Yelp deal.

This is a not so known by Vegas goers and more of a local spot. WhIch I would like to stay that way! Shhh don't tell anyone this is a good place. Hehe. Good food, cool spot but service is a hit or miss.

This is the best Thai restaurant in LV!! I used to live in Bangkok for three years. So this restaurant has genuine Thai foods. Actually I really love here because waitress is so friendly and kind and nice,they are always smiling brightly also. If I've the chance,I'd like to go to eat everyday:)

This is a less known thai place in Vegas. It is about 15 minute drive from the strip. 

The food was awesome. Just what you expect at a thai restaurant. The service was quick. I called them and reserved  a table in advance; hence the wait time was minimal. Even otherwise, there was no much crowd here (visited this place on a saturday night).

The next time I am in Vegas, I am sure I will visit this place again. 

I tried Spicy chicken fried rice and veggie fried rice. Both were excellent.

We didn't have super high hopes for this place because we've been spoiled by a great Thai restaurant back in our home state, but we missed having a nice dine-in Thai place so we gave it a shot. Took 15 mins just to get our drink order (whatever...), my mojito had no rum in it, our food was bland and had no spice (even though we emphasized we could handle a ton of spice), and service didn't really seem to care about us. Food was okay, but we're definitely not dying to go back. Still looking for a nice Thai place. Fair for take-out if you want to add a lot of spices at home. Husband said his pad Thai had the flavor cooked out of it. ?

Great service ! 

Great foood! 

Just found out they serve HAPPY HOUR! 
Can't wait to come back! 
Yum!

I have to edit this some how. Someone left me a message, she upset and bothered that I copied her review word for word. She said "not cool" 

When I fist got to this strip mall I was concerned because the exterior was dimmly lite and not that clean looking. Don't let that fool you. Weera Thai is beautiful on the inside. I have been searching for a Thai place in Vegas since I recently moved here. 

Wait staff service: Excellent, attentive, and friendly. 

Interior: well lit, red with golden trimmings, chandeliers, beautiful, miniature gold bells in the divider wall, nice bar, clean base boards, Las shape set up. 

Food was delicious and comparable to most Thai restaurants. Beautiful plating! Please see pictures. 

Every thing I had was delicious even if today is low carb day. 

I had:
 - Green curry tofu. Tofu and eggplant was fried, I like fresh. I should have asked, but it was delicious. 

-Brown rice to go, for complex carb day lol
-Pepper garlic ribeye. Delicious, recommended 
-Pork larb. Delicious, recommended 
-Green papaya salad. They have 2 different papaya salad so be specific. 

Looking forward to bringing friends and family here.

One of my fave Thai places. Always consistent in food quality and the staff is great. Sometimes the restaurant is jam packed, but it is with good reason!! Join their rewards program. Lunch specials are a great value.

First timer.

We ordered chicken satay , beef larb, pad see ew  and sea bass. Oh and chicken curry fried rice. 

It's really not that hard to mess up chicken satay , but I'm really picky with my peanut sauce since I've tasted some horrible stuff before. Thank God this place got it right.

All the other entrees are good. Not too little , not too much in size. 

I like this place so far. I've got nothing to complain about this place yet.

This place is a gem! I have eaten Thai food all over the USA and this place is great. The shopping center is not so great; but inside is very clean and modern. If your staying north on the strip...take Uber here!!!!
Portions are large enough to split too....
The food was authentic and tasty.  The service was excellent.  The decor was a little "cafateria like " and the price was reasonable.

It's authentic but ask for medium spicy and you'll get mild.  They were Thai customers in there, which was comforting and the food is pretty authentic.  The pilot fish dish was a fried rice concoction with small dried, fried fish (kind of like pork crackings and the dried fish snacks at 99 Ranch).  The duck soup noodle was good.

I liked the place. Nice upscale ambience. Loved their food. BUT was upset with the rude servers. I been to many Thai restaurants & they have turned out to be with the worst customer service so far. I apologize for being rude but definitely wouldn't recommend dining in.  I tried panang curry (Nice thick curry with peanut flavor with tender chicken was served in a nice bowl) & mastmann curry (my dad loved it) along with coconut juice (It was cold but was sweet) & veggie egg roll (Decent size veggies didn't look stale so probably fresh).

Amazing Thai food! Wow, I've been craving something authentic, similar to the motherland and I've found it! Everything was very fresh and tasty. Great blends of sweet, sour and spicy. Too bad I live in New York or else I'd eat here every other day.

Popular business luncheon spot.

I ordered the wonton spinach soup (add glass noodle $2 extra) which had a rich broth and was plenty filling for lunch.  It came to about $15.50 which is a bit more expensive than the lunch specials ($9.99) and didn't have the $1.50 Thai Ice Tea deal.

It was my first time there and our food took a long time to be made, all 4 of us got food at different times.  The bill was wrong and took a few times to fix e.g. we ordered 3 Thai ice tea together and we were charged for 7, 3 of which with the $1.50 deal, and 4 more at full price which we didn't order or get.  My advice, check you bill!

This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas. I've been here many, many times. Service is attentive and friendly, the decor is elegant, and the food is delicious. Best chicken satay by far. I'm also partial to the chicken fried rice and mussamun curry. The menu is very extensive so someone will always find something delicious. And don't forget Thai tea or Thai iced coffee!

I'm so happy to discover this place! I order green curry and it was the best green curry I ever try! And I've been in many Thai places all over the states cause it's my favorite cuisine. Very clean, beautiful place and friendly service. I wish they had a brown rice.

Now I....
Had...
The Thai of my life...
And I never felt this way before...
Yes, I swear...
It's the truth...
And I owe it all to you...

OK- actually, I owe it all to my grimy friend who lives in Tucson, but knows Vegas about 10x better than most natives/locals ('cause he's one of those cool geeky kids who knows everything about anything).

Pardon the "Dirty Dancing" reference, and cast some stones this direction for getting that garbage song stuck in your head, but it really IS the truth.  Weera Thai is the best.

I'm not going to proclaim myself as some sort of expert on Thai cuisine, and especially if we break it down to Isaan-style Thai.  Hell, I don't know the names of regions of Thailand.  All I know is that the food coming out of this kitchen shames most of the places that I've had Thai food at before.

My improper experiences have led me to believe that Thai food is always heavy, almost too thick to enjoy.  Sauces that are so rich that you leave feeling bloated and bogged down.

That notion was not present here.  Everything, from the crab stick appetizers right on down to the wonderful curries, has a lightness and delicate nature to it.  Fresh.  Flavorful.  Complex.  Satisfying, yet leaving you wanting more.  More of the fantastic flavors of Thai food without that after-Thanksgiving-dinner feel to it.

Don't get me wrong, you will walk out of here full, but not over stuffed.

Another positive: service is friendly, attentive, dare I say sweet?

Do not be weary of Weera Thai.  After trying seven things on the menu, it is clear to me that they know how to serve up some amazing Thai dishes.

This is my second time and it's simply excellent experience. Every dish we ordered was very carefully made to perfection. It's fresh and finger licking good. If you're up for a thai restaurant, give this a try. Thanks

A good place to go to get some good quality Thai food.

I generally get their green curry, and I always tell them to add extra eggplant. The subtle sweetness, creaminess, and spice is a good combination of flavors that always leaves me wanting more. Other notably good items is their satay, pad thai, and fried rice.

Where this place shines is their lunch special. A good selection of dishes for under 10 bucks. They also toss in a salad, soup, egg roll, and a side of rice. Even though its under 10 bucks, the entree portion is always filling, and it always has the taste of being made fresh. 

Service is always good and the staff goes out of their way to make sure you are enjoying yourself and the food is good.

My only occasional problem with the place is that the meat that comes in the curry is sometimes overcooked and chewy.  But it doesn't happen often, and even when it does, the curry as a whole is still awesome, and the hot(temp) curry sauce helps soften up the meat.

I have been going to this place for years, and I always look forward to going back. This place is always a good spot to go to while on or off a budget, with a wide selection of food to please everyone's pallet.

Ahhh I can't say how many stars I would give this place because I have such mixed feelings. They are really welcoming and the water here must be extra filtered because it tastes just like bottled! My first time here, we ordered the pad thai, tom ka chicken soup, and I think it was the duck curry. The pad thai was not the best I've ever had...but it was good. The tom ka, was SO flavorful, but also really spicy. The duck curry is what hit the spot (even though my mouth was on fire) I would totally recommend this place to anyone and I would definitely return. 

Now let me tell you about my return visit, We ordered the pad thai again as well as the curry, but were craving dessert. We ordered the mango sticky rice and I think they had mistaken the mango sticky rice for regular sticky rice. Since this order was to go, I assumed they had it right because most to-go orders are pretty simple. I didn't bother checking once I got it since I was in kind of a hurry. Unfortunately, I didn't trust my gut when I went in and told them what I ordered, because when I told them what I had gotten, the employees looked at each other and said "uhh three items right." For that reason I'm a little grumpy with this place which is why I am only giving them three stars.

Lunch special - $7.99!  I tried the red curry with tofu lunch special.  It came with the tom yum soup and a salad.  The curry was very good, not too sweet.  The lunch also came with an egg roll, and I was pleasantly surprised.  It was perfectly fried with the perfect crunch.  The sweet sauce they give you to dip the egg roll in was also perfect, not too sweet. 

I love the decor inside; it gives a more-than-usual modern feel to most Thai restaurants in town.  They also have a bar, which looks like a full bar.  The service was also great.  I am definitely coming back!
The roast duck pad thai is amazing. Start with the pork jerky appetizer, and try the roast duck with a small side of extra peanut sauce.

It was my first time there. Have mango salad, papaya salad, tom-yum noodle soup etc. i love my tom-yum noodle soup. Definitely coming back! The only thing that held me back is the price. Kinda expensive compare to other thai res.
Service is bad and they forgot to put in our order. Their food is 1 star compare to Lotus of Siam

Some small changes over time begin to add or subtract from a great neighborhood restaurant.  Just so with Weera.
Originally a great spot for lunch, their lunch special began a lowering of quality by dropping the Tom Yum soup cup for a tofu soup.  Then, the pricing went up by a dollar for all lunch specials, and some that were a standard price went up another dollar.  
On my last visit, I ordered the red curry at spice level 5.  I got lukewarm red curry, with spice level 0.  In addition, the egg roll was still cold in the center.  
I'm going to find a new lunch spot.
Awesome service and great food. 2nd time here and the whole experience has not let me down. Very clean and staff is always attentive to your needs...

The best curry in Vegas. 

I've tried the red, green, yellow and panang - all delicious. Service here is great and the people are so friendly. Noodle dishes are done well too. We like the pad see ew, pad thai, and drunken noodles. From the outside this place doesn't look appealing but the inside is actually really nice. Small bar, lots of TV's and dark lighting. The tom yum soup is also really delicious. Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.
Like the atmosphere for a simple Thai place. Had cashew chicken spicy. Was solid. Will return.

seriously the best thai food in las vegas maybe even the world 
better than the thai food in thailand 
for real you need to eat here

This thai place blew me away. The food was so delicious. 

We ordered for starter, the glass noodle salad with shrimp, which was the BOMB!! So citrusy and refreshing with two large juicy shrimp, ground meat and red onion was on point and a great combination. My new favorite thai salad from now on. 

The next starter we ordered was the bbq chicken with chili sauce. This was ok and tasty. We won't order this next time. 

For our entrees, of course you can't eat Thai without ordering Tom Yum soup,  we ordered with shrimp only. By god, the shrimp in this soup are ginormous! I think there were 9 or 10 total. Each shrimp was like 3 mouthfuls. I have never went to a thai place that served shrimp this large anywhere! They were plump and juicy. The soup was level 3, it was super sour and spicy, just the way its supposed to be...I'm drooling again just thinking about it.

We ordered the red curry with tofu. This was mouthwatering. I absolutely loved the wide slices of bamboo and basil leaves, soo good. The tofu was plentiful and large as well. The curry was the perfect sweetness and the right amount of spice (level 2). Other places I've been to, were overly sweet with coconut, and was downright sickening sometimes. But they got it just right to balance with the other spicy foods we had.

And last of all, we ordered the sliced beef salad. Compared to the glass noodle salad, this was just not as good in terms of citrus. It was a bit spicy because we ordered level 3. It kind of reminded me of Vietnamese banh mi pickled veggies. So we won't order this next time.

But I have to say overall, this experience was top notch. Believe it or not, this was all for only two people for around 50 bucks. Thats not bad for 5 dishes. Given, that the starters were 6 bucks each, a really good deal. Back in LA its 50 bucks for 3 dishes, and you don't get nearly as much food. We will definitely come here again for our Thai cravings :D

I've been to "weezy" a couple times and ordered delivery A LOT of times! 

First I had weezy was a lazy night, thanks to yelp's eat24 I found out about this gem, but I also found out it is cheaper to order from their own website. Hmmmm

Pretty much every fried rice they have is freakin amazing, they give you the option to add anything you want, as for me I always add mussels!
Teriyaki Chicken was also good, the sauce is not too thick and the chicken is cooked perfect.

The first time I've been to the restaurant I know at some point they need to renovate and make the place bigger which they did!
After a month of renovating, I came by to visit LOL of course I ate too! 
food is always great, though I noticed they are having issues with communication, I think everyone there asked to get our order. LOL
Fast service is always a win win for everyone!

Newly renovated weezy restaurant is much bigger and and it looks more fancy now! So Yes I highly recommend eating here!

As they say, don't judge a book by its cover. It may look ugly outside but it's a very cute & clean place. Very quiet in there, there was only 2 other people in there other than myself and my brother. We got greeted as we walked in, got our order pretty quickly. Our waiter was very friendly. Got our order quickly and received our food at a decent amount of time. Food quality is very good. We ordered crab sticks and omg it was delicious. I'll be back just for those. We also ordered pad see ew which is enough for up to two people. If you love Thai tea try theirs. It was very good I'll be back!

I have been coming to Las Vegas for years and this is without doubt the most outstanding Thai restaurant I've ever experienced. It's located in a little strip mall with free parking on the south side of Saharah just west of I 15. They feature is 10 food which is native to northern Thailand and the chef has an outstanding depth of flavor talent. Happy hour is seven days a week from 4 PM till 8 PM we're Heineken beer is only three dollars, and tidy up like Chang and Singer are only four dollars. The portions are enormous it's family-style so I recommend you order something to share. I will be back I wish this restaurant was located closer to me in Los Angeles.

I love this place, the service is great but the food is phenomenally good they have a great chef in the kitchen.
I been was in Thailand for a few months i know my thai food.
Anything in the menu I love, my favorite is seafood dishes.
I recomend you to try venture and go beyond from the padthai you wont be disappointed.
I am so Greatful this place exist in my life.

My very favorite Thai place! Check in and get the Thai tea! After trying it out, you'll probably want more. It's delicious!

Ok, I've been here a few times now. I've been on dates here too just cus it was my excuse to come. Hah! The first time I came to visit, we already actually had eaten. We wanted to desserts. We're fatties and ended up getting, I believe, all desserts except one. Every single one of them desserts were AMAZING. I was not disappointed. I think I gained 2000 pounds that night. I couldn't stop eating them. Mango and sticky rice is top notch!

I've tried a lot. Check out the pics! They have amazing portions. Pad see ewe had the largest shrimp and the crab rangoons were filled to the max. If you like curry and duck, PLEASE try the duck panang! It's one of the best things I've ever tried and I still dream about it. The prices for everything is decent and perfect for the amount of food you get. Share that plate and get more than one entree. You won't be disappointed in any of the dishes.

The food was so delicious what else can I say.. we had the crab fried rice,shrimp wrap in fried noodles,crab rangoons and Thom Kai. They had happy hour menu that I think last till 8pm and the staff was super friendly and and just a great atmosphere overall. I need to come back soon and try more authentic Thai dishes they serve :)

I will never be weera or weary of Thai food. Anyway, there is an explosion of Thai places in Vegas and this place is pretty good.

My friend Steven L took me here for lunch. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Tom Kah Kai - Cocunut Soup with Shrimp, lemongrass and other stuff.  We ordered this 4 out of 5 spicy and it was very nice. We got the large in the tin hot pot and it was very subtle and very tasty.

Spicy Sea Bass - This dish is very, very good. Steamed sea bass served on bed of lettuce with the natural flavor of the steamed sea bass and liquid in the serving "boat" that it came in.  This was very tasty and one of the best type of steamed fish I have had outside of cantonese restaurants.  Again, very subtle and natural flavors. I did not see a fish tank, so I cannot tell HOW fresh the sea bass was, but it tasted very fresh to me.

I will come back and order other things in the future. I wanted to try other things with my friend here rather than the normal curry and pad thai and etc...

Service - Very nice and pleasant.

Prices - Very reasonable.

GK Says this is a great place to go!  Check it out!!!

PS for an asian place, this place had very, very clean toilets. That is an huge plus.  Come on, if you have been to Wo Fat, or some of the other places I have written about, you will know what I mean about the Asian Restaurant Toilet thing!!!

We used to frequent Le Thai and became discouraged at their lack of customer service, especially towards locals and regulars. We found this place and have never thought of going anywhere else since. The food is superb, quality is far above all others, presentation is so impressive, and the staff is sooooo friendly. Their Happy Hour specials are unlike anything we've seen. We used to get our favorite sake for $18 at Le Thai ($14 at Itsy Bitsy,) and the same exact sake is $6 (!!!!!) at Weera. Unbelievable...in every single way!

After dining here a couple of times, it was time for a review. A small little thai joint that serves solid food. Some dishes are better than others so I'm just going to list which ones I've had.

Sample Appetizer Plate (Deep fried tofu, fried wontons, Thai egg rolls & chicken pot stickers) - I would not order this again. Everything was blah and not a lot of flavor.
Duck Bone Soup - As stated in the name, it's mainly a lot of duck bones with broth. The soup itself tasted good but not enough meat for my tastes. I might try the pork rib soup once it's wintertime.
Nom Tok Moo - The pork is grilled but they let meat cool down to room temp before its served. Seasoned with rice powder, spices, lime juice and chili makes for a very tasty dish.
Kana Moo Krob - Basically, fried pork belly with chinese broccoli and oyster sauce. My favorite dish here especially since the pork belly was cooked to perfection. There's also another pork belly dish called Ka Pow Moo Krob which I can't wait to try.
Green Curry - It was wonderful but the best part of the dish is the eggplant!
Pad Kee Mow (Drunken Noodles) - Well executed ... no complaints here.
Crab Fried Rice - Absolutely, not one piece or smidgen of crab in it. I should've sent it back.

According to one of my friends, she thought the neighborhood is kinda sketchy but I have no problems returning especially if they are still serving the fried pork belly entrees!

I fall in love with this place, most of the food is very delicious, authentic and amazing!! Every time I came here, there's no regrets. I always ordered lot of food here. Last time I took my family from SFO here, we decided only to get some appetizer and go to buffets later. But we ended up ordered so many things crispy rice salad, catfish with salad, papaya salad, shrimp roll, spring roll, grilled pork, basil pork, fish fried rice, sticky rice and ETC (and 3 desserts). And my family ordered lots of food home at the same day. I would recommend this place:)

The ambiance was nice, nice interior decoration. I was surprised and I didn't expect the inside to be nice based on the location and neighborhood it was in. Well the workers were very friendly. 
Best crab Rangoon that I've ever had, the spicy eggplant (I had no thai basil and bell pepper in my dish) was good, not the best, but if you check in you get a free thai tea! :)

I use to frequent this place for lunch but decided to come here for dinner a couple weeks ago.  Is it just me, or does this place take on a new atmosphere at night? Perhaps they redecorated. It's been a while so maybe I'm just imaging things. It seems a lot more warm and inviting. 

We had the papaya salad, beef larb, tom yum kung, red curry, pad see ewe, and pineapple fried rice. The spice level ranges from 1 to 5, so we ordered everything at spicy level 4. It was enough to make my nose runny but didn't overpower the food. Mind you, we love spicy. Everything was aromatic and full of flavor. I like that they don't use the small, cheap, flavorless shrimps. The shrimps were large, succulent, and perfectly cooked. It was so satisfying. 

Service was good as well. They were very accommodating and checked up on us regularly. We ended up with plenty of leftovers and they packaged it so nicely. 

Overall, the food, price, and portions were great. I'll be returning very soon!

I rarely give 5 stars but this restaurant deserves it!  This has become a regular place for me to eat at when I visit Las Vegas.  It's not too far off the strip and it's got ah-mazing food!! The service is good and the servers are friendly.  

Location itself doesn't light up at night but who cares! If you're eating, you want to go for the food!! We ordered ourselves to death this evening.  Celebrating my birthday with childhood friends of 30 years!! 

They have happy hour from 7 to 9pm and let me tell you, most of the dishes we ordered that night was off the HH menu for $5 bucks and it made all our tummies smile!  We always get the papaya salad (super spicy), one of the soups, this time Tum Yum with shrimp, glass noodle salad with shrimp $5 dollars, deep fried pork ribs $5 bucks, Pad See Ew, Red curry, and chicken wings $5dollars (two orders).  Yeah we practically turned into pigs... 

The place  is clean and bathroom is clean! Say what!!  Go eat here! You won't regret it.  Much better than the popular thai place most wait in long lines to get into.  

Happy Eating!

Oh My!! talk about delicious food. For Thai food this place is the best i come here every time I'm in the mood for Thai. The service is great as well. If you go you must try there mango sticky rice for dessert. I highly recommend it to anyone. The best.
This is really the best thai restaurant i've been to!I've tried about 15 different dishes and they were all outstanding

UPDATE: The owner contacted me and apologized and corrected my situation. I bumped this up to 3 stars and I will visit Weera Thai again. 

Ordered for pick up last night using the order option through yelp. We ordered panang beef and ka pow moo krob (flash fried pork with basil and red bell pepper) estimated time was 10 to 30 min. My girlfriend went to pick up the order and it wasnt ready yet, she was asked to sit at the bar she waited. She sat at the bar for 15 minutes and no one asked if she wanted a drink or anything. So 45 min after I placed the order it was ready and when we opened it both entrees were incorrect. My curry came with tofu, not beef which was a $2 upcharge, and we received pork and broccoli instead.  I called and let them know about the mistake, this was at 10:05pm and they close at 10pm but they offered to make us a new correct order. I go and pick it up and they repeat the correct order and I bring it home. Open it up and my curry had chicken in it and not beef, and pork dish was correct but the pork was so over done it wasnt enjoyable. I called back and they gave me a credit for 1 panang beef on my file. Not sure I will be going back or not.

Came here with a group of friends for lunch. The outside looks like a scary shack but the inside is nicely decorated with a lot of red and gold. It's very comfortable and clean on the inside.  

We all got the lunch special and ordered thai ice tea which was a 1.50 more with the special. We all agreed that the thai ice tea was too sweet and needed to be watered down. I think I poured half my water into the tea. All I can think about was... Man me running uphill for a mile this morning is the equivalent of 1/3rd the calories in this tea. 

I ordered the pad Thai and my friends had a variety of stuff... The pad ke pow, curries etc. I liked my pad Thai. It's on the sweeter side but it's saucy and hits the spot. I also liked my friends dishes as well. The curry was rich with heavy coconut hints. Everything  was very flavorful. The lunch special also gives you a general portion of leafy green salad... Not that iceberg lettuce situation some other restaurants give, and a bowl of delicious Tom yum soup.  

You can pick the spicyness levels of the food from 1 to 5. My friends got a level 5 for their curry but it wasn't too bad. You can definitely taste it in the end and it stays with you for a bit but I can handle it and I usually go for a medium or mild. 

I was very satisfied with the meal and will definitely be back.

Entrance is a bit sketch but it's really nice inside with very welcoming staff. The food was amazing! I got the pad ka pow chicken. Very flavorful and not overly salty like other restruants. Was a great experience. They have lunch specials including egg roll and rice if it's not a biddle dish is 7.95.
So happy to find Weera Thai! Delicious! The flavors are fantastic. Even the basic Pad Thai is great. I'm already craving my next visit.

Service is slacking. Very nice staff, but servers should AT LEAST try to accommodate the guests request. There were 2 head tilting experiences but I'll go ahead and skip the first experience because there isn't enough characters on yelp to thoroughly convey what just happened. When there are paying guests, denying or making excuses for a simple request is a poor business move, especially if it's not compromising the integrity of the establishment or of the food. Anyhow, moving on...

Tom yum Kung: 3/5 stars. Good flavor. 

Spicy fried rice: 3/5 stars! we had the soup brought out to us first at a level 2 like the server suggested even after I told her that I can eat really spicy foods. Wasn't spicy enough so I had her tell the kitchen to make the rest of the order a level 3/5. Her response, "well they already made the fried rice, but I can tell them to make your pad see ew spicier." 

Hm...so then I have to add the Sambal and other spices by myself? But then it won't taste the same. Irritating.

Pad see ew: 2.5/5 stars. Bland! 

Mango sticky rice (sauce on side) : 5/5 stars! Bomb! Rice came out fresh and warm, mangos were also fresh with great flavor! 

Servers were sweet and attentive. I just wished they accommodated what I asked! It's not difficult to re toss the fried rice in more spice even AFTER it was done.

Recommended by a friend and finally decided to try it. I had the fried tofu appetizer which was amazing, very crisp outside and soft inside. The sweet sauce that accompanied was delicious. Entree was vegetable fried rice. Great flavor no need for additional soy sauce which was rare for me. Had plenty of fast and the rice was cooked perfect.

I've been wanting to come to Weera for a while and found a opportunity today to pop in for their lunch specials (available everyday 11am-4pm). 

We decided to share chicken panang and tofu pad thai. 

All entrees come with soup which I was pleased that it was tom yum broth with mushrooms. the salad is standard iceburg mix, but the sesame peanutty dressing on it was better than most offer. Eggroll was standard, but decent. 

The panang was good. I like the lime shreds on top for some aromatics and the curry sauce is thick and rich. If you like a more coconut creamy panang base then you'll probably enjoy the way they style the curry here. I like all kinds, depending on my mood and today the creamy style was agreeing with me.

Tofu pad thai had decent flavor, but it was too saucy. It had a mouthfeel closer to carbonara than stir fried noodles and neither of us were fans of it. Don't know if this is just the style they do or if it was a mishap. 

The portion sizes, specially considering these are lunch specials, were very generous and come at a great price since lunch specials are $7-8. 

Thai ice tea was a good sweetness to tea ratio. Best of all, during lunch they're only $1 as well as thai ice coffee and soda. They also have a happy hour for drinks and appetizers though I missed what time that was at.

I can see potential in the food, but since one of our entrees was just alright, I think maybe a 4 is high. I will be back though as the dinner menu had some interesting Issan regional dishes and I can always be into curry!
The food is great the management here sucks. They need a lot of improvement in how they greet, sit, and serve customers.

This place is what I would call a pretty solid 3.5-4 star restaurant. Would I go there again? Maybe, if it was really located in another area. But Sahara is so out of the way for me that I don't go frequently pass by.

AMBIANCE: 3 - it's very cozy and has the feel of a Thai restaurant / diner. It's a small place, but the way their tables are placed, it doesn't feel small at all! 

SERVICE: 5 - Service was pretty excellent! The staff are fantastic and are constantly watching if there's someone they need to serve. The food comes out fast and hot. For a small restaurant, they're really efficient. 

FOOD: 4 - Yum. I mean, it was good and hit the spot for Thai food. I would suggest getting spicy level 2 in order for your food to be more flavorful. Their happy hour is from 4pm-7pm! 

Some of the foods that I recommend are: 

Fresh Tofu Spring rolls*
Pad See Ewe (could use more veggies though!)
Red Curry 

p.s. Skip the soft shell crab with garlic sauce. It's okay tasting, but it's not really worth that 23.99 life!
Very good food! Service was lacking till I pulled out the yelp ap. But the food was great red curry,pad tai and Tom yum were all among the best I've had.
I cook Thai food myself and I have had some best Thai food around the world; BUT, this place is simply amazing. Enough said..
Great food, good prices, friendly service, nice Thai decor.

I stop in with my fiancee for a nice lunch. Unfortunately the service was so slow, we are very close to leaving. When it comes to lunch service, food have to be quick and on the ball so people that have lunch break can go in and out fairly quick.

Unfortunately if you decided to dine in here at lunch time. Tough luck. Food are so so, very slow service. It takes them 10 minutes to take our order, another 5 minutes for drinks and we spend almost an hour for lunch. 

So if you decided to stop in for a quick lunch, better make sure your office time is sufficient!
Extremely slow service. I ordered just a regular entry and my friend also ordered similar.  I sat there for 20min and after he finished his food I was served.
Have eaten inside a few times and love it ! Today got take out and its even put inside the boxes pretty just like they do it on the plates inside!~

I came across a few awesome reviews of Weera Thai as well as read John Curtas  Eating Las Vegas's review in LV Weekly. Lots of stars and praise meant Weera Thai was a must try. 

The service was impeccable! Our server was very kind and quite attentive. Good service is hard to come by in Asian restaurants.

The food however, I was a bit under enthused over. Perhaps we didn't order the "right" things on the menu? I normally can't pass up my favorite Pad Prik King, but I chose the Spicy Beef Holy Basil dish--good but not satisfying. A first-time Thai food newb, my friend ordered the Chicken Pad Thai which of course was delicious--a fool-proof dish. At our table, we also had Yellow Curry & a COLD beef salad which had a lot of flavor-similarities to Papaya Salad. The Yellow Curry was good but tasted almost like packaged Korean curry mix. And the cold beef salad had a dash too much of fish sauce.
