Wasn't bad food, just not as good as I was expecting. I'll stick with my usual Thai place. But I may give Weera Thai another try in the future.

POSITIVES: Coconut Water (straight out of a real coconut)--you can scrape the meat out to eat when you're done!

We ordered the Chicken tofu panang curry, a deep fried duck dish, and the appetizer shrimp cold rolls.  

The chicken tofu panang curry is to die for.  Both my GF and I loved it.  It was thick, sweet, tasty, spicy, all that a Thai dish should be.  I think we both rated it the best from the thai restaurants we've been.  The cold rolls in rice sheets were also super good, but what made it great was that warm peanut sauce that came with it.  It was peanut creamy, sweet and rich tasting.  Also a high ranker.

The duck dish was the only thing I thought was OK.  They really tried to pad their pricing by including duck dishes and Sea bass.  There's really no reason to order the duck dish, since it wasn't really very good anyways.  It was a mix of really heavy tasting thai spices, and it was too much for my senses or distinguish any kind of flavor.  Just too strong in my opinion.

Weera makes me a fan.  Also I really enjoyed the way the restaurant looked and how the walls were decorated.  It's pretty nice ambiance for a date.

Edit: 4/16 
Were Back again!  During lunch this time.  Unfortunately lunch was a big dissapointment.  The portion of the lunch specials was half the dinner portion.  To compensate they include fillers, a salad, a spring roll, a bowl of watered down tom yum soup.  Biggest issue, was the food Must have been cooked by the sous chef.  The red curry was super watery and the  fresh spring rolls that we loved so much last time, the peanut sauce was watered down and full of starch and not rich peanut flavored.  Was 100% different and not remotely good.  i probably wont come here during lunch time.  Ill try this place at dinner again to see if its a consistency issue

A great Thai place!
Good service and friendly staff helped make dinner pleasant. 

Food was on point, spiced right (for us anyway) and it all came out fairly quick. 

Pad Woon Sen with combo meat was a hit for me...
Garlic chicken was flavorful
Pad Thai with combo meat was delicious as well. 
We started off with the chicken potstickers...good presentation, tasted good, standard dish...

A definite option to consider in my future visits to Vegas

I thought I would never find a place where I can get $1 Thai tea.

Location/Decoration/Atmosphere: Came here for lunch with a couple of friends. I was in awed at the place. The restaurant itself is located in a very shady looking plaza but in the interior of the restaurant is very beautiful!

Menu: wide selection! you can definitely find your go-to Thai dishes as well as the specialty items. My sole purpose of coming here was to get the Laos style papaya salad with blue crap. I wasn't disappointed!

Overall, I am planning on coming back. The server was kind enough to give me a rewards card (stamp card basically). I've never seen a Thai restaurant utilizing this!
Very authentic Thai place. Always good dinner dishes. One time I came for lunch on a weekday. Taste was a disappointing

Have never been a huge fan of Thai food ..but some friends got my husband and I a gift card & some suggestions... we were converted ! It is clean & employees are very kind . We love this place & is now our go to place for all of our Thai food loving friends ..Pumpkin Curry ..yum !

There is nothing better on a Tuesday evening than sitting down with your MOBILE device and OPENING your appropriate APPLICATION and ORDERING FOOD TO BE DELIVERED TO YOU.

Weera Thai is part of this VAST ECOSYSTEM and thank goodness for that!  When I have a hankering for delicious food delivered to me in a reasonable amount of time at a temperature that will please me, and I do not want to drive across the street to Commercial Center. WEERA THAI fits the *BILL*. 

My regards to Bill by the way- Delivery charges I guess are just a part of life now, and there is no exception here... however once the bags are in my hot or COLD little hands I don't care that they charged me $4, or that I got to choose my tip online vs. handing cash.

The CURRY IN A HURRY is a good way to go.
The PAD THAI is full of THAIAMIN and Riboflavin to help you sleep.
Everyone in the house can be satisfied with the lack of heat if you ask for no spice- to burn your TUCHAS off HOT HOT HOT.

I enjoy everything I order UP TO and INCLUDING the STICKY RICE (a favorite of mine) and I LOVE that it is not tied to a dessert, it is it's own sticky side.

I just might miss my just in THAIme delivery when I am on the other side of town.

Stay WEERD WEERA Thai!

If you're in the mood for authentic Thai food, this is the place to go. Even though we had a large party, they were very accommodating. We had the catfish salad, the vegetable hot pot soup, the Thai pumpkin and tofu curry, the pineapple fried rice, and the duck pad Thai. Everything was so flavorful and delicious! I also recommend trying the Palms Drink Coconut Nectar. 

The restaurant is small and cozy and the staff super friendly.  Easy 5 stars from me.

4.7989999534 stars

Oh emm gee. Oh. Em. Gee. 
They deliver....P. T. L. ..I am the luckiest gurl in da' world....tonight...I surely am. 

By the purest eerie glow of the talking box...as I lift clenched chopsticks to my lips and my dazzled tongue...decadence. Yup ..fully flushed out thoughts I am sure will follow soon, but I am...otherwise occupied at the moment. 
Eggyplant....with swine, I apologize upfront...required commie card chickie pad thai...crispy duck ka pow... Ohhhh crispy crispy yumms. Dyn-O-mite...wings...suck on this JJ. 

oh holy hallelujah...tonight I am ...happy to be me...

Cannot wait for the next time...cannot wait until tomorrow's leftover goodies.

Ok so the reason why I give it 5 stars because they have a particular dish that they make better than anyone else..in Thai it's called kao moo dang and moo grob.. basically it's bbq pork and deep fried pork belly over rice and Thai sweet tamarind sauce that goes over it.. if you want to try something besides tom yum or tom kha or pad see ew or pad Thai then come here and try this dish..it's awesome

Walking in the restaurant was very cute and busy during the lunch hour. I had called in two orders of chicken Pad see ew for takeout which totally lacked flavor. I'm not sure if it's because they were really busy and just trying to get orders out but I will probably try a different dish if I come back

I tried the duck for the second time, out of this world !
It was crispy and crunchy on the outside yet tender on the inside.

heard about this place from through a friends recommendation and it was fantastic!  The service was great and the server was very attentive to our needs. The price was fair and the proportions were large in my opinion
We had the shrimp papaya salad, grilled squid, and the pad kee mao.

The shrimp papaya salad was amazing! they used large shrimps and the salad dressing was not too fishy or sour. We got a spicy level 4 and it was pretty spicy so unless you can handle eating spicy food i would recommend getting a 2 or 3 and add more chilly flake to your liking. 

The grilled squid was grilled to perfection. I the texture was not too chewy and not too soft. The dipping sauce that came with the squid was very good as well. I wasn't sure what  was in it but it worked well with the squid. This is a place that i feel can be shared among 3-4 people as for 2 people it was way too much squid.

The pad kee mao was good and flavorful we also ordered spicy level 4 and it was pretty spicy. I would however next time order this dish without baby corn.

over all great place service was kinda slow maybe we came late in the day. I definitely want come back to try their other dishes next time!

My family and I have been there twice already with a large party of about 9-11 and they always treated us with great service. No complains at all. Great food, great staff, and a VERY clean restaurant. Keep it up!
I recommend the catfish salad and shrimp pad thai

Did not enjoy the food at all. They also messed my delivery up, charged me for their error, and returned with poorly seasoned food that they rushed. They also asked for the item back which I had tried before realizing it was incorrect. Would never order here again.

After my most recent visit, I have decided it's a 5 starrer. Actually, it's mostly because of the Mango Salad. It is prepared like a traditional papaya salad, but in the place of the thinly sliced papaya, you get to devour mango. And, I think it is far superior to papaya. The thoughtfulness, creativity and cravability of this dish is a perfect representation of Weera. I have had numerous notable Thai standards, like the green curry, but they really stand out by always having a little twist on the standards that are equally, if not more, delicious.

Excellent food! The flavors here are exemplary and on point! The service for as busy has the place is has a urgency that ensures all guests are valued and attended to. If you haven't been here then the only the you need to consider is ....why haven't you been here and what are you waiting for????

the worse customer service ever , they're my neighbor and i order almost everyday and they never give me  a complimentary or free stuff , they have lunch special everyday from 11 am to 4 pm i called 5 times before 4 pm they didn't  answer the phone until the special is over and when they answered and i told them the situation they said nothing they can do,  as always , never go to that place anymore  my message to them is that customers always right so u can have successful business .

So many great dishes here (especially Issan delicacies). Hidden Vegas gem: Laos-style som tom/papaya salad (with delicious pungent preserved crab), but get it on the Laos platter... pickled cabbage, pork nem sausage, pork jerky, rice noodles, crispy pork skin chicharron, bean sprouts, bamboo and pork loaf.

My friend ordered take out from here, I didn't expect to eat anything but I did taste their shrimp spring rolls and crab sticks - which were actually really good! Taking a look at their take out menu they have decent prices and the average Thai specials. My favorite thing about this place is there very obvious name:
"WE-R- Thai" hahahaha good one.
Great food at a reasonable price. Will definitely return to this place on my next trip.

This place is my favorite Thai place that I found so far in the Vegas Valley. Prices are reasonable with the large portions they give you! The staff are very friendly and attentive. My top choices were the duck pad Thai, crab fried rice, seafood salad, and Penang curry!

Pink Thai Tea with milk ( Thai Iced Tea Pink Milk??? ) hands down the best Thai Tea that I have ever tasted!! It tasted like... Cotton candy Frap from Starbucks but.. So much yummier lol! The shrimp pad thai is good..especially the shrimp (big and juicy) And we also ordered the Weera Sampler plate... Yum yum yum !!!

I just ordered delivery food through Yelp eat24. I love how I can track what my status of food is at  I ordered papaya salad, tom yum soup, and pad thai which is bomb!!! Must try if you love Thai food!!

This is truly a hidden gem. I have driven by here a million times....past the run down strip mall...even knowing of the great reviews I always tell myself...LATER...BUT finally I stopped in for lunch with a friend who works down the street and I was very very impressed. Fresh Thai food with an attention to detail that is a step above Le Thai downtown....and corkage is $10...what more do you want....

My mister and I were craving Thai and our family ended up here in Weera Thai. What a pleasant experience! 

At first I was a bit nervous because my mom and the my 3 yo aren't fans of spicy foods and Thai food in general so I was hoping there was something in the menu that would make them happy. I ordered vegetable fried rice and wonton soup. The fried rice is excellent; not overly greasy and enough egg with perfectly cooked veggies. The wonton soup was a hit too. The broth was delicious and flavorful. Took note that those 2 will be ordered again in the future. I had the shrimp pad thai and hubby got the green curry with beef, both spicy #3 (medium). Fantastic, as expected! 

The excellent service made the whole experience a 4 star. For a Friday night, we got seated right away, waited about 10 minutes for our orders, and our drinks were always filled. We were disappointed they didn't have the mango with sticky rice, but understood that it's seasonal so we got the coconut ice cream instead (also delicious and my 3 yo devoured it in minutes). 

Can't wait to go back and try their other entrees!

We ordered the pad see ew beef and green curry chicken for 23 on a Saturday afternoon. We used the 10 for 20 groupon. Each dish was 10 

- Only one promo at a time. They have a 10% facebook check-in.
- Free thai tea ad? haha. you pay 3.50 for the thai tea, then you get unlimited refills. 
- Lots of egg with pad see ew! Loved it. 
- Kale too hard. cook it more.
- Small portions. For 10, not a deal. Good thing there's the groupon. 
- Green curry was great! eggplants were soft and delicious. right mix of coconut milk for the curry. medium is a perfect blend. 
- Small portion of rice. Just one scoop. 
- total came out to 19.58 but the remaining credit from the 20 is voided. 
- Great place for a coupon, but to come without one, I'd reconsider.

Aroy Maaak! (that means HELLA DELISH!)  

The Tom Yum was REALLY good, and I highly recommend the Larb Ped (Duck Salad)  I will be coming back again, and again, and again.  The cook is really nice too, he came out and personally checked up on us.  Great guy...

This used to be royal Thai then they changed management. This is right across the street from our job and used to frequent here. Ever since the change they must've also changed the quality of the meat. One word: HORRIBLE!!!!!! We refuse to eat here anymore!!! We gave it the benefit of the doubt we all ordered at least twice, ugh gross. Go down the street to Thai express.

As aficionados of Thai food around the country, and having given up on Archi's Thai in Las Vegas, we've been thrilled for the past year to frequent Weera Thai, and here is why:  The environment is charming & well designed, and the music is so unlike every other restaurant.  We can actually have a conversation!  The employees, from the chef to the wait staff, are wonderful people who truly care who came in to dine.  The menu is fantastic in its variety, and their specialty is duck.  For vegetarians, the tofu eggplant is divine & they will accommodate any appetite.  We love the chicken basil (or eggplant), Pad Thai shrimp, all of the curries, several duck specialties, mango salad & daily specials.  Weera also has happy hour 7 days a week which includes great drink prices & several appetizers.

BON APPETIT to you at Weera Thai!

K I K I
If you love Thai Food you gotta come here.  Chef specials are great.  Presentation is beautiful.  Decor is gorgeous.  Their sauce is the boss.  Weera Thai is the bomb .com y'all.  Come enjoy.
I really have liked weera but lately something is a miss from service to the food.   I did share my concerns with the manager so let's hope they get back on track.

My wife and I come here all the time.  We sit in our booth against the way.  We know the owners when the place was still called royal thai.  Greatest locals restaurant and down right good food.  We're there usually once if not twice a week.  Good price, good food, and most importantly, good customer service.

My favorite Thai place!  The staff is always attentive and fast. Food is so flavorful! You choose your spicy level from 1-5. There's happy hour everyday! Get the Pad Thai, you won't regret it! 


The parking is kinda tight, but there's street parking on the side of their plaza. The bathrooms are nice and clean.

Food is amazing place is beautiful!! but the service was HORRIBLE! I seriously wanted to get up and leave!! Yes we had two little kids, my baby nephew dropped his water on the floor by accident , we were very embarrassed by it, And we were apologizing.  But the waitress just came and dumped a lot of napkins on the table so we could clean it ourselves! WOW you would think they would have someone else come and mop it up. It was just water.  My sister in law whom is 9 months pregnant had to clean up.  We don't mind picking up after kids but never have I been to a F$&@ed up place like this that didn't care if it was a safety hazard for their other waiters!  Their staff were just terrible.  Even when we walked in Not a smile, we were seated quickly but waited like 10 mins before they took our order!  They need to have happier people working there seriously!! Ugh I will never go back.

Just had potentially the best Spicy Basil with Chicken Lunch special I've ever had.  This might not be a big deal to you, but this is MY ORDER at Thai restaurants.  It's the first thing I usually go for at a new place.  

Spiced 4 out of 5, it had the perfect amount of kick that I like without leaving me in tears.  

The best part of it goes along with something I mentioned in the previous review, with the chicken being of the sliced variety and not ground up like I'm used to.  Even though I love the version of this dish at Archis and Pin Kaow who do it ground up, I always wanted to find a place who did it well with nicely sliced pieces of chicken.  Many times the restaurants that attempt it leave you with chunks of fat on the chicken still intact, or the slicing job looks more like Leatherface from Texas Chainsaw got a hold of it and not the fine carving skills of Michael Myers.  To summarize:  THIS CHICKEN WAS RIGHT!

And I finally remembered to order brown rice!   Oh and the Egg Roll was fantastic.  

Hoping they can keep this up, they really earned this 5 stars today.

After searching for Thai food when I was in the area, I found this wonderful little Thai restaurant. We arrived and were seated quickly yet soon after it was packed with people waiting for a table. The menu is huge and has so many options that anyone could find something to eat here. We ordered the pad see ew, larb salad, Thai spring rolls, and red curry chicken. The minute my daughter tasted the red curry chicken she proclaimed "This is the best curry I've ever eaten." It was wonderful I'll admit. The Thai spring rolls were so fresh and crunchy that I only got to eat one as my 2 kids swarmed them. The pad see ew didn't disappoint as the Chinese broccoli was plentiful and the pork cooked to tender perfection. The larb I ordered with a spice level 3 and the flavor was amazing. What I love about Thai food is that unexpected matching of cool cucumbers with hearty ground chicken, spiced with peppers and cilantro. It's like comfort food with a kick. Don't let the exterior strip mall discourage you from trying this place. Once inside you'll find an upscale dining establishment with an attentive wait staff and insanely delicious food. The portions were huge and we enjoyed the leftovers for a few days after. If you like Thai food, you will love this place. I can't wait to go back and try the duck curry that our neighboring table raved about.

Amazing food!! Glass noodle salad best I've had! There's a little sweetness to their sauce which brings a more balance to the taste. Husband got the garlic pepper with crispy chicken. Husband enjoyed the dish. I also ordered the mussels with Thai spicy sauce, which was really good too and had a big kick, thanks to the Thai chilies. I know everyone raves about Lotus of Siam, but this place is hands down the best Thai food in Vegas! Although the restaurant was really busy, the staff was helpful and attentive.

OMG!!! this place is awesome. customer service is great and restaurant and bathroom is clean.....first and foremost i have never been a fan of crab Rangoon mostly being because its been ordered from fast food Chinese restaurants and is not homemade....well this place changed my mind...chunky fresh crab inside and thin homemade wanton YUM! the KHAO SOI soup was amazzzzzzzzzzzzzinnnnnngggggggg! had a duck dish in a traditional Thai sauce i am so sorry i forgot the name. but do not think twice about coming to this humble, cute little restaurant with amazing food

We took a party of 28 to Weera Thai to celebrate multiple birthdays.  It was excellent!  The food rivals Lotus of Siam and the service was amazing. They went above and beyond making us feel special and making sure we all were taken care of properly!  We will be back!

As with most Asian places, we love to order family style, getting several great dishes to share, and sometimes, we order too much, but then we get to take home the left overs and get to enjoy them all over again.

Today, we share the pad prik king with beef.  The green beans are still slightly crisp and the red chile paste is spicy good.  Next we get the sweet and sour pork, with the veggies cut in decent size wedges covered in a tangy sauce.  We then got the spicy eggplant with pork.  I love sweet thai basil.  Finally we got the pad thai noodle.  This is always one of our favorites and this one is up there with some of the best.

The food was very good, the service was excellent, worth a return trip.
Most of dishes are tasty and reasonable. Also service is good. We live in Henderson.Only problem is too far away.
Amazing happy hour!! It is hard to recommend something specific because everything we try is delicious, extensive menu that you will always be happy trying something new!
I was very pleased with the food (quality and taste).good service as well. The atmosphere is quite relaxing. I like!
Good food and good service. I am glad to live somewhere with good Thai food options again.  Warning the spice is on the mild side I asked for 5 the spiciest and barely tasted the heat...

After me and my wife decided to try something different. We checked this place out our initial impressions was it looked like a small hole in the wall kinda place however upon opening the door we we're pleasantly surprised with a super clean sleek looking place and friendly staff. To top it all the food was superb

Evidently there are only a couple of Thai restaurants in Vegas that have Khao Soi, so I had to seek them out. Weera us one of those, and I will definitely be back. The Khao Soi was really delicious, and even the presentation got a lot of attention. It looked, and tasted, like something really special, lots of flavor. I really loved it.   I do hope they'll bring back some Thai music to compliment the experience just because the top 40 radio racket was a bit loud and annoying, but if nothing else, I can do take-out next time. It is well worth a visit for both the food, and the service.  The staff were friendly and wonderful and wearing nice smiles like you see in Thailand itself, and also very attentive!
I really love Larb Ped n Spicy Seafood Salad too much :) it's so yummy!!! This is the second times for us. We gonna come back n take our friends with us next time :).

This has now taken the place as my fav Thai restuarant. I first went here because of Groupon. They were extremely polite and happy that I had the Groupon. It seems most places that sell them get mad about having to redeem them. 

I love the Panang. They also make it as spicy as I order it. Most Thai places take a look at my blonde hair and green eyes and I get a 1 on the spicy scale. I work with Thai people and I can eat hotter than hot. My husband always orders sweet and sour and it is delightful. It's not that sticky, sweet stuff. It has a light thin sauce. Delish. I haven't ordered the wine yet as we always go for lunch. I think I'll buy the deal and take my sister and family tomorrow.

Every time we come here it gets better. Ying was our server and is always sweet. I had the crispy duck panang, which was ridiculously good, the coconut and peanut sauce in the curry was just perfect. We also ordered the mango salad and shrimp on the happy hour menu. The crab fried rice would make your mama cry, it was that good. My wife got the pumpkin with curry, it had a nice bite to it.

Amazing food!! The chicken panang curry is good it's not too runny or too thick and so flavorful. The mango sticky rice dessert is a must try also. The mangoes are fresh and its almost a whole mango that comes with it.

Best Thai food in las vegas. Hands down. Stumbled across this place last Sunday. Have eaten there 3x since!! Haven't tried anything I haven't liked. Pineapple fries rice and the pad kai mow have been my favorites.
I have to give this place a 5 plus. Excellent customer service and everything are so good. Feel like you are in Thailand. Tom yum noodle was delicious.

Good food, exellent service and the
Price are so reasonable. We always come here for
Lunch.
very good thai style dishes - excellent customer service and a very good Yelp deal =] strongly recommended

IMO this is the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  They have dishes here made for Thais and not just for Americans with Thai taste.  Try the khao soi, chicken leg with curry sauce over noodles, can't find that any where in LV or Hoy Tod, mussels in tapioca batter with vegetable and sauce (my girlfriend's favorite).  Take it from a Thai.
One of the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas for lunch specials.  This was my first visit. Yummy. I got a free Thai iced tea (one of the best I have tasted). Reasonably priced as well.

Best thai beef noodle soup!! Okay, I've really only tried the one here and then at thai style noodle house...but this one wins hands down!  Small hole in the wall restaurant with very friendly service staff.  The thai beef noodle soup has a richer beef broth with a more savory flavor than the thai style noodle house version.  It also comes with a generous portion of beef balls/beef slices/tendon/tripe.  There is also the option of different noodles (egg/wide noodle/etc).  If you are a pho lover...try this thai style version...you will not be disappointed!

I loved it..... first time I tried their food just following yelp.
It's worth it. Deliciousssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssss
Weera has expanded and remodeled!! Well done and the food is still on point. Many papaya salads now. I enjoy my staple pad seew.

My mum and I came here with a Living Social coupon.  Our experience probably would have been better if I didn't have such high expectations, but it was still pretty good.  
The crab sticks ($8) we ordered didn't taste all that crabby.  The texture didn't resemble crab at all, and they had a pretty fishy flavor.  I would not order them again.
Beef Pad See Ew ($9)  was pretty standard.  I forgot to ask them to make it without sugar (most Thai places go overboard), and was pleasantly surprised when it came out just the right amount of sweet.  
What I really wanted to try here was the steamed sea bass, and that was actually better than I expected.  They have 3 varieties ($16 each).  1. Rice powder/chili/lime 2. Spicy sauce 3. Ginger.  The server recommended the spicy sauce one, so we went for it.  It came out in a soup bowl.  There was a very generous amount of broth, veggies, and the bass fillet on top.  The fish was super juicy, and flaky.  The broth was really tart, and delicious.  Perfect over rice.  
There was a lot of confusion when the check came.  That was a little annoying, especially since the restaurant was nearly empty.  The girl that brought the check forgot that we had a coupon, as did the girl we initially gave it to.  They reprinted it, but the amount was still wrong.  They reprinted it again, and we were finally able to pay.  
A-ok just about sums up the experience in general, but I will be back for more sea bass.

Delicious!!! Careful here. Food so good you will forget to stop eating.  Hahaha!! Seriously authentic taste, great service and priced right. Been here twice now and food is excellent. They have some great seafood dishes. Penang curry is awesome. Just be careful. 1-5 on the hot scale so it can sneak up on you. But still delicious. Papaya salad was smokin at number two. Might pay a little later but to good to stop now. Mmmmmm!

This is the 5th time I've eaten here. Never a terrible experience until today. Order was wrong and even the rice was terrible. How do you funk up the rice??? Really!! Veggie Panang please, Spicy #4. Tofu Panang for baby mouths is what I got with an egg roll that's consistency was questionable. Perhaps it was an off day so I will give them another shot but like most restaurants in Vegas once they get a good following, the service and quality become marginal at best. Is this a precursor for a dirty dining cameo? I hope not. Time will tell for sure.

This was my first Thai experience and I've gotta say it was great! Pulling up to the restraunt I was a little sketched with the look of the plaza but once coming inside I quickly realized how clean and elegant looking it was, although this is a casual place. Service was great! They sat us, greeted us, served us and cashed us out very quickly! Very impressed with this place. I ordered a Thai Iced Tea which was delicious! The food was super fresh, and very flavorful. The Shrimp Spring Rolls were great for an appetizer (pictured below). I ordered the Spicy Shrimp Salad for an entree from the happy hour menu..although it was a little small it was delicious as the shrimp was very tender.

This place has remodeled since the last time we were here. Interior is modern and spacious now.
Food was good. They have a happy hour menu. Service was mediocre. We asked for a booster seat 3 times for our toddler and they never came back with one so we gave up on it. Didn't see smiles on any of the staff's face during the visit. This was prior to us asking for a booster seat/high chair. Perhaps we came on a bad day.
Food was EXCELLENT. Best food I have had since I been in Vegas. Food had GREAT flavor, service was EXCELLENT.   Reservations are recommended we were lucky to get in.
Yummy loas/thai food! friendly service! I love their duck nam tok (duck salad) soooo good. Would recommend this place!

so this is an update to my first review and same order. I had ordered the sticky rice as well and when I was eating it, I found a straight white hair in the middle of the sticky rice. I know its not mine or anyone who lives here because it was straight stuck in the middle like it was cooked into it. so gross!

Updates: Weera Thai will be closed for a couple of weeks from 2/29/2016 - 3/15/2016. They are renovating and making the restaurant bigger. Congratulations Weera! 

As my friends and I visited again a couple of days ago, customers came in nonstop. Every time we come to Vegas...we always have to stop at Weera for some awesome Thai food. 

They have this awesome happy menu (every night), that has cheap beer and appetizers. The Issan (Northeastern Thai) food is so good. If you like it hot and spicy...make sure you let them know. 

Never a disappointing stop. Weera is 3 miles or so from the strip. See you on my next trip back to Vegas from LA. Love your service as well....

Alloy!  Always delicious food.  Yai always gets her Guay Tiew soup but I always switch it up!  Today I had Beef Panang and of course it was amazing.  Nobody in Las Vegas does it quite like this place.  Nobody can even compare to the service and hospitality of the staff.  Free thai tea with check in!  I'm here at least once a month and never noticed the check in before but so glad I saw it today.  We came during lunch rush on memorial day and service was still quick and friendly.  I can't say enough good things about Weera Thai
Food are beyond excellence at this place. Great customer service. I love to come here again when i get back to vegas

Great food and even better service!! Recommend the Thai beef salad and yellow curry. The staff here is wonderful and always and helpful. The also make a great mango sangria. All around a great place to eat.

OMGGGGG. If you're trying to decide where to eat, LOOK NO FURTHER. This is where you are eating tonight !!! IT IS SOOOOOOOOOO so so GOOD. Everything. Best Thai , I've ever had and we've had Thai in Thailand . Hahaha do yourself a favor and eat here. So yummy!!! Will definitely be here again and again!

People gave this place great reviews but I just don't see it? Came in during happy hour which had plenty of choices for cheap like the Papaya salad for $6. Not bad at all. Our orders were just the usual orders so we weren't blown away. Everything was good except the Pad Thai noodle seemed to be over cooked ? The texture of the noodle was like melting already in your mouth, meaning it wasnt thick. Gladly the Crab fried rice wasn't bad, I enjoyed that entree. 

The dining area is very clean and the bathrooms as well so that's a good sign. Lastly the service needs some work. The guy server was doing a great job, but the ladies weren't. I shouldn't have to say "Thank you" while leaving the restaurant when you are staring at us, and not say it back.

Excellent!! I've been searching for a delicious authentic Thai restaurant and I have found it. I went based on other reviews and all I gotta say is: they're all true! I was fortunate enough to come at the right time and order the lunch special. The pad thai was excellent. The menu had a lot of seafood too. I'm looking forward to going back!
Best Thai in Vegas. Yellow curry with chicken is phenomenal and the staff is always friendly! They also have really great deals for lunch; a lot of food for a great price!

My wife is Thai and cooks amazing Thai food at home. This is basically the only Thai restaurant that she is willing to go to, even though there are several options that are closer. That might be all you need to know.

Huge menu with an entire page dedicated to Northern Thai Isaan food. Very spicy. Prices are a bit steep but portions are big. For four people, price came out to $85 with tip, no dessert.
Delicious food with large servings. We stopped on our way home from Utah to San Diego recommended from our friend. Pad Thai noodles did not disappoint.

Had yellow curry with tofu and pad see yew with tofu. 
Pad see yew was awesome
Yellow curry had really nice flavoring. My only complaint was the veggie to curry ratio was way off. I couldn't eat it with rice, otherwise the curry sauce would have been gone after 5 bites. 
Tofu was cooked nicely. 

Will still come back again.
I have eaten Thai food for many years and this is the best Thai food in Las Vegas and they deliver I'm in trouble

Came here today to eat--as I saw it when we tried the bar next door the night before. The menu selection was great and many of the dishes are from northern Thailand and then they have a section of southern Thailand. I loved the variety offered and I loved that they offered blue crab as a meat. I'm a huge fan of pumpkin and tried their pumpkin curry--I was disappointed that the pumpkin was undercooked and extremely hard. But the flavor of the curry was great. The tomato soup was extremely flavorful! The pad Thai was also really great. Good service, friendly people. I'd come back again-for sure. Just took a star away for the undercooked pumpkin.

Every Thai restaurant needs to prove their worth with Tom Ka Gai. They did here and it was great. Will be back to try more delicious foods. A must visit.

Yum yum.

Five stars from farang!
Very good Thai food!  The beef basil was really good and full of flavors.  They can make their foods very spicy as well.  Very good portions as well.
Delicious food amazing, personable service. Pumpkin curry with chicken... to die for.

This is my second time coming here. First time I guess there was some misunderstanding and they gave us our bill before our main course arrived. Second time I came during happy hour so it was expected to be a little busier. 

Food and quality was good. The yellow curry pad see ew lacked a little bit of flavor. Basil wings could have been a little bit crispier and the beef salad and tom yum soup was very flavorful. I did enjoy the duck larb and pad thai I had the first time I came. Will be back again for sure.

The portions here were huge! Came here for a bachelorette dinner! Staff was friendly and food was quick. Curry and Pad See Ewe was amazing!!! When I am back in vegas I will definitely come here again. Food was priced just right also. I loved it.
Ok my friend and i went again, this time grabbing another friend and we LOVED it. Even with my 2 lil boys we all ate a whole lot and i love the fresh vegetables. Can't wait to try something else new.

Been here two times so far. Once for lunch and more recently for dinner. Both times were very good experiences. For dinner, I came here with a group of friends and we gots places to share among us. We got the spicy eggplant, Panang curry, pineapple fried rice, and the pad sew ew. We were there during happy hour so we got $2 Thai tea... It came in a cute mason jar :) the Panang curry was very good ... It had a strong hint of coconut and the curry was spicy. I liked the flavor of the spicy eggplant but I wished it was just a tad bit more. The pad sew ew was really good. The noodles did stick or clump together like some places I've been to. And the pineapple fried rice was a hit as well. The raisins added a nice sweet touch to the dish. We ended with the durian with sweet sticky rice. I love durian so I love this dish.

Love this little gem of a restaurant on W. Sahara!  Inside is welcoming and neatly decorated.  We went last Friday and sat at the bar..very nice area and seating. Our bartender was great, friendly and gave us 'our own private time' in good measure.  Food fantastic.  We had spring Tofu rolls and Papaya salad, no meat.  Delicious!  My guy  had a beef and gobbled every bite of it.  I say it is well worth trying!

waiting for an hour, still no food
they are not organize for food comes out one at a time, each meal is 5-10 minutes apart

We really enjoyed this place!!! We found it through Yelp and the reviews were right on the money!!! The Pad Se Ew was off the hook and so was there Spicy Eggplant!!! Fresh ingredients and quality as well... Would highly recommend it too anyone!!!

I think this place is promising. Only tried two dishes with my friend, but I liked our duck order. We did manage to have some communication error (though I'm not sure on whose fault because it might be the lack of English skills on part of the waitress, but it doesn't matter at this time) with an order, but they fixed that for us.

We ordered L5. Pad Kee Mow with beef (flat wide rice noodles stir-fried w/ mint, chili, tomatoes, & Thai spices) and I liked the noodles. Eventually, I was just grabbing the noodles to eat. Beef was good, too.

Our second order was T2. Ped Nom Tok (sliced boneless roasted duck homemad w/ chili pastte, herbs, spices, & lime juice). I couldn't tell that it was duck but it was yummy in a weird way? It was the sauces and spice and everything nice on it, I suppose? Haha. I would order it again, at least :b.

I will definitely be back in on a future visit to try their other dishes. I would like to try some more of fellow yelpers' recommendations :).

Foods was little on sweet side and too much fish sauce. After dinner we woke up at midnight to drink glass of water. 
Don't order their ice cream , it's makes from different ingredients,  after you ate. Got stomach ache. 
Service is average...

My Thai  friend recommended this place so I checked it out the presentation of the food was great. The portion was big. We ordered a seafoodhot pot , papaya salad, pad se ew, pok choy with fried pork, and fried fish dish (cant remember what it is called) for 5 people. The bill was $77 not including tip. Good price.

Omg! Spicy beef salad is the Bomb! 
First time for delivery, took an hour on Saturday night, but worth the wait! Delivery man was super nice and polite
Now I'm going to try the duck curry and finish up my review in a bit! 
Delicious!!!!

Any place that offers a free Thai tea on Yelp check in is alright by me! So this place started off on a good note, and they were even willing to have it cover the Thai coffee as well with the check in. 
The food was pretty good. The spice levels seemed on point for what you would expect although, thankfully, the burn didn't linger. The only complain was the staff lacked any hospitality. They weren't rude or anything, they just weren't friendly either. It was strictly business.

This place is AMAZING!!!!! Its so hard to find authentic thai restaurant. The portions are huge and the prices are reasonable. Service was great!! The waitress was very cute and nice. I'd recommend this place to everyone :)

I finally broke down and ordered lunch from here with my co-workers--what a pleasant surprise! I had the broccoli with oyster sauce. The portions were perfect and it was very flavorful! I will def order again.

When my husband and I moved here we went to many Thai restaurants and this is our favorite. Their Thai Teas are great and the food has never let us down. We usually get the  Massa man Curry, Thai egg rolls, and Pad Prik King. The flavors are good, they are accommodating to personalization, prompt on checking on you, and super friendly.

We always had the same waitress at the beginning and she knew our order and the ladies there always would say hi and play with our young son if it wasn't crowded. I have taken friends there almost every time they come to town and they all enjoyed it too.

I love the most here is Som-Tum papaya salad. It's authentic and this is only a place in town that you can find the selection of Som-Tum. If you like Thai papaya salad it's definitely a place for you. Service is good. Decent I will say. Food serve really quick. atmosphere and decor is great. When I have guest in town and want Thai food. This is the first place I would think of.
Nice place. .good service good food at very reasonable prices. Absolutely nothing to complain about.
Authentic Thai isann. A little expensive but not too bad. Try catfish salad, you will never want to eat catfish any other way ever again.

BOMB BOMB BOMB. Their food was delicious! So many choices and you just know that whatever you order is gonna be super yummh. My only complaints are that it was stuffy and hot in the restaurant, and when they bagged up our food to takeout, they didn't give us all our food.

Delicious....inviting....clean....pretty....the best!

This place looks like a hole in the wall at a divey Vegas strip mall at first glance, but it is truly a gem you would be lucky discover. We search for great Thai restaurants on our travels and have found none anywhere in the country more exceptional than Weera Thai in Las Vegas.

The noodle dishes, rice dishes, and appetizers at Weera Thai are consistently cooked to perfection and delicious. I am one of those rare birds who orders pad Thai noodles mild and they have been superbly flavorful without being spicy every time I have had them from Weera Thai. Their fresh rolls are the BEST and live up to their title. They are rolled with the perfect amount of fresh mint, fresh vegetables, good protein, and the peanut sauce is NOMZ. /drool

A matter not oft mentioned in restaurant reviews is that of cleanliness, particularly for restrooms. If you have read our other reviews, you know nothing outranks cleanliness in importance for us. (Fact: the rating of an otherwise outstanding business plummets if their restrooms are scummy.) As if the quality, ambiance, and service were not all A+ grade, Weera Thai is also tops in cleanliness - for the dining area, flatware, visible kitchen area, and restrooms. The restrooms appear either recently remodeled or just impeccably maintained. They are well lit, well ventilated, tastefully decorated, and sparkling clean (see photos).

The glassware, too, is sparkling clean. They seem to use filtered water because the ice water you receive at Weera Thai is far better than standard gross Las Vegas tap water. 

The service at Weera Thai has been outstanding on each of our visits there. Employees are pleasant and seem to take tremendous pride in serving customers. 

If you crave great Thai, you will not be disappointed here.

OK, this is a tough choice for star ratings. I've gone a couple times here, once for lunch and once for dinner (just missed happy hour by 4 minutes and didn't get the benefit of the doubt on pricing).  My Thai friend wanted to eat here because they featured an Issan menu which is where she is from. 

Why the dilemma in star rating? Well, the restaurant is clean, looks like its got new flooring, tables and chairs, and nicely decorated even though its in a run down strip mall just south of Decatur on Sahara. Parking can be kind of tight.

The service for our two visits was exceptional. Seated quickly, waters brought immediately, drink orders taken within 5 minutes. Food comes quickly too. 

Food, this is where is becomes a bit muddled for me. First time I had the Chicken Pad Thai lunch special ($7.95). Comes with a salad and soup. The presentation isn't as nice as Naga Thai in Henderson. The soup is nothing special at all and the salad basic but larger. The pad thai was delicious with plenty of peanuts off to the side along with other condiments. 4/5

For dinner I had Pork Pad See Ewe (sorry my spelling sucks). Good sized portion, but like only 3 mini stalks of chinese broccoli. Wasn't the best I've had and this is one of my staple thai orders so a little disappointed. 3/5
Crab rangoon appetisers were really good, loaded with cream cheese and not so much crab but the wrapper is light and crunchy. Very good 4.5/5

My Thai friend ordered Larb Ped and Papaya Salad at lunch, and Duck Bone Soup and Beef Stew Noodle Soup for dinner, She gave them medium reviews as they weren't spicy enough for her Issan tastebuds except the Papaya Salad. I sampled the Beef Stew Noodle soup and it tasted like Thai Pho, It was good for me because it wasn't spicy. The Duck Bone Soup fired me up with just a taste of the broth. I don't like spicy food though. 

Overall, somewhere around a 3.8 star rating. I'd go back for the service and cleanliness of the restaurant, just at happy hour to take advantage of some better pricing. Wednesdays from 4-10pm is Singha beer specials, one of my favorites.

Supachai was awesome. Very knowledgeable and our service was great. I love the team efforts when cleaning tables and checking on guests. As a server that speaks volumes for this company! Our food was phenomenal and oh so tastey! We will be back!!! LOOOOVED IT!

Best Thai in town! The staff is great, fast service, great for big groups, good alcohol selection, and the food is to die for! The catfish salad has the best crunch with a fresh Apple, cilantro, onion, and peanut dressing it is the best pairing for any meal!
Best Thai food by far! Great service, great prices, amazing food. The curry is incredible. This is our spot for sure!

A bit disappointed as they did not give me a "wow" effect! I don't feel like I have to be back if I am in town.

We ordered papaya salad and a crab wonton as appetizer. The papaya salad was ok, but spicy! The wonton was not something we liked as it has cheese in it (seemed Americanized). 

We ordered larb and kao soy noodles as the main course. I was surprised that they have lots of Thai street food here. The kao soy was not as spicy as what I expected. The broth was not as strong.

The larb was just ok.

They offered free Thai ice tea with check-in.
Great, authentic Northeastern Thai Food! Careful on the spiciness! Yes, they do have a great Khao Soi!

This restaurant is AMAZING!  I have been here several times in the past two years, each time the meal is an experience in different flavors.  I've had the lunch special which is Mon.- Fri., 3 times, as well as eaten off the menu.  The eggplant with chicken is phenomenal!!

Can't say enough about this restaurant, I drive across town regularly to go here!  Give it a go...very worth every cent and time spent to get here!!

Okay, so we've been here twice. Once for dinner, which was amazing; once for lunch which was so-so. For dinner we had the massaman curry, pad thai, a duck dish, and the fresh veggie spring rolls. Everything was rich, flavorful, delicious, like no other Thai restaurant I've been to in Vegas! The flavors were delicious and unique. After coming here for dinner, I was sold on this place. Thinking of how delicious this place was for an entire week, we returned here again on a Sunday for a lunch special. We ordered the red curry lunch special and the black peppered chicken which comes with a fried spring roll, salad, and a little soup. We also ordered the fresh veggie spring rolls. I wasn't a fan of anything we ordered. Everything tasted light and watered down. The black peppered chicken was far from palatable. The fresh veggie spring rolls tasted ordinary. We were disappointed, but I am sure we will go back again and try this place again. (by "we", I am referring to my epicurious alter ego that lives within...or... more likely, my awesome foodie fiancée)

WOW!!! We just happened to have stumbled on this place one day after receiving a flyer in the mail. What an amazing surprise!!  I am so addicted to their curry, the taste of everything we had tried is so authentic and yummy!!! It is now one of our favorite places to go!!  They have Happy Hour specials that are amazing!!!  They also offer Take-Out!!  and Delivery!!!!!

Was in town for the weekend with my husband and kids. My husband and I decided we wanted Thai food so I hopped on Yelp and ordered from Weera Thai for delivery to our hotel on a Saturday evening. Delivery took a bit long but it's Vegas so I expected that. The food was great. We both had the Pad Thai and I ordered egg rolls and veggie fried rice on the side. I had the Thai Iced Tea; good balance. Overall we were both happy with our decision to order in!

I have ordered delivery from here several times, and am delighted every single time by EARLY DELIVERY and DELICIOUS HOT food. Tonight I also received a free Thai ice tea, which will be now a regular addition to my orders. Fabulous, delectable and satisfying.

We were looking for some good Thai food around the area and this has a 4.5 stars, so we decided to give it a try and thankfully it was a right choice.  The indoor decorations were cute and the food were delicious.  My friend loves spicy food so she got a 3 out of 5 which was too spicy for me.  I think a 2 would be great for the not too spicy lovers out there.
Real traditional Thai food!!! Love it ! You also get Thai beer Singha and Chang!!! It's upscale compared to other Thai restaurants in the area!!

Love this place! The coconut milk soup us THE BOMB! It'll bring you back from death! And the green curry to die for. Excellent taste, very intense and fragrant and although the space is small, it's still not crowded and rather comfortable. 

I wish the waiters spoke a little more clear, but I guess that's what makes this place truly Thai!

Tom Kah Kai was amazing!  Pepper Garlic chicken, Ginger chicken...drool.  First experience with this place and we were all thoroughly impressed.  We ordered late night takeout just before midnight.   Everything was nicely packed in a brown bag and all the entrees were individually wrapped with plastic bags outside their respective containers.

  Guy with an apron greeted me outside when I arrived and said they were waiting for me, then he opened the door for me.  On my wait out I asked the guy if he made the food and he said "yeah, we make", then I pointed at him and said "did you make it?" And he said "Yeah, we make."  I thanked him, smiled and drove away.
Best Thai in Las Vegas.  I order from Grub Hub, and also go into the location.  It is clean and beautiful inside.  They make you feel at home right away.
Food is decent, but would like my food spicier. Great lunch specials. Not worth going out of your way for, but if you're in the area stop for a quick bite.

This place has great Thai food but the service is defiantly not the best. A new girl made my Thai tea with hella cream no tea. Shit was like drinking milk . After I ate my food, which was after happy hour! I told my server that the tea was horrible. They told me to remake it, it would be 3 dollars . I spend at least 30 or 50 dollars here every other week. This is so messed up on many levels ! I will be complaining to owner ...if not resolved I will never ever return .

This is a great place. I'm visiting from the SF Bay Area and it's as good as any Thai place there. The food came quickly, brought by an attentive waitress. Not only was she attentive, she made sure we got the right heat on our dishes. Between the two of us is we tried 4 entries and 8 apps.
I liked the food so much we were there twice. Don't miss this place!!

so good! Delicious food, attentive, friendly service and low prices.

the room is beautiful but I hardly looked up from my plate because I enjoyed the food so much.

Ordered... calamari (side sauce ), papaya spring rolls, and papaya salad. Krys ordered Sukiyaki, Kim ordered Panag (red curry w chicken) and I ordered Pepper   garlic chicken and shrimp (level 2 out of 5 for me Great Thai food

If you want to go to the best Thai restaurant in town, you've found it. Not only the food is outstanding, at least for me as important, the friendly attitude of everyone makes this restaurant my new favorite! Goodbye Lotus of Siam and your overrated prices, hello Waaza!!!

I went there last night and for some reason I don't feel like the food is as good as it used to be. Could it be that maybe the chef has changed? The one thing that I do get that I always like there are the crab Rangoon's and the green curry. Still the best Thai food around though!

This Thai restaurant has the BEST Laos style papaya salad in Vegas. I believe it's priced at $12, I'm not too sure, which can be "expensive" for some but you're definitely getting your pennies worth. Restaurant hours can be busy from time to time, you can always make reservation or order ahead of time and eat at the restaurant.

Everything on the menu is good. I've had their Tom yum and boat noodle soup, seafood hot pot, rice dish, etc., and everything is bomb. If you love wine and beer, they offer varieties of red/white/cocktail, etc., at the bar! They also have good selections on their happy hour menu! I love coming here, it's one of my favorite Thai spots.

THIS MY GO TO THAI!! sweet staff GREAT FOOD. They have the best Tom Yum soup in Vegas. They have great prices too. I get Larb, woon sen noodles, Tom Yum and those are my main dishes. THEY HAVE AMAZING HOMEMADE ICE CREAM TOO. Try the ice cream at least once! Love this place. I come at least once every two weeks.

Weera Thai is a wonderful Thai restaurant located in a section of commercial strip malls on West Sahara Ave that have seen better days.  I have been to Weera Thai a few times in the past year for dinner and most recently for lunch.  After trying out their regular menu and also one of their lunch specials, I personally think that you get more value ordering from their non-lunch specials menu, even if it is before 3pm during their lunch special promotion hours.  

So don't be cheap and walk out becuase your party came in 2 minutes past the lunch specials promotion period. The $2-3 extra you pay for each entree will defintiely get you much more food, in spite of the trade off of not getting the cup of house soup, fried egg roll and a lunch side salad (all are rather unimpressive). 

The staff have always been friendly, and deliver the prepared dishes shortly after it was cooked with care in the kitchen.  Their Green Curry is bomb.  Their Spicy Glass Noodle Salad is healthy and delicious, and can easily substitute as an entree or be shared as an appetizer salad.  The Pad See Ew is one of the best I have tried in all of Las Vegas. If you enjoy having duck, their Slice Duck (Weera Thai Style) will not disappoint.  The Thai Fish Cakes appetizer is generous and good.   The Spicy Thai Sweet Basil made with Beef lunch special was just okay at best, maybe it is better prepared with anything but beef, but it was definitely my least favorite item that I have tried at this cool restaurant.

If you have room in your tummy after your meal, consider getting their Durian over Warm Sticky Rice (assuming you do not have an Andrew Zimmern aversion to this pungent fruit).  Otherwise, get their Mango Sticky Rice during the summer, when mangos are in season.

After reading Yuhi K's review, I must remember to order the Coconut Water served in a young coconut, instead of the common Thai Iced Tea or Thai Iced Coffee, on my future visits.  And try one of the Steamed Sea Bass as recommended by Arvin when I am in the mode for fish.  When winter finally arrives, definitely going to have to try their Thai Beef Noodle Soup, the best of Las Vegas according to Theresa C.

Ambiance: 3.5/5.  Comfortable dining environment with Thai decorations and even a small television showing Thai programming featuring what appears to be a Thai food channel.  On the larger flat panel TV on the right side of the restaurant, it is usually on FoodTV or one of the professional sports games.  But the audio entertainment is provided by Sirius Radio's POP stations.

Service:  4/5.  Freindly, attentive. No complaints.

Food:  4/5.  Again, you pay slightly more but also get great value when ordering from their regular menu san the lunch specials.

Parking:  4/5.  Usually it is not a problem finding parking.

Location:  Fairly close to the Sahara exit on the I-15, so perfect if you are staying at Palace Station down the street.  Otherwise, easily accessible in a centrally convenient location for most resident of Las Vegas.

4 Stars. A no brainer.  

Side note:  The restaurant is aggressively promoting itself online, so you can usually find check-in offers (via Yelp get 10% off your bill), or promotions like Yelp Deals and occasional promotions from other competitors. Just tip on the pre-discounted price of your meal.
This is a hidden Gem!  The Menu is excellent great prices.  The service was awesome.  Great prices.  For all travelers get away from the strip for the day and enjoy good food

love weera great service and food. We eat there twice a week!!! $1 thai tea lunch specialt!! beautiful servers with a big smile when they see you. The Pad thai to die for yummy. just writing this commet makes me hungry. oopss its sunday time for Weera.. satay chicken the best.  Thai fried rice tofu meat yummy!! lets go lunch time!!!
I've been here a few times now. Their food and service have been consistently good and they have the best fresh spring rolls! Even my picky boyfriend left happy!

I almost passed on Weera, ironically, because it was offering a Yelp Deal. I assumed any business promoting itself so enthusiastically can't be that great. But then I drove past and saw that it serves Issan food and I though hmm, got to check it out.

As a lone diner I had just two dishes, the Issan green papaya salad (on the Issan menu, not to be confused with the "regular" papaya salad; the difference is extra fish sauce and an additional level of heat) and the Ped Nom Tak (duck.)  I asked for 4 of 5 on the spiciness scale and the chile in the papaya had me acting like a rat in a lab experiment, shocking myself again and again because I was so desperate for another bite. It was also a great value at $6.95 and I finished every last sliver.

The duck was the opposite, thank god, unctuous fork size bits of breast in a mysterious brown gravy. There was mint and garlic and what looked like ground rice but must have been crack, it was that good. Again, this lone diner finished the whole thing. Both the salad and the duck had a stack of squares of cabbage leaf in the corner of the plate, I assumed to use as a serving implement, but I needed something to soak up the heat and sop up the duck gravy so I ordered the sticky rice, a nice accompaniment.

This is a simple but pleasantly decorated restaurant with tablecloths under glass like a hundred other mom-and-pop Asian places you have visited. The service was attentive and friendly (though they had some trouble with the Yelp coupon, so pay attention to the bill). I was lucky enough to talk to the owner afterward and told him how happy he had made me. He was interested that I was in town for CES and hoped to get some more show-goers down his way. Since this was the last night of this year's show, he will have to wait for another day. I thought about those folks waiting 2 hours for a table down the street at Lotus. Their loss.

UPDATE: Yelp contacted me asking me to specifically write about my experience with the Yelp deal. It was okay. I have the Yelp app on my Droid X and was able to access the deal there and show it to the server. She copied down the code number and asked me to mark the deal as "used" while she was watching which I did. Then the $20 discount initially did not show up on my tab and they had to rerun it which they did... simple miscommunication at the cash register. Bottom line, I think the Yelp deal worked fine and I'd happily use one again.
Food still excellent , Peter still gave us the warm greeting like always . Personal touch is alway appreciate . Thanks for give us a place to enjoy .

I was very impressed the first time I dined at this restaurant. I found it to be a very elegant restaurant, very modern, and good vibes. I ordered seafood and I was very impressed with how fresh it was! The food was very fresh as well, the first time I dined in. The second time I dined in, I noticed that the vegetables were not as fresh and the service was not as good. It is still a good place if you're looking for a good dine-in and not paying $$$.

I love Thai food, but never knew it could be this good. My cousin knows all the great spots for good food in Vegas, and this did  not disappoint. Tom Kha was the best ever. The red curry was really good, the pineapple fried rice and larb was as expected. But the winner was the coconut shrimp served on a bed of salad with green apples. And the chicken and mint dish. It was ground chicken and so good. 

I truly wish I could have stayed and eaten more and more and more the flavors were so pleasant.

This place is super cute on the inside and has an Asian ambience. It was my first time coming here with a couple of friends. We all went for lunch specials since it was lunch time and it was really cheap for the amount of food that was served. 

A bonus was if you check in you get a free Thai tea. Everything was really good. I really liked how the soup that was given with the lunch special was a ton Kha instead of the traditional should rust are usually given with lunch specials at different Thai restaurants.

I ordered the chicken pad ka pow. It was really yummy and it came with an egg roll, soup, and a salad. I loved the dressing of the salad and actually finished it which I was surprised because I never really finish salads when they come with any lunch specials I order. My friend got the tom Kha with noodles and it was huge. We were able to share our food which was great. My other friend got the panang chicken and that was really good too. 

Overall, everything we ordered turned out to be really great. The service was great and they were able to split our checks with no problem. I will be coming back in the future maybe for happy hour next time!
